description:
Possibly the best Thai food in SF.  Small hole in the wall place,  CASH ONLY.  Authentic Thai.

Amazing Pad Thai, and everything else is 5 Star food.  No lunch menu, and not necessarily cheap.  However, huge portions and top quality fresh everything.  Anybody who gives this place less than 4 Stars doesnt know what they are talking about.

A top destination for great food; a hidden gem.
author: Joe S.

description:
Only had take out (ordered ahead on Yelp) from here so far but overall it was delicious. 

Really enjoyed the Tom Kha Gai Soup, Gang Panang Curry, and the Guay Tiew Moo Look Chin Pia Soup with small rice noodle (though might try it with vermicelli next time).

There wasn't an explicit way to specify spice level but things were mostly fairly mild with just a hint of heat, which was nice. The Tom Kha Gai was the spiciest thing we got, which was awesome, I feel like I've only ever had Tom kha without _any_ spice before but now I'm always going to get it this way.
author: Ely L.

description:
King's Thai Cuisine #1 will always have a special place in my heart since it was one of the first Thai restaurants I've eaten at. I was born around the area and my parents would take me here whenever they had a craving for Thai food. 

The reason why my rating isn't a 5 is because the pad Thai here doesn't taste as good as I remembered it to be many years ago. 

I came here with my father and younger sister after they picked me up from the airport. We ordered a couple of #4s, a kind of beef noodles soup, and a tofu and veggie pad Thai. 

The noodle soups taste pretty much the same as I remember-- beefy, rich and slightly spicy. However, the pad Thai just was a bit bland. 

I remember liking the green curry, so maybe I'll opt for that the next time I visit!
author: Emily C.

description:
People are getting the other location of this restaurant on Clement, which is called King's Thai Noodles #2, confused with this place, which is KTN #1.  This is the smaller, simpler location closer to 8th St. that has the purple storefront and, although VERY basic interior (e.g., fluorescent lighting), has WAY WAY better food, better prices and much nicer servers than the other, fancier location -- which is down the street near 4th St and has terrible food and service (see my review there and other reviews). 

If you don't mind the casual interior you will have a much better eating experience at King's Thai Noodles #1.  It's hard to believe the two restaurants are related, they are world's apart in quality.

Unfortunately, #1's overall rating is much lower than it should be because people are getting the two confused and giving low stars to this one when it should be for location #2.  Double-check you got the right location when leaving a review!
author: Merrick W.

description: Great late-nite 'hole in the wall' authentic SF Thai cuisine. Beats the more frilly trendy Thai spot up the block on Clement. Anthony Bourdain woulda come here  #RIP. Only thing missing is a nice cold beer to accompany my go to dish- Veggie Pad See Ew (fresh chinese broccoli, bok choy, carrots, egg, Tofu) with the chilli sauce. Bon Appétit!!
author: Laura S.

description: I became addicted to King Thai on Clement about 6 years ago, back when they only took cash as payment. My favorite dish in this place is duck over rice with spicy soy sauce, the place makes duck in a fabulous way, plain, delicious, minimalistic, just the way I love it. This place is not perfect but very consistent, it will be delicious every time, if you are ordering a delivery - make sure you specify every detail about your order the way you like it or somewhere, something will be misplaced. My new addiction - fresh spring rolls! Try them but be careful as it's an addiction that's hard to shake off ))
author: Erast B.

description: Ate lunch here weekday. Street meter parking $2.25 /hour. Pad Kee Mao and Beef noodle soup. Tastes authentic. Decor in Thai and picture of old king /queen. Food tasty but maybe less sugar seasoning for me
author: Clifford W.

description:
Chicken Satay with peanut sauce = delicious!
Peanut Sauce = delicious!

Pad See Lew = bland
Gai Pad Med Ma-Muang = decent, not a dish I would get a second time.

We had to dump the remaining peanut sauce on the Pad See Lew to give it more flavor since it was just very bland. 

Overall this place was ok, but if I tried it again I would ask for extra peanut sauce and try something *spicy* to get more flavor.
author: Larissa S.

description:
Your standard, typical, hole-in-the-wall Thai place. Definitely more take-out/delivery than sit-down restaurant. The prices are on the cheaper side but that means the portions are on the smaller side as well.

- Duck Noodle Soup: slices of roast duck on your choice of noodles. I went with the thin rice noodles and it was a good combination. Definitely on the saltier/soy sauce-heavy side but I just wanted the duck so it worked out. It supposedly came with vegetables...... but that was questionable.
- Green Curry: boy says it was solid!
- Thai ice tea: always on the sweeter side, but what else would you expect.

Good if in a pinch (and for those late night hours) but definitely would not be anyone's first choice lol
author: Lucy Z.

description: My favorite Thai restaurant, I often order roast duck  noodles soup here, and the soup made here is really tasty. This restaurant, which requires cash payments, is small but is better and more affordable than king of Thai 2, which is two blocks away. High Recommend
author: Yingying C.

description:
Hole in the wall dive Thai restaurant. I'm not sure where all these uppity yelp reviews are coming from, or if these people have even been to Thailand, but the food here is about as authentic as it comes. Having visited  Thailand going on 10x now for work I can say this place is the closest I've found to the rustic, gritty, authentic Thai food I'd get in the nooks and crannies of Bangkok. It's not pretty, the service is adequate, but the food is really quite good and "rustic" so far as Thai goes.

Quit comparing it to Americanized Thai food and comp it against a dive in Bangkok and you'll find it's as real as it gets!
author: Mike A.

description: I normally get my lunch here and I will ask for more meat .Good food and fast service I n
author: Lema A.

description:
Say what you like about this place, but it has several great things going for it:

1. Its late hours--open till 1:30 AM on Saturdays!
2. Its central location--right on the main drag, and therefore easy to locate.
3. It's price to portion ratio. For downtown, prices are very fair for what you get.

I tried the pad see ew with tofu (as always). Delicious. I was craving greasy Thai noodles and these delivered. The rice noodles were fat, the tofu was crisp, and there were some unexpected vegetable additions--baby corn and mushrooms. Let's just say there was none to take home.

Sadly, my dining companion was a different story. He's used to restaurants where more ample helpings of meat are offered so, in reading the menu, he was less than enthused. He finally decided on the duck fried rice and ended up leaving some.

I enjoyed the selection of sauces and toppings that are left out on the tables--even found my favorite, crushed peanuts.

If you want something quick, this may not be a good bet. It was PACKED when I visited and there was a line out the door. There was more than one server attending to us, and it looked like they were doing the best they could, but we still had to wait a while for the food and the check. Also, some of them don't speak the best English so good luck requesting any substitutions/alterations to listed items.

Overall, it was a satisfying meal. I'd return if in the area.
author: Ellery D.

description:
My father had eaten here a few days ago and saw that they have delivery.  Living in the Richmond District, parking on a Saturday night can be hard.  Delivery is great for us, because he is 88 and has a hard time getting around.  

We ordered the chicken larb and the pork basil chile for delivery on Saturday night.  The person who took the order told us that it would be 45-50 minutes.  An hour later, our food had not arrived so I called to follow up.  She told us "he is leaving right now."

Our food arrived 95 minutes after we had ordered and was luke warm.  It was tasty but needed to be microwaved.

I am sure they were busy (the delivery driver told me he had five orders on the run when he brought us our food) but this was very poorly managed and messaged.

Next time, we will order from somewhere else.
author: Gary A.

description:
-Small hole in the wall spot with seating in the back 
-very casual atmosphere, nothing fancy
-chefs are cooking in the front so it's authentic and good quality 
-cash only 
-would only recommend this for takeout or quick food since the ambiance was so casual, not a special dining experience 
-I got the pumpkin curry vegetable style and it was really good!
-saw on the wall they had won some awards 


-3 stars for ambiance 
-3 stars for customer service 
-3.5 stars for value (most items $10-15) 
-5 stars for vegetarian pumpkin curry 
-overall 3.5 stars but will round it to 4 :)
author: Celi R.

description:
I'm so glad this late night chain is open until midnight. You know sometimes you crave for a meal where you don't want Burger King, McDonald's, Carl's Junior, or any type of burger related. You just want a decent meal?! This place is not the best but food comes out quick and flavorful.

At least when you ask them for spicy they really do make it spicy. Some Thai restaurants that I've tried in San Francisco will not make it to specification.  But when you live in the Richmond, there's no el farolito around. Do I want to drive that far for my quesadilla or burrito and bunch of salsas? Not really. This will do!
author: H H.

description:
I'm giving this place up to 3 stars for its consistency. I've called orders in several times and the food is always prepared fresh and ready within 15 minutes. I've gotten pad Thai, curry, pad see ew and a few appetizers. 

I'm giving this place only 3 stars because the food lacks flavor and is overall uninspiring. I've also found that they put very little protein of choice in your dish. Last time I ordered tofu pad Thai there were only 4-5 small pieces of tofu in my dish.
author: Mary S.

description:
These zagat rated stickers threw me off. I expected more from this place since it is the original restaurant and it is so well-recognized. 

Right when you walk in, you see the kitchen and where they cook the food. Which isn't a bad thing. It definitely has that old school Asia vibe. 

However, the bathroom is literally right next to tables. You automatically get a whiff of bathroom right when you sit down. 

We ordered why every Thai place is known for: 
yellow curry and pad see ew. They forgot to put carrots in our curry so it was literally just onion, potato, and chicken. Pretty uneventful dish. Pad see ew had broccoli that was off. I would bite into a mouth full of broccoli stems, but the inedible part. 

I don't know. This place is just eh.
author: Rachelle Y.

description:
I've lived in SF for 17 years now and have never experienced such rude service from an establishment to date. I initially called and asked to make a delivery order because on Yelp it indicates that they do indeed deliver. I was told by the woman on the phone that they do not deliver. I then proceeded to let them know that it might be a good idea to let Yelp know so that they can correct the information to avoid confusion. I then decided to go ahead and proceed with ordering take out instead, but she rudely hung up on me. I was a bit irked, but I figured perhaps there is a bit of a language barrier, or perhaps she was having a bad day as we all do from time to time. So, I went a head and called back to place and order. I let her know that the menu I have has no numbers and that I will definitely butcher the dish's name so I asked if I may spell it for her and read the description. She said 'yes' and I proceeded to do so. She then kept saying 'number 16? Number 16?' I then re-iterated what I had explained earlier, that the menu had no numbers. She said that's fine and I got dressed to walk over and pick my food. When I arrived they had made the wrong dish. I let her know that this is not what I ordered. I showed her on the menu and then she and the cook looked at me as if I did something terribly rude and offensive. She then asked me what kind of noodles I would like, so in an attempt to try and lighten the mood a bit I smiled and asked what does she recommends and what is her favorite. She looked at the cook like I was trying to be difficult. She then said 'rice noodles' with no smile or eye contact whatsoever. At this point I'm really trying to bite my tongue and just let it be. I patiently waited outside until my food was ready....she then brought out the food and had the audacity to tell me that if I'm unsure about what I want it's best that I just come into the establishment rather than call in the order. At that point I had had enough. I told her I literally spelled out the dish's name and read the description to her. She had the nerve to blame the situation on me rather than take some responsibility for her mistake. The order total was $10.35, I gave her a $20 and said to just give me $7 back in yet another attempt to be nice and cordial. She came back with all my change instead and
Shoved it in my hand. I said, 'I only asked for $7 back, Im trying to tip you.' She just kept walking and ignored me. So I went inside and threw the money on the counter and said they're unbelievable. Zero apologies, zero thank you's, and zero responses to my several attempts to try and be cool about the multiple layers of rudeness I had received. I'm a local musician and eat at all kinds of scrappy hole in the walls with mediocre service..., but I left this place absolutely disgusted and livid. I live in the neighborhood and I am super bummed that they were so freakin' rude. I like to support local businesses and they are a great late night spot typically, but this experience has deterred me from EVER supporting their establishment again, and I will have nothing nice to say about this place when people ask me about it. They could really take a page out of Thai Time's book (on 8th Ave.) when it comes to service.
author: Daniel C.

description:
Meh. I ordered the Kao Pad Ped (fried rice with roast pork, Chinese sausage, egg, and tomato). It was $12 for some overly salty fried rice, a nickel-sized slice of pork, a few similar-sized slices of pork skin and no Chinese sausage.

Maybe I didn't order the right item on the menu but I don't have high hopes for King's Thai given some of the other reviews.

Cash only and limited seating.
author: Hao H.

description: Food is good, just need to come here with cash only. It's fast, tasty and straight to the point.
author: Dang D.

description:
My go to spot for late night dining.

Fast, fresh and very good prices. 

I usually order (G) or the crab fried rice. 

Rather than to eat at a diner or fast food, I highly recommend eating at King's late night for a good solid meal at a reasonable price. Made Fresh!
author: Chris L.

description:
I have never written a review. I am so disgusted with the incredibly rude service I just received I needed to let others know to beware! If I could  give -0- stars I would. 
We ordered 3 entrees and asked for 3 chopsticks and 1 fork.

They originally gave us only 2 chopsticks and when I asked for a 3 rd and the waitress consulted with the other waitress and then replaced the Chopsticks I was originally given with a cheaper version. 

The first kind of chopsticks in my bag were the nice individually wrapped ones. The waitress took the 2 out and replaced them with the cheap break apart kind with all the splinters and when I said I wanted the others they just took them. 

Also our pad Thai was only a 1/2 box of noodles and 1/2 bean sprouts.. so cheap.

There are amazing food spots and restaurants on clement street, this is not one of them!

Go anyplace else!!
author: Ari Lin H.

description:
Why do they serve Thai food why . Well if you are going to say this is authentic Thai food than I am not eating Thai food going forward.

I ordered a Pad Thai to go and it was not good at all. The staff seems alright so 2 stars for that. But I am sure that Pad Thai was not what I ever had before in life.

Try something else might be good. Definitely not Pad Thai.
author: Urvish -.

description: Delicious thai food with the perfect flavor and spiciness. Definitely try their pad kee mao.
author: Devanshi S.

description: King's Thai is like a second home me, and my trusty go-to for late night grub. The chicken pad see ew is so tasty, highly recommend! Perfect for take out when you just wanna sit in your bed and eat thai food, but also cozy to eat in. Love this place!
author: Hōkū Y.

description: Great food, great for pickup, friendly staff and everything was hot and ready when I arrived.
author: Jay D.

description: Longtime favorite. The food is delicious. So flavorful. Love all the staff and they keep it very clean.
author: Erin L.

description: Great food at reasonable prices.  Have been coming here for years mostly for takeout and occasionally for delivery.  Love the panang Curry and the pineapple fried rice.
author: Amelia V.

description: Kong's Thai is great! Delicious food, generous portions and very hole in the wall setting.  Great service, cash only!
author: Rich P.

description: Don't get your order wrong hear you will have to pay regardless, Po was a complete jerk and angry waitress ( short hair crooked uneven teeth ) thank god for the other waitress who explain to me what happened. Regardless after the way I was treated like a common crook by Po who has taken my order before, now realizing she always kinda had a bad attitude I will not be coming back , I still payed ( mom was a waitress) and had to say next time you should treat customers with a little more respect
author: Adrian B.

description: Definitely one of my regular spots for a quick dinner. Not too busy, delicious Thai food, and they don't charge extra for rice (which never happens)
author: Chris W.

description: Great pad thai.  Like that they are consistant.  Lacks ambiance but the food is delicious.
author: Frances B.

description:
First off, this is no longer "King of Thai Noodle" but "King's Thai Cuisine", one of two locations on Clement. No idea why the other place got its name changed on Yelp and this one didn't. There was a family dispute over Thai political matters and two branches of the family went their separate ways. The King of Thai Noodle places have gone upscale and raised their prices while this place, as far as I can tell, is exactly the same.

I did a straight up taste comparison of the beef stew with flat noodles between this and the Leavenworth KOTN location and this wins in every way. First, here you can still request the addicting, gut-punishing chiles with fish sauce from the server (it is not left on the table because it could quickly ruin a meal if used inappropriately). Second, the stew contains lots of righteous connective tissue, not just boring beef chuck. Third, it's $2.20 cheaper!
author: Otis M.

description: A great place for Thai cuisine. It is a small restaurant with amazing food. Have won awards and recognitions for the past 10 years straight. Went there for lunch twice and ordered pho. Ordered chicken noodle pho with dumpling. Price was very reasonable for the quantity. The stock was flavorful. The rice noodles was perfectly cooked. Will visit the place again for sure when I am in city.
author: Suresh D.

description: They don't deliver anymore. WTF - so bummed. Now forced to pay $$$ to get delivery from Uber or GrubHub. Use to order weekly. Plus, can't customize my order over the phone.
author: Joshua G.

description:
This restaurant has excellent food. The noodle soups are "Super Tasty" and "Huge Portions". All the veggies are "farm to table" fresh and sliced/shredded white meat chicken. The soup broth is perfect without any of those fatty soup rings. Super healthy and you'll feel great afterwards without any guilt.

A must "go to place" on a cold night when you want some hot comfort Thai food.  The two young female waitresses are also very attentive and friendly.
author: Frankie F.

description:
My review here is long past overdue.  I accidentally checked in this location and Remember I owe this place a real review.  

This place is always crowded, which is ok because that just means foodies know where to go!
It's a real pity that the food is so yummy here and the place seems so divey, but I never came back because of one incident.

My friend and I witnessed a waitress sweeping the floor while we're eating.... And then lifted the broom she just swept the floor with, to sweep the tables....

Wow, I was speechless.  She just swept the table with that floor broom right in front of us like nothing was wrong....  I really don't trust what goes on behind the doors.  Never have I returned!!!!
author: Juila L.

description:
YUM 

the pumpkin curry was so good! the pad thai was a bit bland but i'm still giving this place four stars (i just won't likely go the pad thai route again here). 

the place is small and inconpicuous, like so many other eateries on clement. go for the food, not the environment. the staff is fast and friendly. the spice was hot as requested and the prices no nonsense ($) just the way (you and ) I like :)

try it, you'll like it.
author: Wendy X.

description: Love love love the food here! Minus one star because I am always cautious of the fact they are cooking so close to where people walk and wait for tables. Not exactly sure of how sanitary this is-however the food is delicious and worth the gamble. ( )A very small Venue with a great menu. CASH ONLY. I always order the pumpkin curry and pad Thai- can't beat it and you will crave it around midnight so take it home. Staff is friendly and service is quick . Give Em a shot, your taste buds will thank you.
author: Eva C.

description:
This is definitely my new favorite Thai spot! I was supposed to go to Sakesan across the street but the wait was too long for my hungry stomach so we went to this thai place across the street. 

Best decision of the night, this little hole in the wall is amazing! The kitchen is open and clean as well as the rest of the restaurant.

We ordered the chicken satay, pad see ew, fried chicken over fried rice and the wonton soup with veggies and BBQ chicken. Everything.. well done! The soup's broth was outstanding and everything in it was super flavorful. Every other item was full of flavor as well and I really can't say anything bad about it.

Service is kind and the food comes out fast, I personally love Thai food and this place just upped my love for it :)
author: Monica A.

description:
My wife lived in Thailand at one point, and this is her favorite spot in SF.

I did not live in Thailand at one point, and this is my favorite spot in SF.

PUMPKIN CURRY
author: Jacob M.

description: Here's what you need: drunken noodles and that rice special with fried chicken on top. Those two dishes will change your life. I like how fresh everything is. They cook it right in front of you when you order. Fresh pieces of basil in the drunken noodles give me hope at 1 am that this world that we live in is truly a miracle.
author: Noah D.

description: Very good beef broth soup with beef slices and vermicelli. Quite small. Reasonable price. Good service.
author: Nat C.

description:
We had to order 10 orders for work. We got there at 10:55 and technically they open at 11:00am, but the door was open. The lady yells at my coworker telling her to get out because they're not open yet. We were watching them from outside and they were picking food up with their dirty hands and eating it out of the food prep area. We went in and waited for our order. Not once did they wash their hands.

When all 10 of us got our food, we went back to work and had lunch together. All of the food we had ordered was burnt and the noodles were overly cooked! None of us enjoyed out lunch. 

This place is dirty, lack of customer service, and the food was not edible! Do not come here.
author: Darlene M.

description: My low rating reflects the inadequate service King Thai Cusine 1 offers ​or more likely​​y does not offer. You would think city like San Francisco you would be able to buy Thai food on a Sunday, but think again. King Thai Cusine 1 should extend the hours immediatley.
author: Richard M.

description: Not a huge fan of most of the watered down Thai restaurants in SF, but this place is authentic and consistent with their food. Can always count on them to get my Thai fix! Sorry Osha, your fancy decor and high prices got nothing on this hole in the wall spot.
author: cary g.

description: Coming here was a last minute decision but it wasn't bad. I am actually glad that this place was open cause my partner and I came in around 10PM. To be honest this place is decent, not one of the best places I been too but it was good. One of the dishes we ordered was the fried rice with BBQ pork, sausage, tomatoes, and onions. It was more on the sweet side, so I didn't add any sauces because the sweetness was enough flavor for me. The second dish we ordered was the roasted duck curry. I thought the duck was very delicious, but for some reason I felt like the dish was missing something, maybe needed the tomatoes to simmer more because the tomato was still very fresh, and lastly we had the larb salad. We got the beef larb and it was pretty good. However, we would usually receive it on a bed of lettuce but instead of we had cabbages, which is fine but the larb had so much flavor to it, that we could use a little more cabbage. Overall, this place was an okay place. If I were to be hungry for Thai late night I wouldn't mind coming back still has a lot on the menu for me to consider.
author: Chinda O.

description:
I used to go to the King of Thai on Clement and 3rd a lot since my friend lived super close. Also, they were open until 2am, so it was a good option for late night eats when dropping my friend off after going out. When I found out the King of Thai on Clement and 8th delivered, I thought I'd give them a shot. I remember liking the other location, so why not this one as well? I phoned in our order since they don't have an online option.

June 2013
*Tom yum goong http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/king-of-thai-noodle-house-san-francisco-4#MzjnMjbydgTgt-4SO0BfOg
*Pad thai with chicken http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/king-of-thai-noodle-house-san-francisco-4#7L4-93MJ_-6IKjQR9dOaVg
*Som tum http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/king-of-thai-noodle-house-san-francisco-4#BTlKcUcXdlforClj7J_wGQ
*Kao pad ped http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/king-of-thai-noodle-house-san-francisco-4#5o8UToXp-Z4_tqf4Fra8UA

Nothing was as good as I remember. Of course, after a night of dancing and drinking, I guess most food tastes better than when sober. I did like the Pad Thai and the Duck fried rice. The pad thai noodles had a nice chew and flavor. And the kao pad ped was nicely fried. The soup and papaya salad were kind of bland and could have used more spice.

Not sure if it was my alcohol goggles that made the food tastes so good, but I prefer the Clement and 3rd location. And it's just down the street!
author: Elena N.

description: Hey, it's Bob.  Haha, dude sorry it took me a while to leave you a feedback.  Thanks for the ice tea.  Good noodle soup.  Not so salty like most of the Chinese food.  I'll see you soon! Say hi to my man in the kitchen!
author: Bobby D.

description: Ordered the seafood salad, smelled disgusting, did not eat. Don't waste your time or money.
author: Noah A.

description:
Not sure what happened with the naming but this location is now called King's noodle house. I've been visiting this location since as long as I can remember as the Inner richmond was my old stomping grounds. All of the food is as I remember it. It comes out quick and you don't have to wait too long after you place your order. Much like a street stall in Thailand. 

That being said the interior is small and doesn't have too many seats. The service is what it is so don't expect high end service. If you need something flag someone down, they expect you to eat and pay, pretty much how it is in SE Asia as well.

I like to eat here because it is fast and fairly inexpensive. I know coming in I will order something like the #4 boat noodle soup and #8 duck noodle soup. It will come out fast and I can be done with my meal quickly. If you're expecting more you are expecting too much.
author: Vincent W.

description:
Ok so some people say this place is alright but for me this place is the first thing I think about when I want Thai food in the city. 

Just like any Asian restaurant service is ok, even on a slow night service was mediocre but reviews is about food right? So no big deal for me

Food: 
Pad see ew: I am very particular about this dish and I love it here! Some places make it all liquid-y but not this place. The taste is perfect too, not too sweet and the sauce is cooked right into the noodles, which it should be. Also no noodles were joined together where you had to pull them apart. Right amount of egg and veggies and I love it with tofu
Thai tea is always good here
Fried chicken over fried rice: decent amount of chicken which comes with the sweet and sour chili sauce. Fried rice was good too

Now I know people might say there's better places but when you jus want Thai food from a whole in the wall and the prices are decent and they give you a lot of food then this is the place. Plus no waiting 

Oh and who could beat that gengki crepes is like two doors down if you don't know what that is, then Yelp it of course :) 

Always such a good night when my fiancé brings me here, reminds me of our college years
author: Monica G.

description:
Fast and filling. For $8 I got a giant bowl of noodle soup that came within 5 minutes of ordering. Service was quick and the waitress  was very patient with our questions. 

Ordered: #4 combination beef soup with flat rice noodles. The flat noodles were bigger than expected. Imagine long chow fun noodles. Noodles were fresh, soft and perfectly cooked. The beef, which came in different cuts were flavorful and tender. Only thing to look our for is the one big fatty chunk of beef (if fat is not your thing). The beef balls were ok, nothing special. The soup was very flavorful. Reminded me of Chinese style stews as the five spice was very prominent. The soup is thicker and fattier...very tasty. However, the soup did leave me VERY thirsty afterwards (MSG haters beware). 

Overall, looks like they serve tasty reasonably price food. Will come back to try more.
author: Michelle C.

description: Consistently great food! I usually order from this one when I want take out and the other one on Clement when we want to dine in.
author: Zach N.

description: King Thai Noodle not bad the service is fast the food it's yummy parking is not too bad you can find parking in about 5 to 10 minutes they have some TVs you can watch or you can just Google or play with your phone they only take cash that's only problem is I will make sure you go there bring cash better than that you're fine have a good day enjoy your weekend
author: Miko A.

description:
Having lived in the area before moving to the south bay I used to like this place. After the Yelp party and before heading home we decided to feed our growling belly. This place was open and with my past experience we stopped by.

Well I'm older, hopefully wiser and now possesses  a more discriminating palate and eagle eyes. Walking in brought back memories of late night eats and the narrow aisle to get to the back reminded me of more post shenanigans visits.

We ordered one of the chef's specials. Roast Duck in Red Curry. Lets just say I've had better. Crab fried rice. Again- I've had better. PadThai. Meh.

Short story. Ones memories of food or at least mine was based mostly on what happened then and how much fun it was. Food be darn.

Now like I surmised earlier...I'm wiser and a lot more discerning now. This isn't the place for me anymore. But it doesn't mean years ago this place wasn't good at all. Hell I didn't even think twice about if their glass was clean or not.

Walking out there I explained to Adam the logic of why we even stepped foot there in the first place. It was mostly based on good 'ol times!
author: Janet D.

description:
Yesterday was our first time coming to King's Thai Cuisine #1 during lunchtime. The service we've got from this girl was so damn RUDE! She came and took the order with attitude and she brought us our foods and drinks literally dropped in front of us. She treated us like we are here to beg her for food. 
We usually come during dinner time, for over 15 years. We always have a wonderful experience. We were always  treated with kindness and known by all the evening staffs including the chef. Today was a pretty horrific experience. I gave 0 star.
author: Srey C.

description:
I don't know why this place is underrated but let it be known that this place is BOMB!!!

We didn't know that our regular place (Thai Time) is closed on Monday so we decided to come here despite the bad reviews on Yelp because we didn't want to walk too far.

The staff were very friendly and courteous. Our food came promptly with no fuss. Best of all they're super delicious!!! We literally closed our eyes as soon as that first bite hits our taste buds. It's like as if we were taken back to Thailand!

We had the regular suspects such as Pad Thai, Pad See Lew, Green Curry w chicken and the Chef Special Red Curry w Duck. Absolutely delightful!

Don't be fooled by the stars given on Yelp. Give it the benefit of the doubt and write your honest review, seriously!

This place is so authentic that my check came in handwritten in Thai Script!
author: Aina L.

description: Awesome service! The girls are great! Food is delicious and quick. Definitely will be back.
author: Luz A.

description:
Terrible example of Thai food. Not only does the restaurant have a poor food safety rating, the food is just plain bad. The noodles tasted burnt, as if they had been constantly cooking in the same pan and burning things in it all day without washing it. The staff isn't very friendly, and the prices are way more than what it's worth for quality and quantity.  

Advice: never search for food when you're very hungry and go to the first place to come across. You're going to have a bad time.
author: Sarah H.

description: Food gets ready faster than McDonald's, and very yummy too. I liked the fast service, good food and availability of street parking
author: Uzz T.

description: Hole in the wall Thai place but my favorite in the city. Absolutely love the food here..cashew chicken is amazing..have never had a bad experience here food is always consistent.
author: sam k.

description:
Ok haven't gone here to eat for few years now.. Always go to their other locations..!! Parking around Neighborhood isn't easy.. Cuz is mainly meters..glad that we stop by and ate here.. Walked in and got last table in the back.. Lady toke our order.. We had waited for our food n toke awhile,, then the waiter came n said they lost our order.. Like WHAT ??? He gave us one ice Thai tea for free !!
Of course we ordered our favorite food..!! #4 my fav is beef combo flat noodles soup.. Make me think about my trip to Thailand few years back..
Fried fish cake a must order.. And fried chickens over fried rice !!!
Our portion today seem very very big.. Wonder is it us our dishes been delayed ??
But over all everything on the menu is great n mouth watering yummy..
author: Crisy G.

description:
Service can be better though. Every time my friends and I ask for something simple like water, forks or even a napkin they somehow forget to bring it to us. I ordered brown rice yesterday, they somehow mistakenly gave me jasmine rice... which was not a big deal. Then charged me for the brown rice. 

I've ate here a couple of times and the food is not that bad.
author: Johanna M.

description:
This review is for a delivery order, so I cant comment on service or ambience.

1- food was prepared super quick, impressive!

2- pad-kee-mow (not sure on spelling) was very good and not too greasy. Not sure how traditional it was, but it was good compared to other places I have tried in the city

3- yellow curry is tasty, but make sure you order a ride of rice because it doesnt come included.  

4- cost is pretty low! Not huge portions, but good value.
author: Kimia M.

description: Because I want to be as honest as possible I'm giving it three stars. The food was great we ordered a variety of plates and each one came out perfect. The service was the complete opposite. The waitress did not take our order till about 15 minutes after we were seated and she only came by to check on our water glasses once during the entire time we were there. I had to flag her down twice to get some attention to our table. Id recommend ordering take out next time you come here
author: Kirita S.

description:
So this is my default Thai place to order from on EAT24..so I've tried just about everything. 

My go-to's:
1. Pad Kee Mao - with Tofu (Veggie) - Order it SPICY! I like it because it is so flavorful and gives you way more veggies then the other stir-fry noodles offered. I love it with a kick :)
2. Pad See Ew - with Beef - This is your standard pad see ew, nothing really spectacular about it except that it really hits the spot when you just want some pad see ew and some Chinese broccoli
3. Yen Ta Fo Noodle Soup - Seafood Noodle Soup that really hits the spot when nursing a hangover. They give plenty of seafood and the broth isn't too salty. I usually order this with flat rice noodles.

I've tried the other beef noodle soups..and even though my friends swear by it, I haven't been overly impressed with them. Perhaps its because I order it for delivery and it isn't super fresh. I would just stick to the basics with this place.

As a helpful tip, just say NO GO on the crab fried rice.. it's really smelly, which makes me feel like it isn't too fresh. Not too much else in the fried rice either..so totally not worth the money!
author: Jennifer S.

description: I like this place, I've been here many times but the service is spotty. We went at an odd hour today and didn't want to order a lot of food but figured it was fine because it was not busy at all. The woman gave us attitude about not ordering enough food but didn't get our order right the first time anyway. It was very uncomfortable because I ordered and said "we will just have...." and then she stood there and we had to tell twice that we didn't want anything else. Then she confirmed that we only wanted X number of dishes which was inaccurate. We clarified and then she entered the order correctly. We were literally the only people in there. She brought part of our order and clearly forgot about the other part until we reminded her. She didn't check on us, refill our water, ask if we needed anything else, acknowledge that she forgot part of our order  etc.
author: Diane B.

description:
This place was our 3rd choice - unfortunately our first two were closed today due to unknown reasons.  We walked in through the kitchen/cooking area and sat at the back table.  We had intended to go to a pho place, and the first page of the menu here was all noodle soups, so I figured we would get something on par.  We both ordered the noodle soup (one of the last ones, maybe #14? it had a lot of different seafood in it), a plate of som tum, and a plate of pad see ew.   Food arrived at the table pretty quickly.  

The soup was alright, nothing to write home about.  The broth didn't have too much flavor, and while there was a good amount of seafood, the soup bowl felt relatively empty.  The pad see ew was better than the worst I've had, but nothing stood out about it.  Noodles and veggies were cooked well, but the flavors didn't really pop.  The som tum was not good.  It was just not spicy at all and a bit sour, and it was missing that crunch that I'm used to - some of it was a bit soft.  Not a good representation of the 'four flavors' that are in most Thai dishes.  Really a disappointment here as som tum is NOT that difficult of a dish to make, especially for a Thai restaurant.  All in all, everything we ate was just a bit mundane.

Guess I've been spoiled with 20baht bags of som tum on the streets of Bangkok, so now $8 for bad som tum spoils my experience.  I wouldn't come back here as there are so many other choices on this street (hopefully they will be open next time).
author: Ben K.

description: You can't go wrong with the fried rice, pad Thai, or pad sew Yee. This is one of my favorite go-to places when I can't decide what to eat. It's not too pricey, stays open late, and they give you a good sized portion
author: Alan L.

description: This is not King of Thai.
author: Dan B.

description:
I paid a visit to this location while vacationing in San Francisco. Not knowing what to expect, I hopped into a van full of friends with only the promise that GOOD thai food would be waiting at the end of our journey.

This location is a hole in the wall and looked too small to accommodate our party of 7. We had to wait for them to clear up enough tables to fit our group. But, I'm impressed they were able to accommodate us at all. Maybe we were lucky, because it was pretty late in the evening?

I ordered the green seafood curry that comes with a bowl of rice. I also had their thai iced tea to drink. Cravings fulfilled! Not going to lie, the green curry was pretty spicy, but my spice tolerance isn't what it used to be. Regardless, the flavour is wonderful and the seafood in the curry was delicious. Overall price was definitely friendly on my travelling budget. Next time I'm in San Francisco, I would love to try their pad thai! :)
author: M.K. R.

description:
3.5

Extra points for closing late!

My boyfriend ordered flat noodles with beef and yellow curry with rice. I appreciated how efficient the workers were here and got our order in about 10 minutes to-go.

I would say that their portions were huge and satisfactory! We devoured our food and the price was affordable enough for the two of us.
author: Aj C.

description: OMG u must try this place it's very good I ordered the fried chicken on fried rice and it was amazing but it was a bit burnt but it's still very delicious
author: Anson Z.

description:
Dear good Lord, please feed me this in heaven haha. Took my boyfriend here after about 6 years of living out of the area and left, happy, full, and tipsy - clearly living the good life :). Make the trip to clement, you wont regret it. We got Tom Yum soup, Spicy Calamari, Red Curry Chicken, and Pad Thai. Yea yea before you judge me as not a true thai food lover for stereotypically ordering Pad Thai, back off haha. This Pad Thai is AMAZING!! If you don't at least try it once I dare say you say have nightmares regretting it. 

Tom Yum Soup - good but not the best
Spicy Calamari - my boyfriend loved it, spicy, crunchy. The sauce really made it
Red Curry Chicken - spicy & delicious. I enjoyed that it wasn't made with coconut milk as a nice change. 
Sangria - good enough for a second glass but relatively forgettable

Try this place, you'll love at least one thing I'm certain.
author: Stephanie J.

description: My go to veggie flat noodle soup, open late, delicious, fast, affordable, nom nom nom.
author: Alicia T.

description:
I don't usually write reviews, but I write for the ones who without a doubt need one.

I am disappointed. I usually eat here and one of the waitress today is really rude. The food is great and everything but this waitress got an attitude. 

Long short story:
I ordered Pad Thai and Thai fried rice. There were 5 of us, and all my friends heard I ordered pad Thai. She insisted that I order Tom Yum without politeness and she realized that she's wrong. She knows she's wrong but she refused to apologize. 

A simple apology would be enough but instead she acted like she owns the restaurant. A customer is king no matter what, and I tried being polite to every waiter or waitress, but thanks for her bad attitude I bring this restaurant's star average down.
author: Jogi P.

description: Very good food. This was our first Thai meal. My Wife, Daughter and Son shared two bowls. Food was very good, service was attentive and helpful, food was served quite fast. We also had Thai iced tea and Thai iced coffee. Both beverages were very tasty.
author: P.J. H.

description: Fried chicken over fried rice was delicious. Cash only at this location. Super friendly and great service. Thank you so much we will be back.
author: Darrin P.

description:
We happened on KOTNH by accident as we were in the area late and just needed a bite to eat. Obviously they serve your typical Thai restaurant fare, but since it is in the name, we decided to try the noodle soup.

This was AMAZING. I would describe it as their take on a meaty noodle soup with hot broth, noodles, meats and veggies. Like a pho or chinese noodle soup.

They offer a variety of different meats to go in the soup. We ordered a combo, which includes sliced beef, beef balls and beef stew, but the stew was the highlight.

All was good and great until half-way through we found a snail in the soup. This was slightly offputting, but the soup was really that good. However, for the sake of letting the restaurant know they should probably wash their veggies a bit more, we called the waitress over and showed her.

Interestingly, she did not seem to know what to do. We asked if she can do something about it, and she looked confused. She walks away, and 5 minutes later brings back a thai iced tea. I actually thought she did this as an apology to help tide us over until they bring us a replacement, but 10 minutes passes and nothing else happens. In effect she rewarded us with a thai tea for finding a snail in their food. Like finding waldo in a line-up!

We end up having to flag down a different lady to ask if she can take the old bowl with snail away and just prepare us something else. They eventually did, but it is odd that they did not default to this in the first place. 

Snail or no snail, the soup noodles are just that good. I would highly recommend.
author: Vince E.

description:
I have several issues with this place:

* They charge you higher prices than what's listed on their website.  I ordered about $30 worth of food and when I got to the restaurant, they charged me close to $60.  When I asked them about the prices on the website, they told me they don't have any way of updating the site.  I told them it was false advertising and they told me to take their takeout menu for next time or check the yelp menu.  I told them to remove to remove the website link from their yelp page if they cannot honor the advertised prices.  They all had this laid back attitude like extra $30 isn't a big deal.  I was also told they only accept cash, they probably hide some of their revenue from the IRS as well.

* All the dishes were spicy even though I told them to make everything mild, several times.

* They added chicken in one of the veggie dishes.  I asked for extra eggplants in one dish and they added a side of rice instead.

I won't be going there again.  There are several other good Thai restaurants on Clement.
author: Iqvinder S.

description:
This place is open LATE!! 

Wide variety of choices to pick from. You don't get lucky with all hole-in-the-wall restaurants, but this is one! Super cheap considering general SF prices. And the food is yummy. 

You might doubt the cleanliness, but their rating seems to be good.
author: Vikram A.

description:
Ordered the Thai green curry. The flavour is bold & delish. 

However, the pork is over cooked & chewy & the green bean is totally raw.
author: Aj P.

description:
First started eating at this group of restaurants when they were opened in Lakeshore plaza...probably 10 years ago. It is always solid, quick , food. 

This iteration of KOTNH is just the same: small, always busy, cheap , and pretty good food.

I aint guarenteeing you stomach wont be saying.....what have you done to me.....as you always take a lottery ticket when dining in these places....but it is usually pretty darn good.

Last note....cleanliness is not their top priority.....just saying.

Favs are:

 Guay Tiew Moo Look Chin Pia noodles with sliced pork, ground pork, sliced fish cakes, fish balls and bean sprouts in clear chicken soup

Guay Tiew Ped Yang noodles with sliced roast duck and yao choy vegetables in chinese herb duck soup

Kao Pad Gal Tod deep fried boneless chicken breast over fried rice with egg, white onion, tomatoes, topped with cilantro and cucumber and served with sweet and sour sauce

Tofu Tod  deep fried tofu served with peanut sauce.....anything deep fried yum!!

Kao Pad Sapparo pineapple fried rice with chicken, shrimps, white onion and cashew nuts.
author: David G.

description: I always love coming here when I am in town visiting my cousin. Went here after the giants game, for some good old thai food. delicious and amazing, great service and food comes out fast and ready. If your ever in town, def check this place out for sure
author: Oliver L.

description:
Speedy Gonzalez must have been born here because my order came out fresh and exactly to my liking within minutes!! With great service, late night hours, and a super clean inside, I can see why this place wins Zagat props every year.

The only drawback: my dish was not spicy at all. Guess my saracha tolerance makes everything bland...
author: Regina D.

description: UPDATE: After the first time, I decided to try King of Thai again with my boyfriend. For some reason, the one day must have been a fluke because this restaurant is amazing.
author: Laura G.

description: Went here on Christmas day after discovering Safeway was closed.  I like the open kitchen so you can see how food is prepared.  Other reviewers have remarked on their recent health inspection score of 77.  I looked at the details and it all seemed pretty minor to me except for "improper meat thawing" and warewashing deficits (I got take out).  Overall I felt the service was good, the food was prepared in a reasonable amount of time, the portion was a good value, and the food had good flavor.  Not the best Thai I've ever had but in a pinch it does the trick.  I would return.
author: Jay G.

description: This place is usually good when we go in. This time we ordered through uber eats and the quality suffered in a major way. They also got the order wrong. Beware when ordering delivery.
author: Eric L.

description:
My dine in experience was decent. We order a beef pad see ew, angel wings, calamari and a beef stew. Nothing to complain about.

I rated this review one star because I ordered a to go order for my boyfriend. Another pad see ew but with chicken. When I got home, I opened the package to see that the order was wrong and they gave us such a small portion! I didn't expect to be ripped off on my to-go order since we ordered a pretty good amount for three people. The taste of our to-go order wasn't appealing either. 

As a result, I'm thinking twice about ordering to-go at this establishment.
author: Stephanie L.

description: Da bomb. Generally get soup and curry. Never disappointed.
author: Mr.x T.

description: Food is just okay, msg over used. And most importantly why no change when I gave 25 dollar for my $20.03 check? At lunch? And why all the 3 long benches for the waiting area of a single stall bathroom???
author: Prim204 M.

description:
Food:
The Pad Thai Noodles were not as good as I remember. In comparison to Thai BBQ in South City, I would have to say I prefer Thai BBQ, but that's a bit out of my way depending on where I am. My Hubby ordered his usual Pad See Ew. The flavor was good but the chicken was a tad over-cooked and a little dry. It could have to do with the cook watching TV while he was cooking or that the food sat in the car for 25 minutes while I drove back home. There's no way of knowing.  

Experience:
The plus side was I was able to order food from them at 12 midnight when most other Asian Restaurants are closed so for that reason, I still say that the overall experience was good. It's a quick "go-to" for "to-go" orders before I head home for the day. 

On an another note, the restaurant has changed their name to, "King's Thai Noodle House" and it is no longer called, "King of Thai Noodle House. It is a minor change in the name but it can be a little confusing to someone who isn't familiar with that place, the area and what to look for.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Today is the 3rd time these folks got our order wrong. It's the 3rd time we ordered 2 dishes specifying zero spice on both of them. Our children were unable to eat them. In one dish we requested sliced chicken but they still gave us ground chicken in the noodles, and our child did not eat them because we couldn't get all the chicken out.  I waited a long time to give this place a review because my husband likes it a lot. They keep messing up our orders and it's just not worth it anymore. 
Won't be back -- ever.
author: Mary P.

description:
My roommate and I wanted a late night bite, so we ended up at King of Thai Noodle House.  I was getting over a cold, so I ordered soup with pork dumplings.

The portion is huge!  There were different types of pork, from the dumplings to sliced.  It was actually too much for my taste.  I ate only half, and ate the rest the next night. The broth and the noodles were good.

It's a tight space, and it can get very busy.  It's probably best to get your food to go.
author: Vira P.

description: This is one of the few Thai places in the inner Richmond of SF that is reasonably priced & open late. Hot Thai tea is just $1 & in general, $20 can get ya a full entree over white rice.  The only downside is that this place is cash only which can be a hassle for some folks besides this place having a tiny sit down area.
author: R C.

description:
3.5 stars. Don't get me wrong, they have delicious food and great service, but there were a couple things that were just a miss about this place. I got the duck over rice and although it tasted good, there was so much fat, bone, and tendons left in the duck that it was hard to eat. My rice was also hard and not cooked fully. What made up for it was the taste. It was nicely seasoned and I loved the vegetables in it. I would love to come back and try different things on the menu.

Also, cash only!
author: Hana K.

description:
The food is quite good, but the service and atmosphere are average. We loved the Fried Chicken over Rice #43 and whatever #21 was. Sooo good.

I did have a problem with their menu description. I'm allergic to shellfish and made sure my meal didn't have any. Turns out, they actually did use shellfish in my meal, so I had to leave after a bad allergic reaction. I was also definitely to blame for not asking. Just be careful! 

But in the end, this a good place for Thai food on the cheap. Nothing on the menu is over $9.
author: Ashley E.

description: Best Thai food ever.  I'm bonafide Thai foodie and chef - this place always delivers.  It's literally a hole in the wall kind of place, but service is fast and delicious.  This is well worth the drive when I'm in San Francisco.
author: Mari S.

description:
I had the noodle soup with vegetables and tofu 
And it was very good
author: Dwayne P.

description:
Been coming to place for years and it never fails. Food is always consistent. Prices went a bit high but no complaints here. Same quantity and quality. My per usual order is Kao Pad Ped (fried rice w/roast duck)Always on point, no shade on the meat. There's this apetizer dish I've tried. Hoi Jor- deep fried bean curd paper stuffed w/ ground pork,crab meat, ground shrimp,ground water chestnuts served w/sweet plum sauce. Damn, it was good! 

I glanced over my neighbors table and they had soup. It looks good with a good ass portion bowl. For sure on a gloomy early evening I'll definitely give it a try.

P.s CASH ONLY but who cares there's a few atms down the street.
author: Cee M.

description: I would give five star because of the food! There's no doubt that their food taste better then other King of Thai because they are the original. However their staff is rude as s***! Not friendly they just want you to order, dont ask question they're to good to talk to you, they snatch money out of your freaking hand when you're paying them. Place is pretty dirty so I always get it to go. So zero star for the decor zero star for the staff and five star for the food! I don't know if it's just me or if Thai restaurants stuff are just rude as s***!!!
author: Michele T.

description:
There is just something about those Angel wings that has me craving for more. Great environment located in a nice area with other places to look at and enjoy. The restaurant itself is very clean and inviting.

The food is outstanding. Had the pad thai and it was great! good serving size and none of the ingredients overpowered the others. Sometimes I find that the sauce ois too much or there is too much peanuts.. etc. The Tom Kha was the right taste and is the closest I can get to the taste I have been looking for since the closure of Jarin Thai on Ellis Street in SF. Again, back to those wings. GET THEM! they are juicy and so flavorful. The price may be off putting but definitely worth the try.  You tell me.=]

The reason I give it 5 is because from service to food to atmosphere I was not disappointed. Definitely a great place to take the fam for a night out to eat.
author: Nikole D.

description: Good for late night. Always come here after climbing with a group of friends. My favorite items so far are Tom yum soup( hot and spicy but a little salty) and duck green curry. Duck salad and duck noodle soup are good too. Basically like all the duck items on the menu.
author: Sophia H.

description: The food is very delicious. The service is really fast. The price is very reasonable. Fried chicken over fried rice, tom yum gong and thai tea are my favorites.
author: Roy G.

description:
This place is great if you're hungry and it's late and you want something tasty and flavorful in your system QUICK. 

I love their thai fried rice. I'm a very picky fried rice eater and sadly almost all of the asian restaurants in SF don't qualify. This place does! 

They're not as creative or exotic like Lers Ros. Flavor is also not as refined. But it feels a lot more casual, hearty, family-like. It's also great that you can see their open kitchen in the front, in full action.
author: Wendy K.

description:
This place has the most amazing noodle soup ever, coming from a soup FANATIC and I mean fanatic, it's beyond amazing. I got the beef soup with flat noodles and it honestly beat any pho or kasoy or anything I've ever had. Solely based on that, I'd give it 5 stars. BUT, the green  curry was not too great ... It was a little sweet for my taste and spicy, it was not savory at all. The pros; soup is amazing and so are their meats and the price. The cons; parking and service.

But if you're craving soup on a cold morning, which is rather common, go here!
author: Ashley B.

description:
Fast good Noodle soup in the avenues. Sometimes I just want something quick when I'm shopping for groceries so I stop by this place for some hot noodles.

They can make things spicy or mild upon your request.

They have a variety of duck and seafood Noodle soups for every taste.
author: Jackie H.

description: I order chicken kabobs every time with a thai iced tea and they never fail. Such a consistent restaurant.
author: Carmel G.

description:
My mom loves place! We recently came back after years of hibernation and although it's tiny, it's a gem. Authentic dishes, satisfactory-ish service (hence the four stars and not five), awesome hot thai tea (no milk, just the incredible tea). I would definitely recommend this place.

I don't know what to recommend, we ordered probably everything at least once on the menu and there wasn't anything we did not like (except the soup... I would not order that again just because I'm accustomed to clear broths of my viet culture).
author: Katherine L.

description:
I'm not really sure what I ordered, but it was #43. It was fried boneless chicken breast with fried rice. And it was delicious!! 

The food came out really fast, and the servers were really nice.
author: Rachel H.

description:
The situation: My thai friend says "This is the most authentic tasting thai in the city!". We stopped by for lunch and were seated immediately. The place gets good marks for service and cleanliness. I actually didn't feel the need to wipe off the table with my napkin or bust out the antibacterial hand sanitizer. 

The order: We got the tom yum gai soup to start. It was really large, very flavorful and spicy, and full of chicken. This would have easily been large enough for one person's meal. That's what the two "regulars" in the corner ordered for their lunch. Now I know. We then also got the duck curry - lots of flavor and a lot of duck skin. I was a big fan of the skin, but I also would've appreciated a bit more meat, you know? The meat I did get was mostly boney and chewy pieces that I ultimately had to spit out stealthily into my napkin and pretend like it didn't happen. We also ordered some chicken with thai basil, which my friend really liked and devoured. 

The bill: the prices were all about $8 a dish, so we got out of there for about $30, which seemed pretty reasonable to me. If I'd wanted, I could have easily made another meal out of the leftovers....unfortunately I'm just not a leftover kind of girl.
author: Janet Z.

description: Awesome service! Awesome food! I eat here at least 3x a month. I would recommend them all day every day. Only slight draw back is they only take cash which can be inconvenient sometimes.
author: Kristina W.

description: Decent Thai food. This place good for soup. Recommended to those like noodles soup. Personally the salads are so-so, nothing fancy. Cold weather, good place for a bowl of noodle soup
author: Unyo N.

description: So many other great thai restaurants. Food was very mediocre. They got the order wrong after clarifying 3 times.
author: Erin A.

description: Went to SF for a gig. Got hungry. Decided to find something that is not China Town. We went to inner sunset. Found this place. Ordered some food. My stomach and taste bud thanked me. What a great spot. I've gone here one previous time and it was still amazing. Love their duck red curry. One of the best I had in a long time. I am also an eggplant fan and damn, it was yummy too. The service was quick. Food was yummy. Can't complain.
author: Tom H.

description:
I'm writing this review as someone who has actually never stepped foot into this restaurant, but orders their delivery 1-2 times a week. I'm an Eat24 "veteran", if you will, with over 500 orders, so I've had my fair share of Thai delivery. King of Thai is one of my favorites in San Francisco, and always impresses me with the quality of the food at delivery time. 

When I order from here, I can expect the delivery without 30 minutes ALWAYS, which is rare in San Francisco. I always order their Wonton Soup (add flat rice), and Spicy Eggplant with Mixed Veggies and Tofu.  I've been told by friends that I really should take the next step and visit them in restaurant, but there's nothing better than sipping on Wonton Soup and relaxing on my couch. 

Love this place, will continue ordering delivery, 5 stars all the way!
author: Alex G.

description: Ordered the chicken cashew nut for carry out. Barely any chicken in the dish. Disappointed
author: David M.

description:
1 star is for customer service, not the food. I ordered a meal to-go and dropped $3 in the tip jar. When I got back to the car and put the to-go box on my lap, I noticed that there was a crack in the bottom as garlic sauce was dripping all over my pants. After quickly putting the meal back in the bag and cleaning my pants, I went back inside to ask for another to-go box because the one I received was cracked.  The lady at the front told me I had to pay for a new one! She would not replace the broken box she gave me. As if getting sauce all over my pants wasn't enough, this topped it off. 
The food is very good. They will put MSG in your food unless you request without.  
Bad customer service makes a meal taste bad. If I could do it over, I would have taken my tip back out of their jar.
author: Jay E.

description:
The service here is very friendly. Very casual restaurant. The food comes out quickly. I've been here many times since I live in the area. 

I got a stir fried noodle dish one time. It was too greasy for my liking so I avoid stir fried dishes from here.

I've tried the curries a few times. I just wish there was more food in the curries. (For almost 9 dollars each) There was only one piece of potato in my yellow thai curry, and not too much else.
author: Nona T.

description:
It's small and narrow. Open late. So small there are only a handful of tables.
You'll probably end up waiting if it's late at night.

You'll probably end up extremely annoyed if you just came from Outside Lands and you're seated next to a table of nerds in a heated debate about Apple vs PC and comparing it to having a Porsche versus 2 Civics SO DAMN LOUD that the 2 females at that table shushed them and told them to use indoor voices multiple times. Yes, that really happened and they're probably all virgins. Don't even get me started on when they started shouting about Linux.

The food is just meh, okay. You go because it's late, it's open, and decent enough to get the job done. Just eat and GTFO of there..

The service can be hit or miss. Waitress totally forgot about the table of guys to my other side. They had been trying to get her attention for awhile to place their orders but that was a fruitless endeavor. After I placed my order, I told her that the table next to me was also ready to order and she gave me the death stare. Yea, just eat and GTFO of there..
author: Susy C.

description:
First up, CASH ONLY! (Luckily, BOFA was right opposite)
Second, thanks to Yelp again!

When I was up in the city near Golden Gate, I was trying to find good Thai restaurants nearby and found this one. It is a very very small hole-in-the-wall restaurant that can be easy to miss. Paid parking is available in the neighborhood.

We came in during an odd time, at 3ish for lunch, so it was not crowded and the 6 of us were seated immediately. Here is what we ordered:

- Tom Kha Soup
- Pad Kee Mao
- Red Curry with rice
- Pineapple fried rice

Everything tasted very good. Very reasonably priced. Neat service.
author: Anu M.

description:
Came here after a hungry night of exploring the California Academy of Science at the Thursday NightLife event. (Date 2 with the mister) Nerding out can really make one tired, yadadamean? :P

Yay for late night hours, and polite staff. There was a mini wait so the staff quickly serviced us and led us to the back waiting area which was quite comfy and away from the dang cold. Anywho, ordered a noodle soup (don't remember the name) and it was pretty good. We were so tired and hungry that we barely talked - ate all the foods instead. The size of the soup was massive and def a challenge to finish. Nicky had to finish the rest after he devoured his own meal. After finishing the meal and getting to know each other's "expectations" of one another we paid for the decently priced meal and left satisfied. 

Would recommend? Yes :) Good sizes for the prices.
author: Lynn L.

description: Got the Duck noodle soup.  Good flavors but painfully salty.  Generous serving of tasty duck.  Pretty cheap so that's a plus!
author: Olivia T.

description: For Russian Roulette players.   Food inconsistent & tends to be overly salty.  On a very good day the food is tasty and satisfying, but don't depend on a dish you especially enjoyed once to be the same taste-wise or the amount of food served.  On that very good day when dish is prepared well and you don't leave hungry, I consider prices reasonable.  Service good.
author: Tree C.

description:
I would say they are nice and small restaurant in the busy area. At that time, I was craving a curry so I walked around the area and Bingo! There's only one place still opened (8-9pm) with curry dish that I really wanted to have. Then I jumped to the restaurant :)
They were not busy but almost packed lol yeah I ordered Roasted duck curry dish :)
It was Yum! But still lacking flavor. I mean curry flavor. But still good but not that great. 
The server was super attentioned with me and another customers. Great service :) Food was OK.
Sorry I usually give 5 stars but I cant due to lack of the curry taste (like water curry :$)
I'll come back for sure to try another dishes :)
author: Weerachai P.

description: The regular chef must be off... Or my taste buds are.... But seriously. If i wanted Mexican food I would go to the Mission or So Cal. At a Zagat rated food spot i expect legit... I want a thai person cooking my thai food... I know a lot to ask for... The good news is the kitchen is open in plain view... Next time i will look at who is cooking before I come in. Although I  may not try all the soups in the menu now... Oh well thank god there are 100s of thai spots within this 7 mile square called San Francisco.
author: Pedro Proz P.

description: This King of Thai Noodle House is for the less demanding, low maintenance, not-too-interested-in-appearance kind of people. You don't go into this restaurant expecting them to ask if you are enjoying your food at inconvenient times (like while chewing your food ect.). Catch one of the waitresses when they walk by if you need anything. The food is great - well at least the ones I get. I tried the pumpkin curry the other day and it was delicious. I also like their coconut soup with lemongrass and mushroom and I usually add noodles for extra. Hits the spot when I'm tired or sick.
author: Momoe K.

description: Since 1994 they must have been doing something right.  We love the soups. Especially the boneless 5 Spice roasted duck and vegetable soup with thin rice noodles.
author: Mike N.

description: They just raised their prices AND lowered their food safety rating (now 7 points away from being poor).  Please go to the other Thai place down the street which also accepts credit cards.
author: I C.

description:
This unassuming spot serves some serious Thai food.

We came by because another place was closed, to be honest, and were a little skeptical by the emptiness at 8:30pm and the take-out atmosphere. But the back seating area filled up quickly. The waitress was super friendly and kinda amused, though I'm not sure by what.

We got the staples of tom kha gai, pad kee mao, green curry. Huge portions, good prices, could have been spicier but it was legit. The food was surprisingly good, actually some of the best Thai I've had.  I'm almost hesitant to try anywhere else because I feel like it wouldn't beat King of Thai Noodle...

My only gripe is the cash only deal, and that they didn't have my usual Thai order -- spicy fried catfish.
author: Vivian H.

description: I ordered a duck fried rice to go and I got extremely sick from it. Either it's bad duck or the food isn't fresh. After eating the food, I got extremely sick 7-8hrs later; food poisoned. I won't be eating from here again!!
author: Cindy W.

description: I was in the hood and hungry so I yelped for help. This place is off the chain and lives up to its name. I've never had Thai noodles before. I got number 4; rice noodles with sliced beef, beef stew (yum) beef balls (what?) spinach in spicy (gringo spice) beef soup. Cash only! Super duper good ...
author: Moy V.

description: Horrifying experience dining there last night. In the middle of our meal a RAT came out onto the dining area floor. People were horrified. One little girl was standing on her chair. The restaurant owners did absolutely nothing about it, acting as if we were overreacting. We asked for the check and got the the hell out of there. NEVER AGAIN will we eat there.
author: Louis R.

description:
Easily, the MECCA for Thai food in SF.

Okay, usually, I go to the larger one one the same street - except for today, where I notice that that location is now CLOSED!  Not a big deal - I know there's a teeny-tiny King of Thai place a few blocks down across the street.  I always wondered about why there were 2 locations of the same restaurant on the same street so close to one another.  I've read that this smaller joint is actually the mothership of the chain - store #1.

Whoooooa- when you first walk in you're treated to a up close and personal view of the kitchen!  I was a bit alarmed when one of the chefs was stirfrying something over a blazing flame!  Baa-WHOOOOSH!  Kind of a neat way to start your KoT experience.  We were seated in the smallish dining area.  Did I say it was small?  There had to be no more than 6-7 tables in the entire place!  It reminded me of having lunch in a closet.

Our food soon arrived after ordering from the familiar menu.  My own pad thai noodles with prawns looked amazing.  They're really quite artful in arranging the dishes to make them even more appealing.  I have to say, their Pad Thai is really authentic - nearly identical to the stuff you'd get in Bangkok.  Others I was dining with had a tasty duck noodle soup (rich with the aroma of star anise and other goodies), and a stir fried eggplant and prawn dish with basmati rice.  It all looked so great - and I was assured that they tasted equally as good.  The bill was around $30 - a fair amount for the quality and quantity of tasty Thai food.

I seldom do this, but I'm giving the original King of Thai noodle place a whopping 5 outta 5 stars.  Yes, it has it's quirky/funky bits, but it only adds to the King of Thai experience!  I'll be back again real soon.  Khun Ka!
author: Gibson T.

description:
I received exposure to chemicals in plastic to go containers. They put very hot curries and broths in these containers. Food and beverage containers that are all plastic are made from chemicals. Research strongly suggests that all plastics may leach chemicals if they're scratched or heated. 

Steps you can take
Try to use as little plastic as possible, especially if you're pregnant, and never use it around food.

To reduce your exposure:
1. Carry your own glass, steel, or ceramic containers for use. 

2. Use glass, porcelain, enamel-covered metal, or stainless steel pots, pans, and containers for food and beverages whenever possible, especially if the food or broth, curry is hot.

3. Plastics with recycling symbol 2, 4, and 5 are generally considered OK to use when contents have not been heated.
author: ava l.

description: This place was delicious. First time, ordered pretty safely, but everything was excellent and well-flavored. Excellent condiment cart as well. The best Thai I've had in some time.
author: Jim K.

description: Used to be my favorite go to spot for late night Thai food. Left me on hold for a ridiculously long amount of time only to come back onto the phone to tell me the driver doesn't want to deliver to my area? Loyalty? Zero f@cks given. Well then, also zero stars. And zero more dollars ever. Thai Time had waaaaaay better tom kha gai with prawns anyways. Deuces
author: Kareem C.

description:
We went here on a Friday night and the place was absolutely jammed with people. Must be because the food is good and the prices are cheeeeeeeeap. Literally, everything on the menu is $8-9. We were a group of 8 but only had to wait about half an hour.

We ordered WAY too much food for 8 people. But everything was delicious. From what I can remember, we had:

GOOD
- Tom yum gai - hot and sour Thai soup goodness. 
- Tom yum goong - same soup but this one had shrimp instead of chicken in it. You really only need to order one soup...
- Pad thai
- Green curry
- Red curry
- Pad ew soo
- A couple of other rice/noodle dishes which I can't remember

MEH
- Chicken satay - you get 6 pieces with peanut sauce. Wasn't impressed with the chicken though. A little on the dry side.
- Pumpkin curry

Tasty, cheap sums up up King of Thai Noodle House for me. Good for large groups and food comes out fast so it's perfect if your hungry and need to eat.
author: Jonny M.

description:
Working in the area, my co-worker decided to check this place out.  When there's a line, the food must be great, right?

Ambient wise, the place is decorated like an authentic Thai restaurant. 

My co-worker and I each ordered a rice plate.  Nothing special in terms of taste.  The soup on the other hand was way too sour.  The coconut-milk couldn't mask the sour taste.
author: Chi T.

description: Needed to pick up some for my husband on my way home and he requested some "hot noodle something."  So I had to figure out what was open around 10:30 pm, and luckily these guys were still serving.  You never know what to expect when you go to one of the late-night joints on Clement, but I was pleasantly surprised when I got home and had some bites of his food.  I ordered the chicken noodle soup with flat noodles and chicken Pad kee mow.  The soup had a slightly sweet flavor to it and was surprisingly good, and the noodles weren't too spicy but flavorful.  They used fresh veggies which helps.  I'd get late-night takeout from them again, but not sure I'd eat in -- not the best ambiance.
author: Yea A.

description: 2.5 stars but I'll round up to 3 as the service was decent. Food was lacking flavor from what I remembered from previous visits. I saw the 77 score but walked in still. There were flies in the restaurant and we were not dining al fresco.
author: W A.

description:
We were so fortunate when we chose to come here to King of Thai on Clement instead of the restaurant that showed up on Yelp when looking for Thai (wont say, did not sit down).

I had the Pumpkin Curry, and it was absolute dynamite. My wife and I usually agree to split whatever plates we order in case I feel she has the better dish (don't even ask, I'm weird and neurotic like that). I was enjoying this particular dish SO MUCH that I was fine with practically keeping it all for myself. ..

Don't get me wrong, her Pad Thai dish was really really good, but I was in love with my Pumpkin Curry plate, and all those potatoes, and the wonderful tasting spicy and sweet sauce, holy cow. Great stuff.

AND the food came out really fast, which I am always a fan of; especially when the stuff is this good!!

You owe it to yourself if you are a fan of Thai food, to try this one. You will not regret it. I didn't!!
author: Johnny G.

description:
Reasonable priced, not too expense and good food for under 10. We ordered some Pannag curry, that hit the spot just right. Not extremely spicy but gives you that extra kick.  My husband ordered a roast duck noodle soup that he loved. For apetizers the fish cakes and wings were really good. I think they were garlic chicken. wings.

King if thai was pretty busy and service was good. Too bad we don have this place where I live.
author: Helen T.

description:
Omgggg! Such a small little Thai restaurant but don't be deceived, the food was incredible. There wasn't anything that I didn't like. I wish I had more room in my stomach for more food.
