First thing you'll see is the chefs kitchen right up front on the right side of the store. Walking down that lil hallway you'll reach the seating area. 

We ordered: 
-papaya salad. Looots of fish sauce on this one. But they give us plenty of papaya for 4 people to share a plate.
- crab fried rice: oh my, real crab, so much goodness. Can eat this with anything!
- duck noodle soup: not the best duck noodle soup I've had but it has really good flavoring and the duck isn't dry. 
- duck curry: this has got to be my favorite. Omg I've never had such good curry and I'm  a huge curry obsessed girl. Definitely want to come back for this. It's inspiring me to learn how to make this dish. Try it out and you'll know what I'm saying.
author: Katie T.

description: I like this place--nothing out of ordinary. They don't have offer much on the menu at all and most of their dishes aren't spicy; however, I do like their tom yum soup. The major issue I have in this restaurant is their location of the bathroom. The place itself is quite small and the bathroom is in the back but centered. Most of the customers aren't kind enough to keep the bathroom door shut after they leave so the stench of the bathroom can be smelled if you're sitting close to it. And by the way, who enjoys being seated right next to the bathroom where many people frequents? Definitely not my cup of tea.
author: Melanie W.

description:
Have been coming here to this restaurant since approx. 8 year ago ~ this restaurant was pretty famous and their food used to be pretty good.

Ordered: 
1) Combination Beef Noodle Soup w/ Watercress (seasonal) - Noodle with sliced beef, beef ball, beef stew, watercress and bean sprouts in spicy beef broth ~ haven't had that for a while and this kind of Thai style noodle soup is not a common dish in many Thai restaurant ~ once in a while, I will crave for this and will come to eat this
2) Pra Ram - Your choice of meat (chicken, pork, beef, prawns, seafood, or roasted duck) with spinach topped with peanut sauce

Haven't been back for the past few years and the orders were only A-Ok. Quality seemed to drop a lot ~ wonder if they change chef or not.
author: S B.

description:
I love King of Thai. It's my go-to place for late night eats, because of the staff, great prices, and freshly cooked food. 

When I come here, I get a few things usually. My partner loves the curries, and gets them almost every time. Pumpkin curry with chicken is a favorite with jasmine rice. Everything I've gotten here has been fresh, hot, and spicy. Stick to your ribs food that make you so warm inside. 

Other favorites include the lemon grass ThomKa soup, and the Shrimp and Pineapple Fried Rice. I've had their B
author: Charlene S.

description:
This is still one of and maybe the best Thai noodle experiences in San Francisco but it's lost it's glitter. 

Come here ASAP, it's amazing. I took off the fifth star because it's has lost the magic. I still am in love though. The service is quick and the wait staff very friendly. The Chicken Pad Thai is great.
author: Justin S.

description:
I legit have nothing bad to say about this joint. Food is so good. Prices are fair. Service is speedy and friendly. Wait time for the food was minimal. 

I guess the only thing that sucks is parking. If you plan to eat here during peak hours, prepare to circle around for hours. It sucks but hey, comes with the territory when you're tryna grub in the city. 

HEADS UP: Cash only. Dollah, dollah bills y'all. 

Definitely recommend and would come back!
author: Abigail D.

description: Best Beef Pad Thai ever!! Their chicken skewers appetizer is also amazing! Service is always fast and delicious!
author: Kristen B.

description:
This is by far one of the best King of Thai chains.  Parking can be hard, depending on the hours of the day.  Just keep circling or park a little farther.  The inside is nicely remodeled and very modernized.  The menus are clean and so are the tables.  The seating takes maximum advantage of the floor plan, without compromising personal space.  

The GF and I came in about 9:30 p.m. on a Tuesday night.  We were seated immediately, and given menus.  We ordered the fried chicken over fried rice, topped with a fried egg, as well as the pad kee mao.  Both were great tasting dishes.  For dessert, we ordered the mango sticky rice.  I thought it was good, but noting spectacular.  I would have rather enjoyed the fried banana with ice cream.  

Overall, very good thai food.  Service was great.  Would come back again.
author: Victor L.

description: Wow. Went to king of thai with four things to order and coincidentally was told they weren't making those dishes anymore....all FOUR f'n dishes. Oh but here's the kicker. Coincidentally "Kings Thai" has them and the waitress from "King of Thai" advised us to go there....because they're all connected despite "Kings Thai" claiming they're under new ownership and saying they're a separate restaurant. It's obvious they're trying to save that stink hole of a restaurant by sending customers there since the service and food stinks at "Kings Thai". I guess I'll simply just boycott anything with the word "King" following "Thai" because in the end, they're both the "King of B.S."
author: Jas P.

description: food was great, the staff was incompetent. creepy child-molester looking guy was staring at my girlfriend the whole time. 4/10 getting to go next time.
author: Zachary B.

description:
1. open late

2. GREAT thai food

3. AMAZING flavors.

4. Price is fair

This is obviously the best , first, original King of Thai. The other locations pale in comparison. I think my love for Thai food has been reignited! ( I overdid it Freshman year in college sigh )

Cannot wait to come back and eat eat eat!
author: Selina W.

description: OMG this is the BEST place to get Shrimp Pad Thai or Chicken Pad See Lew in San Francisc.   The first time I went in to order these items, it was for take-out so I had an unexpected appetite-inducing show.  I was standing along the long counter, so had a front row seat view of the cooks preparing my dishes from start to finish, their woks dancing and getting licked by the flames.  It was fun to watch, in a sort of Benihana way. I felt like clapping when they placed my noodles into their respective takeout containers.  I am hooked.  Definitely highly recommend. Excellent
author: Hot Lunch Lad Y.

description: I don't really like the Pad Thai, but the Pad Z Ew is an even better placement. The Thai tea could be creamier. I enjoyed the chicken satay especially the peanut sauce.
author: Fernilla S.

description:
Default thai place to go to when i want some fast thai food (also because they open till very late + good location).

-I usually love getting Pad thai because i know it tastes about the same everywhere.  This pad thai has everything: the meat(ordered chicken), bean sprouts, tofu, egg, peanuts...missing my favorite raisins in it!! (Only one place in chinatown that was on broadway had it-closed)  Trust me raisin in your pad thai will tie the dish together even better!  
-As much as i love pad thai, i would get the pad see ew at this restaurant instead!  This pad see ew tastes better here than at any other place i've tried.  I never order the pad see ew so please try this here.  I like this dish strictly for the taste of the noodles, not the beef (beef was like any other place)

Pros:
-If you're out late, this would be a great spot to come to for a late night meal!  
-Small but clean restaurant
-Fast service

Cons:
-Bathroom is kinda weird.  You pretty much slide open and close a door that is literally the same area as the eating area.  It feels too close x)
author: Roxana L.

description:
Came here wIth the fam bam to wait out traffic on the bridge and have an early dinner... thank you Yelp! Food was good, really fast service, and the price was unbelievable.

We had pad see ew which was very good, yellow curry, chicken satay, and rice for 4. This was only $26! The curry was simple but good, the satay was fine but I'd try something else instead. The food made me think thIs might be what I'd cook at home if I was Thai... Im not even remotely Asian so I could be wrong.  All I can say is the food was basic, but they nailed it. The kids and us polished everything off!

What a great discovery in the city. We'll be back.

Note: cash only
author: JD I.

description:
A hole in the wall place located at the New Chinatown of SF.  We were craving Thai food one evening, and we decided to come here to have a nice inexpensive meal.  For a dive, this place was quite busy.

We ordered a Pad See Ew with beef and a Thai style beef noodle soup.  The proportions was not too big, but can't expect much since it was inexpensive.  about 7.00 a dish.  The Pad See Ew was tasty.  It wasn't as spicy as I thought it might be.  The wok flavor was there and it wasn't too greasy.  I liked it.  The beef noodle soup was also a bit small in proportions.  There wasn't that much meat in the noodles... the beef brisket, beef balls, and thinly white noodles.  I could have counted the pieces of meat, and the strands of noodles. But, no complaints since it was pretty good too.  The soup base flavor was there, but again wasn't that spicy like I expected.  But, I can't really use it against them since there was hot sauce on the table.  

The place wasn't that clean... sticky floors, chairs, and tables.  The chopsticks and spoon was clean, but I still had to wipe it down with my napkin since everything else was sticky inside.  

The waitress was attentive.  She served with a nice smile and made sure we were satisfied.  

There was one LCD television hanging inside.  How I wish it was turned to ESPN.  But, instead it was on some documentary that nobody cared to see.  I asked the waitress... but, she didn't know the channel number.  Oh well.  Can't expect to have sports fans everywhere I go... 

This place has the flavors like it should be in their dishes.  But quantity is a bit stingy, and the place needs to be a bit cleaner.
author: ED L.

description:
Ahhhh this place is so fricken good! Everything is amazingly flavorful. This is true authentic Thai food.

The chicken and beef larb appetizer were so delicious although I liked the beef more. The chicken skewer and seafood dumpling appetizer were also super yummy. My Tom Kha chicken soup was incredible. Probably the best I've ever had and SO filling. 

The group I was with brought our own beer because they don't serve alcohol. The establishment is small but they have another larger restaurant down the street. This place is so super cheap. We ordered 6 main courses and 4 appetizers and the total was around $70.
author: Erica C.

description:
I LOVE King of Thai's pad kee mao! Probably the best in the bay imo. It was $7.50 ish (cheaper than Osha's) and tasty. The only downside (this time though) was they that gave me small portion. I've been to other King of Thai and they never skimp out on the noodles. Sad. Please don't ever give me small portion? I may be skinny but I eat A LOT.  Anyways, that doesn't keep me from coming back! This location is the smaller one, only a few tables at the back and the bathroom is VERY close to the tables near the wall, so it's kind of gross. We came here just in time before the dinner rush at 6pm. There's another King of Thai a block away but they're closed down for renovation. 

Oh love the serrano peppers in vinegar! I had a serrano pepper slice with each bite of my noodles and it wasn't spicy at all.  My bf had a beef stew noodles and he enjoyed it. The Thai iced coffee was way too sugary. I had a sugar crash after I drank it, I wanted it to wake me up! The service is a bit slow. It's crowded and there's only a couple of waitress manning the tables. 

Anyways, worth trying! Pad kee mao for my savory taste buds fellas!
author: Rita K.

description:
Came here with two friends after a late night of HH. Space is enormous, we were served rather quickly, food is yummy and prices even yummier! 

I've been to the sister location in Inner Richmond and thought the prices here were less expensive (maybe I'm wrong). 

Favorite dish I had here: pad see-ew with beef. Yum!

Looking forward to coming back (although parking is a nightmare in this area).
author: Siv L.

description: Got the yellow shrimp curry. I liked it a lot. There are seatings at the back and it is cash only :)
author: Jay L.

description:
Expect to wait awhile even after being seated...

This pretty much sums up the experience we had when we came in here for dinner.

We came in and were seated right away since the rush hasn't arrived yet (seating for 4). After being seated, we were promptly given a menu (for some reason they only gave us 3 menus instead of 4, even though there were 4 of us).  We ended up sharing a menu - not a problem, but still something to note.

There was a small family (3 people) right behind us that was seated before us and had their drinks.  

After a bit of small talk, we eventually figured out what we were going to get.  Thai iced tea and thai iced coffee, pumpkin curry (chicken), roast duck curry, and some noodles that I can't remember... sorry about that.

This was about 10-15 minutes.  We were looking around for the waiter around this time, and ended up having to raise our menus to wave a waiter over.  One waitress simply nodded in acknowledgment and went to get the waiter who was supposed to serve us.  The family behind us apparently has also been trying to signal a waiter over.  I felt kind of bad when the waiter bypassed them and went to us first to get our order when they were waiting for much longer.

We ordered and thankfully the waiter then went to their table.  Apparently, they had ordered their food already but have not received it yet.  The waiter had to take their order again to get it.

After this hiccup, the orders were sent and we received our food.  For some reason, the waiter gave us our entrees before the appetizer. When we asked for it, they had to check and then ended up having to get our order for it again (chicken satay).  

The pumpkin curry I received was okay - nothing incredible. I've actually had better. However, I did enjoy the thai iced coffee.  

Would I go back here again?  Definitely not.
author: Nina M.

description:
The Pad Thai is ALWAYS on point. 
I always tell myself to try something new on the menu but the pad thai is just so perfect, i end up getting the same thing every time - totally worth $8, big portion, enough for two to share. Parking isnt all that bad, a couple rounds around the block and you'll fine somewhere! Keep in mind that you need to order atleast $10 worth of food in order to pay with card. 


loveeee this place!
author: Mya M.

description: I'm giving this review because they should have a higher number of stars than they do-both times I've been here I've had delicious meals (pad see lew, green curry, can't remember the previous ones), and I loved it! Great food, friend, fast service. And open late-way better than anything else you'll get late night
author: Afton C.

description:
I ordered delivery from them yesterday and was sadly disappointed, considering all the positive reviews.

I ordered the roast duck fried rice and ground chicken larb. The fried rice was somewhat lacking in flavor, whereas the larb had too much fish sauce in it, making it too salty for my taste. The larb also wasn't warm, even though the delivery didn't take that long.

Maybe I ordered the wrong items from this restaurant, and should've ordered some form of noodle (since that's what's in their name). I'll be giving them another try with a noodle soon.
author: J. D.

description: Food is really good.  I love the red curry and the boneless chicken over fried rice with sweet and sour sauce.  But their service suck.  I'm sitting at the table writing this review. Waited for my water to be refilled for the past 10 mins and when she finally came she spilled it on my hand and didn't apologize. But because food is cheap and good I gave it 3 stars.
author: Chief D.

description:
First and foremost I would like to give 5 stars to service. Its a take away order so when I phoned it and despite language difficulty the lady who answered the phone was very patient and very polite.

You see I have this favorite Curry Noodle soup from Bangkok Express at Powell St. I always always order #12, which I believe (but do correct me if I am wrong) is Tom Kha Gai or something like that. So I explained it to the lady who took my order.

When I got home, I was excited to dive into my soup since I am famished and have not eaten since brunch and this is about 7pm already.

To my disappointment, the curry soup was sour (too lemony), again, almost all the ingredients are the same, galangel, lemon grass, chicken, mushrooms. I dont want to sound stupid and maybe comparing apples to oranges here, but I really dint like the taste.

At any rate, I am sure that most of their dishes are delicious as I have trooped to King of Thai before (at Taraval).

I will definitely come back again to try the other dishes.
author: Malou C.

description:
The best that restaurant ever. No frills and oh so good. Pad thai the thai popular fried rice noodle was simply scrumptious. It's got crunch and just the right amount of fish sauce for salty and sweet. 
Tom yum soup just the right amount of spice and sour too. Add in some rice noodles and it's a a good entrée. 
Overall cheap and the best thai for me
author: Nelle L.

description:
Cheap foods (under $10 average) open late night (2am closing every day). It can't get any better than that. 

So far have tried the following and was thoroughly impressed:
Beef noodle soup (very flavorful soup, very tender beef)
Beef pad see ew (solid pad see ew, comparable to Osha's).
Eggplant with beef. (slightly spicy, very tasty!, love the eggplant)

Am excited to try the other entrees!
author: Patty O.

description:
Modern decor, small and cozy.  Fast and friendly service but that means nothing if the food is sub par  We ordered noodles believing that it would be the restaurant's name to fame and as it turns out, it's a misnomer.  

I ordered some noodle that came with different variety of meats and vegetables. Maybe because there exist so much variety, the food didn't taste much of anything at all and was rather bland, despite having ordered medium spicy.

The order dish includes fried noodles and curry mixed together. This was the less horrible of the two and I managed to steal large portions.  The portions are on the small side but I didn't mind considering that I didn't like either very much.
author: Lana W.

description: Whenever I'm craving Thai food, I am more than willing to make the trek all the way out here from San Jose to satisfy my yearning. I recently came here and noticed they definitely remodeled the place to make it more modern looking. I know King of Thai has multiple locations, but for some reason this specific one is my absolute favorite. Parking can be a little difficult, but again so worth the hassle. I absolutely love their Thai chicken wings, which are always perfectly crispy and covered in that amazing sauce then topped off with crispy basil. However, my favorite item here is their duck fried rice. OHHHHH MYYYY GOOOODDDNNESSSSS their duck fried rice is on point, I can literally inhale a whole plate to my dome. I refuse to share with anyone and of course I have to wash it down with their epic Thai milk tea. Though service can be hit or miss and wait times for food can get lengthy when it is busy, I forget about all of that when I inhale my meal. Overall, if you're looking for delicious Thai then definitely make it a point to try this place out.
author: Cristal C.

description: My to go Thai place when I am in the area. Their Pad Thais and Tom Yum Gongs always hit the spot! Craving satisfied!
author: Michelle K.

description:
Excellent Food.  I thought going in this was a strictly 'noodle' place, but it has the usual Thai food menu.

Great food though!  Really exceptional!  

Tiny place, you walk through the kitchen first to a back area with about 10 tables, you don't go for the ambiance, just the great food.
I was getting over a sickness when I went, so I got the delicious #1, the soup that I cannot remember the name of.  Amazing!  Fresh, hot, lots of meat and bean sprouts, spinach, and lots of bone marrow in the broth.  Great.
author: Song H.

description:
Would you consider this an express Thai food joint? Not sure but the prices and locale made it seem like the Mcdonald's of Thai food.

With that said, I really despise Mcdonald's except for their french fries.

Food here is tasty, warm and just overall good. 

You can hear the crackle and sizzle of cooking food while you sit and talk in the back of the restaurant.

It's kind of funny how you eat in the back and you are cut off from the view of the public. You walk into the place and are moved to the back to dine.

While we waited for our food, I had to figure out where in the world did they put their food. I didn't see any refrigerators at all.

Oh well. I am rambling.

Tangents aside, this place has good food, good eats, for a good price.
author: Vince N.

description: The food is delicious! We ordered and within five minutes they started bringing out our dishes. I highly recommend the pumpkin curry- everyone was good but that dish was by far the best. Small and casual atmosphere, fast service and great food.
author: Samantha H.

description:
Great food, horrible service.  Don't be surprised of you find yourself waiting 5 mins before being serviced.  The two waitresses working were yapping away the whole time while other patrons and I were waiting.

Again, the food was great, good portions, but, -btw i hope i don't sound like a food snob for saying this- a smooth running restaurant shouldn't keep you waiting 5 mins before serving you water and taking you're order.
author: Win C.

description:
I have been here several times in the past because the food is good, despite the slow service. This past Sunday a group of six of us came in - the restaurant was not quite half full. There were two people waiting tables but the guy disappeared right after we walked in. We literally waited twenty minutes for water - the waitress did her best to ignore us. One of our group finally went up to the counter where she was writing up a to go order and asked for a glass of water - she said yes and then ignored her. Finally she came with two waters and wanted to take our drink order but seemed flustered trying to remember six drinks. Where was her pad of paper? She came back with one beer, one tea and one Coke (not diet as ordered). After a delay she came back to take our food order (with a pad of paper) - we gave her our order but when we inquired about the other three drinks she brushed us off. Honestly I'm not sure why we didn't just get up and leave at that point - we were all frustrated. Suddenly the guy shows up with a couple more of our drinks, one still missing. When I asked if he would exchange my Coke for a diet one he made a pained face.  We did finally get six drinks and all of our food, but by that time the food didn't taste good. The noodles seemed sticky and dull. 
Definitely will not go back! There are too many restaurants in SF with good food and good service. 
The service has been poor since I first came here but not like this. Where is the management/owner? Does anyone care that you're losing customers due to the service?
author: Patricia E.

description:
Yes yes yes yes. This is one of those great hole in the wall one room restaurants: kitchen in the front, few small tables in the back, cash only, bill handwritten in Thai. The food is amazing and oh-so-affordable. Nothing is over ten bucks and the portion sizes would make any Asian mama proud. 

The pumpkin curry, already lauded by others, deserves another round of applause. The flavors are simply perfect. Spicy, creamy, savory, tangy...everything in total curry harmony. The texture too was unreal. A lot of Thai places tend to make very soupy runny curries. At the same time, I don't want my sauce to be all thick and gloopy either. The consistency here was stand-out and made me realize what I had been missing my whole Thai-food-eating life. Creamy, rich, but not overwhelming. This was one of the few times I devoured every last drop instead of leaving the sad little puddle of unwanted curry that is often the aftermath of mediocre Thai food. The ingredients were fresh and generous too - the shrimp plump and crisp, vegetables colorful and not overcooked. Heaven.

Other highlights include the pad thai and pad see ew. Wonderful wok-y smoky flavor, big chunks of veggies and meats, and perfectly textured noodles. 

The servers are really friendly here and the atmosphere is simple and no-frills. A humble King indeed.
author: Carol C.

description:
We ate here for my wife's birthday lunch. Parking on a Saturday afternoon is awful around Clement St. but fortunately after driving around found a metered parking place and the meter was broken. Free parking! 
When we sat down, it took a while to be served, I guess this is how this restaurant operates but once we got it started it was smooth afterwards,
The food is delicious, wish the portions were larger, but not bad.
So full, did not order the fried bananas.
I would recommend!
author: jack d.

description: It's really authentic and delicious. I ordered a flat rice noodle with minced pork, fish cake and fish ball. It's definitely a big bowl to finish but it's all money worthy.  I have friends from Sweden, Italy and vennizula joining me and everyone of them enjoyed their food here.
author: Valda G.

description: I'm a regular at this Thai restaurant and use them often for quick pick-ups or delivery as well. My favorite and recommendation is the Pad Thai. And while you're there, also make sure you try the Tom-Yum soup.
author: Nitish S.

description:
This original King of Thai Noodle House location is the only one that I go to now.  Their business has expanded over the years but all of the other one's aren't the same, in terms of the food quality.  The spacing of the restaurant is small and that's probably the reason why the food still tastes good, for the sake of food quality over quantity conversation.  The food is quick, legit and cheap.  

I usually come here for the noodles soups, the pan fried noodles and rice dishes.  Can't go wrong with any one of the following:

1. Any Beef Noodle Soups
2. Any Duck Noodle Soups
3. Duck Fried Rice/Fried Chicken Over Rice/Rice with Ground Meat w/ Fried Egg
4. Pad Thai/Pad See Yew/Pad Kee Mao
5. Thai Ice Tea/Thai Ice Coffee (Mandatory!!)

There are few other dishes that I recommend but can't recall at the moment.  Not much of a Thai Curry (Coconut Milk) fan so can't really comment on that... sorry.

Disregard the 1 star rating by someone complaining about the waitress service.  This is a quick in-n-out noodle spot to fulfill your hunger needs.  Go somewhere else if you're looking for a ambient sit down Thai food experience. Seriously though, GTFOH!!
author: yusai g.

description: Best Thai food in this whole area, hands down. I know my pho....I travel a lot and no matter where I am, whatever culture I'm exploring it's pho every night!! And in San Fran I discovered the best pho of my life here at King Thai. The number 4 is hearty, full of delicious ingredients and left me feeling comforted. Be careful of the other King Thai cuisine location. It is not as authentic and the atmosphere does not make up for the lack in taste.
author: Gary G.

description:
Horrible customer service! Waitresses chat-it-up in the front ignoring customers trying desperately to wave them down. We practically had to do a cheer in order for the waitresses to give us our check. Or actually, they did see us, but they were too busy gossiping in the front and glaring at customers that dared interrupt them.
The girls that work here are rude and have no regard for their customers. Avoid!! There are plenty of other better Thai restaurants nearby.

Oh, in case management is curious as to which workers? We were there on 12/13 at 7pm. Look up your employee work schedule and you'll find the inadequate waitresses that served us.
author: Maria N.

description:
UPDATE  UPDATE UPDATE:
I mentioned to one of the bosses at KOTN on Sloat (Now just Thai Noodle House), that I thought the soup was different.  He acknowledged that at they don't add the "blood" to their soup, because the "customers here [Sunset District] don't like it".  That's really too bad, cause I like what ever it is that they leave out.  Oh well.  I'll come to Clement, when I want the soup.  Thank God they still do it right here.
author: Stephen F.

description:
AMAZING THAI FOOD.
One of the best I've ever had in my life time.. 

Price is reasonable - generally $8 per entree. 
Rice dishes come with rice. 

Would definitely come again and recommend to others..
author: Thomas N.

description:
The food by itself I will give 4 stars. But the service is the worst worst worst I have ever had!!!!! 
I work as a server, so I normally wont being picky or gave the waitresses hard time. Because I understand they have to deal with a lot of bullshit everyday. 

I went to this place on sept 10th around 3 ish afternoon.  I told them we are party of 2 and my friend isn't here yet. 5 second after I got seated, she came over and ask me am I ready. Hey, obviously I'm waiting for my friend! Have some common sense! After that no one ever bought me any water or tea while I was waiting even till I left. 

Ok, so what pissed me off the most was,I had to wave for couple mins but they were just chatting there and not looking. Eventually I had to walk up to the counter and ask for a check. She came over cleaned up the table and brought us the check. While she was cleaning up, she ask my friend to put the napkin that she used in the soup bowl for her. My frd already put hers in the bowl, then she asked my friend to put mine in the bowl for her too. 

Hey, excuse me?! Isn't that suppose to be ur job? How can u ask a customer to clean  up a table for u? I had never seen that before. Ridiculous. 

I usually tips 20%, even with so/so service I'll still tip 15%. I only left her a quarter and wrote bad service on the check. When she came over, she picked up the money and she start cursing in Thai in front of our face. 

I'll never go back again. I love the food there, but there's a lot of Thai restaurant with better service near by.
author: Niko L.

description: Consistently great food. Really good. Super casual.
author: Mark D.

description: My friend and I both got SICK from their food. We shared the beef noodle soup and the pad thai. I'll spare you details but we both got sick within an hour. The only reason Im not giving it one star is because Ive eaten here before and I was fine and the food tasted good. However, I probably wont be back since theres just so many thai places to choose from. And I'd rather not get sick
author: Tiffany L.

description: This has always been my favorite Thai restaurant. I haven't found one I liked better. Well, actually, there is one dish at Osha Thai I really like that they don't have at King of Thai. It's a pineapple-lychee curry but isn't available at all the Osha's so King of Thai is my #1 Thai place to go to. Their prices are also very reasonable.
author: Karen L.

description:
Fast. Cheap. Delicious.

I recommend the smaller more authentic whole-in-the-wall location down the street from their larger location.
author: James G.

description:
Yelp, I feel misled.
I called in my to-go Monday night at 8:20p, picked up at 9p.  I was daydreaming of amazing asian grub, but I was met with a sore disappointment: Pad Thai made without any love or affection, and with unevenly-cooked noodles. I'd paid a bit extra for them to throw in some sauteed veggies, and got 2 mushrooms and a few pieces of broccoli stem in response. I also ordered shrimp as my meat selection, and there were a total of ...4? and a bunch of fried tofu for filler: I don't like tofu, which is why I'd selected shrimp! 
I'd ordered 40min before I even got there, but they didn't start making my food til I arrived, so I had to wait there another 10min while they got their act together.

I'm in noooo rush to return to King of Thai Noodle. I really wish Thai Time was open on Mondays...
author: Rachel S.

description:
The only great thing about this place is that they deliver to my boyfriend and I a few blocks away (I know, we are lazy!).  However, they only take cash and their food a never consistent.  Sometimes there's more chicken, sometimes the chicken is fried darker, sometimes there's more food.  Consistency is what brings your customers back, but if you're in a pinch and don't want to cook....I guess you can order and hope for the best, right?

Also, they do not include utensils.  I grew up in a restaurant, so I know the basics of to-go and delivery.  You include the utensils! Also, their customer service is terrible.  They delivered our fried rice without the fried chicken and wanted us to pay for the difference.  If you made the mistake, you bite the bullet.  Why does the customer have to suffer?  We definitely are not ordering from them for a while.  I hope they get their act together.
author: Lisa X.

description:
Ate lunch here yesterday with a friend.  It is a tiny place with the kitchen in the front which is a bit weird, but no uncommon for this part of the city.  The service was sufficient & as expected for this type of restaurant.

We ordered:
Phad See Ew with Beef (Tasty, but a bit overcooked in the pan)
Pumpkin Curry with Chicken (Tasty, but the squash was overcooked)
Thai Iced Tea (this was not good at all- I didn't drink it, something was off about it) 

Note: Cash Only!
author: Christy L.

description:
Service is decent - the people working there were nice, but one girl gave us another man's order, which confused me for a minute before he told us [he was at the table next to us.]

Food is good and affordable; perhaps not the best quality and a bit hastily prepared, but the portions are large and they serve it up rapidly. 

I also realize now, reading through these reviews, that I have been here a few times but have never tried the famed #37. Making a mental note to order it soon.
author: Delia Z.

description:
King of thai is always the best go to place. It's conveniently close by to me. This location is great for take out. It's rather small but the original branch. They are pretty friendly and very quick. 

I definitely come here all the time. Food is great and price is very reasonable.
author: Christine V.

description:
Of ALL the thai places I've been to so far this place truly does live up to its name. It's the KING of thai (noodle)

Now lets get to the point and start on the food. Proportion wise, get the noodle soups. The noodle soups are HUGE, guaranteed you won't finish it by yourself. The fried rice proportions on the other hand, a little small for my taste but somewhat filling. Now my expertise is fried rice, and I've tried all the specialty fried rices here. The crab meat fried rice, roast duck fried rice, and pineapple fried rice. 

Now between the three the best one would easily be the roast duck, followed by the pineapple, and then the crab meat.

The pineapple fried rice comes off with a few pieces of shrimp and chicken with a salty and sweet flavor. The chicken, however, tastes dry and bland; not working well with the overall taste of the rice. Overall, not bad, but not the best pineapple fried rice I've had.

Now onto the crab meat fried rice. This dish is actually too bland for my taste and is borderline tasteless. However, the crab meat is real, unlike many other places. The downside to real crab meat is that there are small pieces of shell still inside the fried rice. Overall, kinda tasteless and pretty boring of a dish.

Best for last, the roast duck fried rice full of flavor. It has the roast duck flavor well cooked into the rice and the duck pieces were cut into good sizes, making it never too dry for the rice. Overall, this is a must at this restaurant. Try and see for yourself.

Now the rest of the dishes are all worth trying so experiment and get whatever looks good cuz it probably is!
author: Jon W.

description:
okay so their seafood pho noodle soup is absolutely yuMMY, definitely one of the best in SF. 

However, i may not have much credibility as to the taste of the other dishes because I have always been ordering the same dish every sitting, that is #12. 

The food is also pretty cheap, considering how expensive many SF restaurants are.

One problem i did have with this restaurant is that a few of the waitresses seemed to have a bit of an attitude as whenever my family and i would order food there some of them would act pretty hostile as if they were unhappy to be here serving for us.  

Other than that, the restaurant is really good!
author: Don C.

description:
I walk by this place alot and have never taken the time to eat a meal here until last night and I was blown away.  The Beef Stew Soup with Wide Rice noodles was just the ticket on a cold night.  Right away you could taste the purfume of star anise and cloves in the dish.  The stock was remarkable as well, with great flavors and intensely rich.  Sure a bit of base to add some oomph, but very tasty.  

Can't wait to eat through the rest of the menu.
author: Dude D.

description:
Uck.  And yuck.  Sixty-point-nine-seven is not a good percentage, no matter how you look at it.  Here:  60.97 percent.  Or here:  60.97%.  OK, I'll round up:  61 percent.  See?  Still no good.

Yeah, so don't treat your ____ers like ____.  And don't cheat your customers.  All of us deserve better.  I'd like to still enjoy your delicious Thai food, but I have a conscience as well as tastebuds, and there's plenty of great Thai food in this city--Thai food that doesn't involve trickery, deceit, and the potential spread of disease by sick employees.

Thai Time, here I come!
author: John S.

description: If I can I will give them 0 star due to horrible service!! I will remember this forever as long as I live!!! No one serve us for over 10 minutes and we sit down on our own the server humiliated us for sitting down on our own when we ask him for menus!!! We don't deserve this kind of service and we will never go back to this specific location!! How could someone possibly blame us for sitting down on our own! Of course we left after he said such things like that and he gave us that look and said something when we stand up and leave!!!!!!!
author: Sally C.

description: I have never been to this location until a few months ago. I always have heard it was tiny but wow I didn't know it was that small. Three of us came here like about 40 minutes before closing and it was completely empty. We had the place to ourselves but it was pretty quiet. The food was good, better than some of the other locations in SF.
author: Tiff C.

description:
This is one of my to-go-to late-night-eating-places! The service is decent for having to accommodate & deal with a lot of large party under the influence obnoxious peeps!

King of Thai has the most reasonable prices for Thai food in the city! And the portions are huge! I have no specific recommendations for what to eat here because everything I've tried has been good.
author: Alysha K.

description:
Love this place! Have eaten at thai places all across California and this one is at the top with a few others.. even though they are open late they still serve excellent food. Everytime i'm up in the area, i make an attempt to stop by.. 

only negatives things i can say about this place is that they were promoting a mango salad special one evening and when i attempted to order it, they were out of mangos. Also, some of the servers aren't too proficient in english so sometimes there is an english barrier. Also if you may be placed at a table that sends a gush of wind from the door everytime it opens.

would recommend!
author: Tyson T.

description:
Good, authentic taste.  Fast and friendly service.
I always drop by here when I'm looking for a steaming bowl of noodles.  Hit's the spot every time.
author: Robyn S.

description: I've been coming here with my husband for a while and I love it! Food is always tasty and people very nice!
author: corina f.

description:
Main complaint: I hate their bathroom. There's something kinda weird about going into a restroom that's right next to the tables and there's a gap between the door and the frame where you can actually see people in the restaurant. Heavens knows what kind of sounds/smells might come out of there.

Aside from the sketchy bathroom set up and the random bird that flew in, hit the mirror at the back, then flew right back out the door, service is fast and the food is delicious. We had an order of Pad Kee Mao and a peanut sauce with tofu and veggies + rice dish. For fast food cheap Thai, King of Thai is one of the best places to go.
author: Cassandra J.

description:
If I came back I wouldn't come to this location especially because there is one across the street. The place is tiny and you can smell the bathroom from the "front" of the restaurant. 

I was expecting so much more from this place especially because I was in dire need of something to cure my hangover. Typically 4 star restaurants in SF don't fail me, but the noodle soup here was pretty generic, and the curry even more so.

Maybe I should stick to my normal pho-hangover food.
author: Jess C.

description: We were driving by this neighborhood and decided to have dinner at this place. It was a weekend and they were busy. The service from the staff was bad and almost non-exsistent. We ordered chicken rice noodle soup and fish ball rice noodle soup. The food was good. I would not go back there until they improve on the service.
author: Raman S.

description: They always have great food and I love that they are open late. Kad Pao Gai Tod, Tom Yum Gai soup, and Pad Thai here are consistently delicious - I always get them.
author: Chris L.

description: Walked in: no greeting and it says wait to be seated so we stood there waiting no one says anything; so I signal to the guy who's working up at the counter and say outloud can we just sit anywhere? Seeing as there's open tables. He acts as if he needs someone else to seat us although he walks over with a shitty attitude and seats us himself. Mind you they had tables that were busy but mostly everyone in the restaurant had already received their food, we sit down and look at the menus, and after about 5 minutes no one comes and asks us if we'd like anything to drink or if we're ready to order. So we're just sitting there for a good 10 minutes at least with waiters walking around us paying no mind that we were ready to order.
author: Jaime B.

description: The roasted duck noodle soup was one of the best dishes I ever had.  The Penang  Green Curry is rather watery and too spicy -- but that's how it is in some of the rural places in Thailand so maybe they were just going for authenticity.  The white rice wasn't done well or they probably used cheaper Indian rice.  In this case, I didn't really care about these shortcomings because of the great roast duck noodle soup. I equate service in a Thai restaurant with how efficient the staff can keep the cold water coming to put out the flames in your mouth so top marks there.  It's San Francisco so the restaurant looks old and dark and a very loud, out of control, homeless person came in wanting a refund so they had to call the cops on him.  Still -- 5 stars for the great food.
author: Eduard F.

description: Dirty small restaurant, bad cheap food. Unfriendly staff. Their watery, tasteless shrimp curry served on a small, sticky table is as bad as it gets. If you value your health, don't go to that nasty place.
author: Pam J.

description:
I am now a fan of King Thai Noodle House. 

So I was with my sister and a few friends and we wanted to eat somewhere in inner richmond. Sis had a craving for Pad Thai. So we stumbled upon this place. 

At fist glance, King seems pretty meager. Their storefront is like 10ft wide so it is easy to miss and the inside can be cramped. But the food makes up for it. Not only is King cheap, but their serving size is absolutely ridiculous. And the food is pretty solid too. The pad thai was different from what we are used to because they use thinner noodles here. I ordered the pineapple fried rice with chicken and shrimp. It was flavorful and they had a substantial amount of chicken and shrimp. Yup. They don't short change you here by ODing on rice and barely adding chicken/shrimp. 

In short: loads of great food for a reasonable price. It is easy to miss, service is friendly, I recommend that you guys stop by and check it out for yourselves. I will be back sometime.
author: John B.

description: UNBELIEVABLE!  This was the best I've ever had!  I was in SF for 3 days and had to have this place twice!!  It was SOO good!  We had the basil pork (minced) & some coconut based soup with flat rice noodles = OFF THE CHAIN!  My family actually owns a Thai restaurant and this one is actually better.  (Thankfully they're 600 miles away!)  MUST GO if you're in the City.
author: Kimberly N.

description:
Three stars for the brand new look & as always, really good customer service!

Unfortunately, the only meal I get here has gone dry & burnt. Pad Z Ew (they now changed up the menu names as well). Fried rice seemed dry as well, my daughter barely had two bites. My husband, normally gets the Crab fried rice & as he says "good as always." So sorry to knock down my stars, but when your plate is suppose to be full of taste and a little saucy & it was the complete opposite, I can't help but knock it down a bit.
author: Jazzie D.

description: I have been to this place many times and have enjoyed it but today was a whole different story! The server was beyond rude! While taking an order on the phone he kept rolling his eyes like he was just sooo annoyed at the person on the other end. After that, a woman (who was tired of waiting for the server to come get her credit card) came up to pay so that she could be on her way and this guy says: "can't you see I'm on the phone? I'll be right over". This is not the end of my very short experience here today- after waiting for 7 minutes to place an order I tired to get the servers attention and he says: "just wait!!" Seriously? Not ok!! We got up and left! I have to add that on other occasions when I have been here (usually in the evening) the ladies that work here are always up to par in terms of service- that is why this review is not a one star!
author: Maryana P.

description: Bad experience last night call for the order to go and was very clear on the phone I order 2 regular pud thai and 1 spicy ask for the total so I can withdraw exact cash from the atm because they don't accept card. Had my 5 and 2 years old with me so had to get them out and in the car for the atm and picking up the food. When I got there I ask for the order the lady who took my order just said oh you wanted  3... and smile and turn around and serve the people on the table. She wasn't even apologetic. So I told them the third one should be free since you guys messed up my order. But they just told me it's another 8 bucks for third one. So I end up short in cash and food. BAD SERVER & SERVICE! that's all I can say.
author: Qween_Gie S.

description:
The food here was great! First time eating their food, we did take out, but it was hot when we picked it up! The price was very reasonable(32.26) for 4 ordered items. This was more than enough food for two people. 

I recommend this place if you want something quick to pick up.
author: Robert R.

description:
The menus are a bit stickier here and the tables show much more wear than the other Clement Street location, but the food and the service is just as good.  Most of the time I dine over at the 346 location, but on occasion like this afternoon, I do visit this location.

I usually have rice dishes or stir fry noodle dishes here.  Today I had a Pad See Iew with assorted seafood.  Excellent service.  I had the stopwatch going just for fun and my food was ready in less than 3.5 minutes!  Lots of tender calamari, imitation crab meat, sliced fish cake, sliced fish balls and a couple of shrimp with soft rice noodles and Chinese broccoli in a slightly sweet / slightly salted sauce.

There's often a longer wait at this location because it only seats about 24.  A nice, clear flat panel color television sits on the counter and faces the dining area.  The waitress was very cool when somebody asked whether the channel could be switched from MTV to sports programming.  She did so right away.  This restaurant has a clean restroom also!
author: Wilhelm Y.

description:
Was looking for a late dinner and stumbled upon this

4 pieces of thin chicken for $6 nahhhhh
Shared pad thai with husbter and it was okay.
Quality went down since I've bee nhere.  Blah
author: Claire J.

description: Authentic Thai food. Came here at midnight on a Sunday and were still greeted at the door and told to take our time with the menu. My girlfriend is vegetarian and extremely particular about her food. She ordered the #17 and loved it. If you're looking for some midnight Thai that WONT  give you bubble gut, this is your place.
author: Kyle B.

description:
This place is a hole in the wall that serves thai noodle soup, pan fried noodles, curry, and rice plates. One of the few late night options in that area. 

I like their pad thai and their pumpkin curry isn't bad. Everything else I have tried has been mediocre, but I haven't had their noodle soups yet. 

The level of service is what you would expect for a small asian restaurant: negligible.

I prefer the king of thai a few blocks down the street much more.
author: Alfred L.

description: I love to go there! As a student, their reasonable price and delicious food are always my reason to go~
author: Kang N.

description:
You can't go wrong with late night thai in SF... actually you can, but King of Thai Noodle has a few locations throughout SF so you should be safe if you run across one of them. Some things I've tried:
#4 I forgot the name, but it had assorted beef with your choice of flat rice noodles or the thinner ones. VERY good choice, and was made in a jiffy! 
Pad see ew was yummy, but can't go wrong with that!
Prices are decent, service was nice even though I got there 15 minutes before closing. Whew!
author: Alex R.

description:
CHEAP AND GOOD THAI FOOD. Best of all is that the curry comes with the rice and price is still cheaper than other Thai restaurant's solo curry order. AND my usual order of medium spice of pad kee mao always hits the spot... ohh yeahh.

Only negative thing is CASH ONLY. Boo... no 1% or 5% cash back.
author: Pansy L.

description:
I had dinner here and both the food and the service were great!  I've been to the North Beach location, but I like this one much better.

I will return very soon!
author: Kenneth G.

description:
Came here because it was open late and close by (double win).
Food was delicious, fairly priced, and came out fast (triple win). Beware the large portions! Bring friends to share.

however, the movie they were playing on the bigscreen was slightly disturbing to be accompanying a meal. hahaha.
author: Tuwie N.

description: We ordered pumpkin curry with seafood, calamari salad, spicy minced beef with bell-peppers and basil and fried calamari for appetizer. The pumpkin curry was really good. The fried calamari appetizer was OK, a little too sweet for my taste. My dish, the minced beef was super spicy and so was the calamari salad to the extent that we were shedding tears and unable to finish them! We were pretty invisible to the waiters but then again it was 1:30 AM so not much to expect there. Overall, it was OK for late night food but I would probably not go back unless it is past midnight and I am stuck at that part of the town again!
author: Kayvan M.

description:
This King of Thai is a lot better than the other one on Clement (between 4th & 5th). The flavors are good, and portions are very decent, especially for the price point.

I usually get the duck fried rice, or the pad see lew with beef. The place is a bit small, but I always get take-out anyway.
author: Munnie T.

description:
Food is okay. Nothing special about it. Same as other Thai places. Portions are a little smaller than others and if you order the same thing as your other friends, portions are halved. The place is a bit small, and feel like some place in china town. Bathroom has a sliding door that doesn't really lock.

Don't order duck, only gives you skin, no meat.
author: Pak K.

description: The info on this restaurant is wrong - it is named "King's Thai Cuisine", NOT King of Thai Noodle House.  King of Thai is the one that has a location in North Beach and near Union Square.  I like those restaurants, and was disappointed when I got food from here, because it wasn't nearly as good.  The only good thing about this restaurant is that it is open late - but they stop delivery at like 11 or something like that, so if you want to get food late you have to go there.
author: Jon N.

description:
First time I came here was in February 2010 with a group of friends.  I remember I ordered the green curry dish.  From my experience they give you huge serving portions for a price around $8.  Its not bad but I tasted better elsewhere.  Its always busy here especially around night time! We went on a Tuesday night and we had to wait at least 5 minutes for a table.  I don't mind eating here again with a group of friends.  I think its big enough compared to other Thai restaurants I been too.  This is the only K.O.T. not sure how the others are compared to this one.  

Parking is horrible just heads up! You will end up circling around the block and/or parking 2-3 blocks away.

Btw, the good part is that Genki's is next door! =)
author: Sharjah M.

description: This king of thai is still good...There's some changes in the others....
author: Kevin L.

description:
Ugh so stupid. Just ordered delivery. I asked specifically for two different kinds of hot sauce. (I like my food spicy.) I didn't get any! Nor did I get any utensils or napkins! Wtf. 

The time quoted was 45 minutes and they took 1hour and 35 minutes! So mad 

Of course the food sucks w no hot sauce
author: Lisa N.

description: There are several iterations of this place all over SF but from what I heard this is the original.  It's a hole in the wall and a comfortable place to dine alone.  The other menu items are also done very well but most often I do take out to fill my pad thai craving and you really can't beat the price.  Very good and my easy comfort food.
author: J J.

description: The prices certainly went up since the last time I came here. It's no longer is a great value. I suppose with the rent in the city jumping will all the tech people moving in, it is not their fault. The noodles are still great with a lot of flavor. The wonton noodles are always a home run with me.
author: Jeff H.

description: If it's late and you're in the city feeling to eat at a place not so sketchy, this is the place. It's like an average noodle house but the grill pork noodle soup and chow fun there is super. I like that it's open pretty late. The curry isn't super special, so go for the soups.
author: Christine L.

description: King of Thai is a dirty, greasy spoon and I mean that in the most endearing way possible. I usually just get take out. Bf has some kind of attachment to this place and has eaten here a lot more than me, but I digress. I consider it Thai fast food. When you want something quick, cheap and especially when a lot of other places are closed during the late night hours KOTNH is there for you. Staples for me have been Pad Thai, any Basil meat dish and green curry dishes. Good for what it is. 'Nuff said.
author: Liv A.

description:
My personal favorite in Thai food around San Francisco.
have a limited but still large menu  (full menu is at the 2nd location just a couple blocks away) 
They also deliver and the food comes really fast.
The only problem is that they accept only cash... .
author: David V.

description: One of my favorite casual Thai places ever! Don't go because you want service or white tablecloths. Go because you want inexpensive tasty Thai food cooked by actual Thai people. Excellent Pad Thai and fried chicken over fried rice. Great for takeout on those lazy Monday nights. Highly recommend!
author: Stella L.

description: One of the best Thai places on Clement st. In SF. Rad nar has always been my favorite! , been coming here for years and I never get tired of it!
author: Mike P.

description: Had the chefs special, D. Was like chicken in a coconut peanut tai delicious sauce. I don't do tai food much but I would say the flavors were all there. Chile And peanut ,was good, however the chicken was way over done. I understand it's par cooked but hey, don't cook it fully and just warm it. Half cooked chicken does not stay long at all so I understand! This place is open late so they probably don't have a huge dinner rush. I will return.
author: Nathan B.

description:
Only place open on Saturday at 11 pm in this 2block radius strip for a bite to eat but it's not bad for late night food :) K of T has waiters that don't really speak English and communication may be bottleneck-ing but it's fast and good. 

I'm a salad lover so I had the mango salad. I'm soooo glad this was an option at this time a night!! K of T is a franchise in SF so it's pretty consistent. Not as spacious as the one in Union Square.
author: Iris Y.

description: If we're in San Francisco and we're not there for a specific meal, odds are that we'll end up at King of Thai for some meal or another.  Maybe that sounds like a complaint, but it's not.  It's delicious!
author: Mike N.

description:
After King of Thai no. 2 telling us it would be "15 min" wait, we decided to venture down Clement St. because there was no way in hell we were going to be seated in 15 mins.  We were pretty happy that we stumbled upon the original King of Thai!

Super small and mainly used as a take-out place, there are a few tables in the back.  Even though this was the original and the portions were larger, the food wasn't on par compared to the other ones.  The service was horrible...they wouldn't take the empty dishes away even though they were trying to make room for more dishes we ordered.  I would definitely rather go to the one in North Beach instead.
author: Jane N.

description:
I have eaten at their location near Macy's many times and loved it.   However, my experience today was not good at all.

I ordered the Pad See Ew with shrimp.   When the order came I literally had to dig around to find the shrimp.  There were only four tiny shrimp (with tails intact).   The noodles were mushy and there was way too much of the sweet black bean sauce.  I didn't even finish my meal because it was so unappealing.

I got the check and it was $12.40.   I put down my ATM card and the waiter asked if I had cash.  I thought perhaps their credit card machine was down, but no!  If you don't spend at least $15 you have to pay with cash.   

I won't ever return to this restaurant.
author: Mark W.

description: I went for dinner w/friend at the thai restaurant near Macys's shopping mall. We were seated, my friends got served their meals and I waited and waited, i have to call their attention, the have forgotten my order. Food is good, no pricey at all but young fellows servers have to be more attentive.
author: Maddy J.

description: I don't understand why this place has a 4/5 rating. I was in SF the other day and was pretty hungry so I decided to turn to Yelp, like I always do when I'm not familiar with an area. And boy, I was pretty disappointed. Granted, I didn't order anything extravagant since I just ordered a Pad Thai and Pad See Ew, but this was something else. I usually judge a Thai restaurant by their pad thai, because really, it says a lot if a simple dish is good or not. I didn't enjoy how the pad thai was all clumped up in chunks. I've never experienced anything like it. The pad see ew was ALRIGHT, not the best, it was actually pretty dry and not that tasty. No doubt, I've had better.
author: Yannie S.

description: The food here rocks and the service was awesome. This place is a little small but what it lacks in size it makes up with in favor.
author: Annabelle S.

description: I used to come here all the time when I lived nearby 15 years ago. Food is still as tasty as ever and prices are still very meager. Service is still quick and friendly. They renovated the dining area with new art on the walls. Gone are the old photos of the King of Thailand (I always thought the picture of the King looked like Tiger Woods). The only drawback of this place is the bathroom at the end of the dining area. It is a single toilet behind a sliding door. Best option is to get seated nearest to the street!
author: Mike C.

description:
this place is the original King of Thai - i definitely notice a 10% difference from the other king of thai. I love the pad thai here. Avg price for a dish $8-10. 

Open late nights Woo Hoo
author: Thomas C.

description: Abysmal. I was seated, menu closed, ready to order. All the tables already had their food and were taken care of. ABSOLUTELY NO ONE CAME TO TAKE MY ORDER. I heard lots of giggling from the kitchen and no one bothered to check if I was ready to order. Why should they care if a brown boy is ready? They were ready for some white gentrification dollars.
author: Denzo A.

description:
Very good Thai food in San Francisco. 

Has a good selection of pretty authentic Thai dishes (keep in mind, I look for authentic vs. americanized thai restaurants). 

Love that they deliver!
author: John C.

description: You can't beat the prices here. My personal favorite is the coconut soup and the hot and sour soup here. Big portions, delicious, and the cheapest Thai food I have ever had! Sevice isn't so great but for the price and quality you can't beat. I love their food!!
author: Sophie C.

description:
I went to this place after a few of my roommates and friends had a strong craving for Thai food late in the night. The thing I liked this place was that it's open very late... like 3AM. The place had good tasting food and the prices were about average. I ordered the normal Tom Yum Kum with Shrimp because I was craving soup. My other friends ordered noodles, the soup with coconut milk, and fried rice. All-in-all all the food looked really good and tasted really good. I really liked the Tom Yum Kum here. A lot of times I order this soup and it always ends up being too spicy for me to the point where I'm tearing up. But the soup here was fantastic. Spicy enough to give me that kick but at the same time mellow enough where I can handle it. 

Service: The service was pretty positive overall. The guy was very attentive and always responded quickly to all our requests. 

Deco: Kind of tacky... but no biggie. I wasn't a big fan of the bright purple all over the walls.

Music: It was fun eating to the techno music playing in the background. It just made me want to start dancing and fist pumping. I also wish that there was a disco ball in there. 

So, overall I give this restaurant 4 stars. I only removed a star though because for some reason a spider almost fell inside my soup from the ceiling. However, I caught the spider with my soup spoon. I'm sure though that if the spider fell in the soup I probably would have gotten a meal replacement or something. It just irks me too know that spiders and such are falling from the ceiling in this place.
author: Kristen M.

description: Some of the best thai I've found to date. Nothing over 9$ and delicious! The long hours make this place all the more accessible and awesome
author: Michael P.

description:
I lived in San Francisco for nearly 7 years and I went to tis King of Thai at least once a week. They have the best red curry and chicken with cashew nuts. 
I can't find Thai food like it in New York.
author: Karina P.

description: YUM.  Came her with my sis and we shared two dishes... but now I've forgotten which... a curry and something else with a name I didn't recognize, but they were both delicious and tasted like fresh ingredients.  I love the tea, which I'll be looking for to buy for home.  Prices were reasonable, service was good.  Only negative was the wait, but since it was busy I expected that.  Very small, so I could tell from the line that there were lots of takeout orders.  I'll definitely go back.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Me and my Gf often come to this restaurant...food is really good here but the big plus that they open late at the weekend
author: Denis A.

description: Pad khee Mao with beef was fresh, crispy and delicious. Totally affordable, great taste, I'll be comin back
author: Mike K.

description:
Confused as why there is two different names on yelp? 
Anyways, after getting off work, my coworkers and I treated ourselves up with King of Thai. We got there about midnight and the area honestly smells like ish. And when we got inside the place it was crowded because the front is where you can see them cook. It's a small place.
I got Pad Thai and honestly, it was the best one I've ever had.
That amazing meal can surpass the moment I got locked in their bathroom because that's literally how amazing it is.
author: Bernie S.

description: Actually they are open until 1:00 AM, but this place is awesome! I loved their rice dish with fried chicken on top. I saw two guys sitting on the next table eating it, and it looked so good, I asked them what it was, and they told me that it was delicious, so I ordered it. And it was!!! I also ordered the yellow curry dish, which is also very good; I especially liked the curry sauce, which I just poured over the rice. I really liked that they open late because it can be hard to find places that are open this late, and especially for Thai food. I definitely recommend this place for their food.
author: Sam T.

description:
I've been coming here for quite some time but unfortunately it's gone downhill more each time I go. I had dinner there with 2 friends tonight and it just wasn't working for me tonight. 

Red curry chicken-the chicken was overcooked and not tender at all. Flavor was good but what good is that unless you're just going to eat the gravy with rice and not meat.

Pad Thai-very salty & fishy tonight, enough said

Pad Gra Praw with ground pork-meh

Deep-fried boneless chicken breast-you can order this as an appetizer. Tonight it was fried to a horrible death. Being the chicken is cut thin, it's not hard to overcook. 

Probably not coming back here any time soon. So disappointed, no more Thai restaurants that I like anymore :o(

Even the Thai ice tea was bad. I asked for light ice and they must have diluted it to get their money. I make this at home so I need to stop ordering it while I'm out. Ugh
author: May G.

description: Hands down the best Thai noodles. I've been going here when it was still the one and original shop. Every time I have had Thai noodles or rice in Chicago I miss this place and can't wait to get back home and eat their food. Their combination beef noodle soup is still the best I've had and I've had a few in Chicago. I've probably have had half their menu now and nothing has been disappointing. Only go to the original to get your fixing for Thai noodles
author: Reginald W.

description: Quick service and fairly priced food. I had their fried rice and duck curry. The rice had a great aroma along with taste. And the curry was nice and spicy. No need to order up the heat like most places.
author: Jaclyn N.

description:
I really enjoy King of Thai Noodle. I think my favorite part about the restaurant is the name; I always picture a giant noodle sitting on a thrown with a crown. 

The restaurant is VERY small but if you order take out you can watch them cook your food right in front of you! The portion size is average and the price is very reasonable. I don't like how you can't pay with a credit card (that's annoying since it's 2013) but this restaurant is a good reason to carry a bit of extra cash in your wallet. My favorite dish is easily the pineapple fried rice (despite the fact I'm allergic to pineapple). I guess that speaks volumes to the restaurant.
author: Tommy C.

description: The food is good here, but the staff is so rude. They rush you to order or they never come to your table to check on you. I went to the front counter and was asked what I needed. When I told the man at the counter what I needed which was to check if a to go item was ready he left and went and served someone else then he came back and asked what I needed again. I was thinking to myself this is strange. I was at a table with a party of about 6 but I place a separate to go order. I also went back up to ask for a to go box since our server never really came back to our table and the man went under the counter to get it then he came back up and said have your server get it for you. I asked for the to go box again then he gave it to me.
author: Robin R.

description: Those reviews about poor service? Yeah they are real. I was ushered out of the place because i tried to order takeout like 5 minutes before they opened. The place was opened and all the staff was already there. Very nice.
author: Shelly M.

description: Although it's a chain, it doesn't read like chain food. I'd just hit town and was looking for a quick meal near Union Square and happened on King of Thai. I was seated at the wall-facing bar because I was a single, though I wished I'd have gotten a table facing the sidewalk show passing by the window. My seafood Pra Ram arrived so quickly I knew it was properly flash-cooked, and it was delicious: tender, flavorful chunks of shrimp and calamari tossed with crispy vegetables, and in a big portion for a great price. Condiments are nearby and the jars are kept clean, service is quick and efficient and the place is clean and bright.
author: Becky R.

description:
Came here really late one Saturday night and I appreciate their late hours.

I got the red curry and thought it was delicious and it was decently priced. The service was pretty friendly and let people in even when they were very close to closing. The place is pretty clean and presentation was nice. I'd definitely come here again.
author: Chris T.

description:
I should first say that it seems that most San Franciscans have something against restaurant chains. I don't. 

King of that served up a tasty $6 pad thai. 

I have no clue what authentic thai food is, and I may know more about thai cuisine if I ever ventured past pad thai but for the time being that works great for me.

The place isn't anything special as far as decor, but the food was damn good.
author: Carlos A.

description:
The food here always impresses me with it's portion sizes and quality! It's truly comfort food, and I recommend the Pad Thai and the Kao Pad Moo Dang Goon Chiang. The service is fair, and the decor is nothing to write home about, but the food is very tasty and worth it. It's a great place to grab a quick, inexpensive meal. 

Although it's not the best Thai restaurant I have every been to, it definitely fits that niche of a neighborhood restaurant that is fast and easy to get into.
author: Chloe T.

description:
I've been here twice and both times have been delicious. I always get the pad-se-ew (every thai place spells it differently) and it's this dish that I judge the restaurants on. 

Consistent, decent price, quick.
author: Maggie F.

description: This my go to spot for Thai Food. Everything is good here. The staff is friendly. Recommend the Pad See Ew, Nam Took, and fried chicken and fried rice dish is Hella good.
author: David S.

description:
Very fast & attentive service.
Lots of choices.
Cheap. ranging from $6-$9 for a huge plate of anything.
Food is always tasty and hot, usually with food to take home for later.

Only accepts cash.
author: Ash R.

description:
"Umm, wait. Did I accidentally come through the wrong door?"

You literally walk through the kitchen when you first walk through the front door. It's a little odd, but once I made my way to the cozy seating area in the back, with its tacky lavender paint-on-wood-paneling decor, it rounded out my impression of this place. It's far from posh - I mean, they have framed, rhinestone-covered pictures of Thai royalty hanging on the wall, and the tables and chairs look like they're made of plywood. The seating area is so small that everyone is sitting near the restroom door. BUT - I loved it - why you ask? Because it has character.

I ordered the pineapple fried rice ($8.45) and pad thai ($7.25) and two thai iced teas. The pinepple fried rice a small sprinkling of prawns, cashews, onion and tofu served with cucumber and tomato slices. I've never been to Thailand, but it seemed alot more authentic than places like Osha Thai. The noodles on the pad thai were a little thinner than I was used to so they sogged up easily, but it was still savory, spicy and flavorful. That iced tea ($2.50) was a bit too sweet so I mixed in a little of my water to dilute it.

The total bill came to $22 including tax. Not bad at all. AND there were tons of leftovers. 

Bottom line - Hole in the wall with good, cheap Thai food. I would definitely come back.
author: Mariela D.

description: This place opens late which on San Francisco is a rarity. They have a vast menu but I like the big bowls of beef noodle soup. Nice broth and a massive American sized portion. The other noodle dishes are great too, not to mention cheap.
author: May C.

description: Much better experience these days. Came back because a friend was craving a dish. Have to admit that I enjoyed it and the service has improved.
author: S P.

description: Love this place!!! Noodle soups are delicious, especially the combination beef noodle soup! Other items on the menu that I like are pad Thai and duck fried rice! Oh oh and the cashew nut chicken is AMAZEBALLZZ!!!!
author: Keerati C.

description:
make sure you peek who's cooking before you enter,if you see the fat woman on the left and a dark old skinny guy with glasses on the right DON'T GO IN! They're the worst pair chef in that restaurant.both are not friendly,the food taste bad and very small portions.

But if you see the pair of a crop hair style with glasses cook on the left and a cook with hair on the right GO IN! They are super friendly,food tastes great and generous portions! and not just that I noticed if this pair are working the restaurant is always full of customers. TRY IT AND SEE FOR YOURSELF!
author: Ryu K.

description: Got take-out tom yum gai with thin rice noodles and the waitress was really friendly. She took my order and said it would be ready in 10 minutes, but I left for about 5 minutes and it was already ready for me. The place is a bit small and not as clean as it can be, which loses a star. Another star lost because my tom yum gai was a little too sour that day than it usually is. Maybe I should stick to the other King of Thai Noodle down the block.
author: Amanda C.

description: Food is pretty good and the delivery is quick. Great hangover food and you can't go wrong with the Pad Thai or the Pad See Eiw
author: Richie M.

description: Best Thai I've had in San Francisco yet! The food was delicious, came out quickly, and prices were unbelievably low. I had the green curry with chicken and ate every last bite - my husband had a soup dish (couldn't find the name on the menu) that was equally great. An order or two for the fried chicken appetizer may have been placed...and it may have been really, really good tender, white, crispy breast meat for about $3. Not the best atmosphere or friendliest service, but hey, sometimes compromise is necessary.
author: Audrey A.

description: I have reluctantly accepted that one of my favorite 5 star places, this, their original location--which I've been coming here for more than a decade and long before they opened any satellite  locations (which, btw, I always found lacking compared to here)--has slipped to three stars. The signature dish for me has always been the roast duck noodle soup. But the reasons that have kept me coming back have evaporated. The once rich soup with generous chunks of succulent duck with attached dark roasted skin is now a decidedly flavorless broth with a few meager pieces of I-didn't-know-you-could-slice-duck-this-thin, pale (is there white meat on duck??) meat with a yellow skin (was it boiled?). The other item I got for variety, is their larb with rice. The larb hasn't really changed, but the rice....well, they now pre-mound it on plates in front and when you get it is cold, dry and hard on the outside. Yuck. 3 stars for nostalgia.
author: Anthony B.

description:
King of Thai 
....Is not the same at every location.
This king of thai has the most DELICIOUS AND LARGE DISHES 

Price:
The average price for a dish is around $8.00

"Pak Kee Mao" and "Fried Chicken with Fried Rice" are my favorite dishes

Fried Chicken with Fried Rice:
Lightly Battered Fried Chicken with a side of Swee N' Sour Sauce
Ciltrantro tops the perfect tasting fried rice. 

Someone get me a napkin, I'm drooling as I speak 

Dessert: Mango's with Sticksweet rice. 
VERY TASTY - No Lies
**Picture is included**
The mangoes are sliced in perfect thin pieces surrounded a small portion of stickysweet rice with sweet coconut milk drizzled on its top.

If you are not digging the dessert explained...
Then something is wrong with your taste buds :)

King of Thai is also surrounded by many restaurants.
I like the Crepes at Genkis.

Go try those dishes! Or I'll take my review back!
author: Tony C.

description: This review is for this location only! Thus place does it right. Great food, always consistent. Open late 7 days a week. Accepts credit card with a $15 min I think... Service is friendly and decent.  My favorite dish is the Panaang curry.
author: Jangalina J.

description:
Delicious thai food!!

I came here with a few friends and we ordered:
1) Thai Iced Tea  - standard. 
2) Vegetarian Basil Fried Rice (spicy) - Yum! 
3) Vegetarian Pad Kee Mao (spicy) - Yum!

Both entrees had just the right blend of flavor, spice (food was actually spicy which was great), vegetables, and tofu. 

Great prices too, most entrees are around $8.
author: Geetanjali J.

description: Still the best KoT in the city. Looks nicer than it did in the 90's, but the food is the same and delicious. Also open late, which I love love love.
author: Kris F.

description: Still the same cook, same old food and still taste the best! lobe this place! service is good also. I love the basil chicken over rice with fried egg! try it!
author: William C.

description:
I really love the food here. It is so satisfying and exotic - you don't get Thai food in the valley 'burbs!

I recommend the green tofu curry and the hot and sour soup. There's usually always enough for lunch the next day!

Prices range from $6-9 for entrees, which you can usually split.
author: Em L.

description:
The ORIGINAL...and will always be my favorite location of all the Kings, and it's probably the smallest too.  I can't believe I haven't reviewed this place yet and it's been around for YEARS, I must be nuts.  I love watching those long haired boys whip stuff up at the stove, they are so exciting to watch and they are right there when you walk in.
