The #21 never ever gets old for me here - ground beef stir fried with basil is sooooo good with a heap of steaming hot rice.  And adding a fried egg on top just makes it the prize.  The pad thai with shrimp is always a knock out and never disappoints me either.  And don't mistreat those girls who work the tables, they work hard and I never see them complain.

Bonus tip! -- Ever wonder where all the cute guys go eat solo?  They go here.  The last time I was in here I've seen at least 3 separate guys get a single table to themselves and eat solo.  Geez, if I was still single I'd muster up the balls to strike up a conversation with one of them, I'm juuuuuust sayin'...
author: Emy B.

description:
I'm not super familiar with Thai food, but I do know when things taste good.  I came here a couple nights ago because I was in the area it was one of the few places open (around midnight).  I don't remember the name of what I got, it was I believe number 16, some kind of seafood noodle  and it was great.  It was cheap (~$8), tasty and quick.  If you get it to-go as I did, you can watch them cook your food which is kinda neat.  If I'm in the area late at night again I'll definitely stop by again.    

Oh also, it's cash only.
author: Jack M.

description:
Love this place! 
Best Pad Thai I've had so far. I also always order the Green Curry with steamed salmon and it's delicious! Just the right amount of sweetness from the green curry and coconut milk balanced with spice! Love ordering To-Go from here. 
Not sure if we usually order from this one or #2, but wherever we go takes cash only! So be careful! Delicious fresh, you literally see the cooks make your food over the counter. Great take out!
author: Natasha V.

description: Wanted to get my order soon as I sat down but no one was coming by so I just put my hand up to get their attention and and said I'm ready for mu order and the waiter said in a rude tone, "we'll get to you, you don't have to wave your hand at us." We'll, I wasn't waving my hand I just stuck up my hand slightly since there was only 3-4 tables occupied when we got here and thet were pretty much served. So what the heck. I liked the old management.
author: Judy C.

description:
Is king of thai. Dont expect much. usually just order the fried rice with thai ice tea. no complaints about this place. thai chain with decent food for the price. dont expect anything too "authentic"
very friendly service, not in a rush to kick you out compared to other establishments like chinese restaurants.

always willing to go back to any of their restaurants if i dont have any options or dont want to think for dinner.
author: Andi I.

description:
Favorite dishes in order:
1) roast duck noodle soup
2) roast duck leg noodle soup
3) beef balls noodle soup

The portions are just right. I am a small eater, but I almost always finish my food here and feeling bloated afterwards. I also like that you can customize the type of noodle. The servers and owners are all Thai, so they do it right. The bad thing is that they do not take plastic here, which has left us in some bad predicaments before.
author: Jennifer W.

description: King Of Thai has two of the same name on Clement. Love this one. Great pumpkin curry. Duck fried rice.The one on the 300 block of Clement has an awesome Won Ton soup (at a Thai place) choy and generous amount of Chai Siew you can even add noodles. Tasty  Calamari Appetizer!
author: C T.

description: Damn, this place is freaking cheap. 16 people in our party on a Friday night with no reservation, and we still got seated within an hour. Everything is flavored well. It's the flat noodles you want (sauteed superbly). And what a price?! Over 10 dishes, came out to $150 (with gratuity already for 16 people and 2 drinks). Sickness.
author: Danny C.

description: Small place, but pretty decent food. One suggestion is to make the portions a little bigger for the price they cost.
author: Sylvia H.

description:
I couldn't tell the taste difference between this location and the other down the street. Pad see ew was delish, big thick fun noodles, chicken and some greens. The green curry was great too - spicy and flavorful the way I like it. Only issue was ordering it veg I thought I would get at least eggplant as some kind of filler but there wasn't much to it. 

The ambience isn't as nice as the other and it's small. But the price is good ($15.00) and a great take-out location.
author: Jade W.

description:
OK, from the stats chart, it seems like I give out hella 5 stars, and you know what? It's true. I just can't give most places (esp food places) less than 5.

I chose to review this particular K.O.T. cuz it's probably one of my favorites. 

The food here is always fcking great. Thai food is def one of my favorite asian foods, and this place definitely does it justice.

There are so SO so SO SO many thai restaurants in SF and all over the bay area, and most of those places are banal, tarnished bullshit of establishments, it becomes so discouraging to find a place with great thai food. 

Back to this restaurant. I've had the duck noodle soup (yummy uymmy) and the duck over rice (ymmyummy) praram (yummy, even thou i'm not that big of a fan of praram) and pumpkin curry yumm yummy!

Food comes out quick. Servers are nice. Opens late. I don't frequent the richmond area, but when I do for fooooood I always choose THAI FOOD!

:)
author: Bonita C.

description:
"Meh. I've experienced better" definitely describes this location of King of Thai. "Better" (actually great) is located just two blocks down between 4th & 5th. Same chain, but totally different standards. 

My gripes with this place? 
*They definitely have different cooks---quality and taste not there. 
*Much smaller dining area makes for a very cramped dining experience with tables placed very close to one another.
*Even though the other King of Thai isn't necessarily quiet, this location is much louder considering the kitchen is adjacent and open to the seating area.
*The bathroom is right next to the seating area (like you can hear the toilet flush if you're at the table closest to the bathroom door).
author: Valerie F.

description: Solid food ( from my one trip ), fairly cheap. I love the fact that it's open late at night. Will probably go again
author: Karthik K.

description:
This is by-far my favorite Thai place that I've been to. Since I don't live in the city, I don't come here often but every time that I do, I'm never disappointed! I love their pad se ew.. it comes with chinese broccoli! And not many places make it with that, they just use plain broccoli. I've also tried their spicy fried rice, which is also good as well.

A BIG plus is that this place is next to Genki Crepes.. which I super love so you can easily hop on over and get a delicious crepe after your meal.
author: Krystal O.

description:
Love this place! so many great memories of going to USF and stopping by here... they have gotten a litter pricer than before (especially after they remodeled) but they're still amazing!! 

Their starters are super and so are their rice dishes.... Love trying curries, seafood and noodles here... 

A must try!
author: Dale S.

description:
Came here for lunch and was surprised by the format of the restaurant.  Kitchen takes majority of the space, in the front, and you walk past it all to small seating area in the back.  It was very neat, and when you leave, even the cooks say thank you and acknowledge you!  The seating tables on the right are very close to each other, almost as you're with the party next to you.  But we didn't mind that too much, until we got up, and immediately the lady next to us put her dish on our table. o.O!  However, it is very fast service so the turnover is quick.

Was between the nam tok salad and the pad thai, but I decided to try something new-ish.  Nam tok salad is done very differently in different thai restaurants, and sometimes I love it and sometimes I'm not a big fan.  Unfortunately, I was not an entirely big fan of this dish.  The lime dressing was very prominently lime, and lacked more of the spices that I've had in other restaurants, and there was not much cabbage or lettuce to accompany the beef.  The beef itself, however, was cooked delightfully.

My signif ordered yellow curry, and it was good ole curry.  It also comes with rice and a small cucumber and onion salad (not really pickled, but more sweet).  That itself was the better deal in my opinion.

The service was nice (CASH ONLY! and they'll also give you change for a dollar if you need help for the meter) and it was a quaint lunch stop (though Maury playing in the background was entertaining and confusing).  If ever feeling up for it, maybe will stop by and actually try that pad thai.
author: My An V.

description: If you like Thai food this is the place to go to! They are fast, cheap, and delicious! Will be coming back!
author: Lynne G.

description:
My fav spot for Thai style noodle soups.  I always go for their beef stew noodle soup with morning glory, sprouts, cilantro, + their rich and tasty broth.  Extremely satisfying and leaves me searching for something just as good on the Peninsula (haven't found a place to match it yet).  We also had their Pad Si Iew (Fried flat noodles with Chinese Broccoli, egg, and Chicken) - it had great flavor.  We washed it all down with out Thai iced teas.

Other noteworthy items are their pineapple fried rice, fried fish cake, larb salad (super spicy), and chicken satay.

This time around we came on Thanksgiving day since we were running around the city with my daughter and our niece.  We knew that we would hit the jackpot for open restaurants on Clement Street (our old stomping grounds).  Good place for kids also...  I remember coming to this specific spot years back, and if I remember, it was the original.  They have a ton of restaurants sprinkled around SF now (we hit the Taraval Street location more often due to proximity).  We still think this particular spot is the best (must be the chefs).  

The place is small, and easy to miss - a hole in the wall that is a diamond in the rough.  Hats off to their consistency, friendly service, and yummy food.  We will definitely hit this spot whenever we are in the area and in the mood for some good Thai food!
author: Lawrence L.

description:
Pad See Ew!  First had it here and no where else compares.

Likes:  Large portions, tasty and authentic food, great menu selection, very reasonably priced, staff is extremely friendly.

Dislikes:  As with all businesses on Clement St., parking is an issue.  Seating around dinner time can be difficult to come by, sketchy bathroom situation.

Overall:  Awesome, tasty food.  Don't forget the Thai Iced tea!
author: Matt J.

description:
:(

I'm really sad that I'm writing this, but I feel the need to share this with everyone. 

If you love Thai food/King of Thai Noodle House, go to the between 4th and 5th. 

DON'T COME HERE THEY HAVE RATS PROBLEM!!!!!!!!!!!!

The other night my friends and I were walking home from the bars on clement, my friend accidentally kicked something, and it ran into the side door of King of Thai. It was HUGE!!!! They might have a whole rat clan in that kitchen. 

The next night we were walking home again and saw another rat running into the same side door. This happened again last night when we were walking home. We were all horrified and decided not to eat here ever again. 

And plus the food here weren't that great comparing to the other one. This one's smaller/dirtier too. I've definitely gotten sick after eating here, and now I know why. 

Walk a few more blocks and go to the other one!
author: Erica L.

description:
WHAT HAPPENED!?

I used to eat here alot in the past but stopped coming to this location due to a bad incident that occured last year. My girlfriend and I came in here early in the night, around 8PM, to have dinner. It wasn't crowded or anything and seemed relatively slow. Our waitress took our orders: the usual crispy chicken fried rice for me and the pad thai for her. 

My food came first but I wanted to wait for my girlfriend's dish to arrive so that we could eat together. When the waitress brought her dish out, it was not pad thai, rather, a plain rice plate with some beef and veggies. My girlfriend notified the waitress that this was not what she ordered but the waitress insisted that my girlfriend was wrong, and this was exactly what she ordered. This just went back and forth for a few minutes until finally, with a pissed-off attitude, the waitress offered to return the dish and make her the pad thai (that supposedly she didn't order). But at this point, we were both hungry and irritated and seeing how my girlfriend didn't want spit in her food, she just ate the dish. 

After finishing our meal, the waitress gave us the bill which came up to be about $16.50ish. I put down $20 and watched her return to the register but instead of returning to us with the remaining change, I saw her simply drop it into their tip jar. Wow..

Even if I did tip 15%:
16.50 x .15 = $2.48
16.50 + 2.48 = $18.98

Thanks for over-tipping yourselves..
author: Albert L.

description:
Always have the pad see ew (sp?) on my mind when I come to this King of Thai or the one on Taraval (or even downtown). Yeah, it may be a chain but they have some good thai food. You cant really go wrong with anything that you pick here.

If you want to wash down that spicy thai food make sure you order the thai iced tea. 

This place isnt as big as the Taraval location and parking isnt as easy to find but the inside is a lot nicer
author: Tim M.

description: Delicious salmon with green curry plus a seafood salad with shrimp, calamari, scallops, and fish cake. I was so pleased with both dishes. I'll be back!!!
author: Martha N.

description:
This place has been a favorite for about ten years.  There are a few things that are always great--the noodle soups, and the larbs.  I've never had good luck with the wide noodle dishes.  

Good place to introduce kids to Thai food.  The #10 soup is a favorite of my kids--just delicious broth, pork, wontons, and egg noodles.
author: Dave L.

description: Most places were busy @12pm, was with my two kids so give this place a chance when I see no line, than was told no table but I can see clearly there is a table, ask the wait(ass) she pretended to be busy.  They don't want to sever to kids or Chinese, don't bother.
author: Fei W.

description: Decided to try a new spot for lunch. Based on the ratings for the Thai restaurants in the neighborhood I figured it'd be a good choice. I got the pad thai because that was recommended. Not sure why anyone would say their pad thai is famous because it was NOT tasty at all. I will continue getting pad thai from Thai Time right around the corner because it's WAY BETTER!!!!
author: Alesia M.

description:
I have King of Thai at their other locations many times and have alway been a fan so when I found out theres a King of Thai by my place I definitely paid my visit.  This location is significantly smaller and was packed when I went during dinner time so I decided to order to-go.

Here, I ordered the pad see ew with chicken.  The wait to get my food was about 15 minutes despite them having a full house and a line of to-go customers.  As soon as the food came out I went home to dig in before it gets cold and found myself unimpressed.  The pad see ew at their other location was very moist and felt as if portions were bigger.  The chicken and noodles were dry to the point where it was brittle.  Also the chinese brocoli that went in it were obviously the ends of the flowers as they were thick and coarse.

I really hate to even give King of Thai three stars but this time around I was definitely disappointed.  Regardless I will still return to give them another try and their multiple locations.  

As a side note, I really need to start carrying cash with me in the city, but at the same time we're in a city of innovation.  Square, VISA, and other providers now have simple and easy to use credit card readers.

Let's step it up guys.
author: Zhen C.

description:
This's restaurent good for who have small budget for living (simple live)
Food                 =4*
Clean               =3* dinning room and restroom
Atmosphere    =2*  noise,smell,decor
Service             =3*
author: lee s.

description: What happened? Change of ownership? Same number, looks like the same menu, but the signs are changed, and the last order I picked up was terrible.
author: Mark M.

description:
I dislike purple on the walls and the purple uniforms they wear...

I ordered a special dish. BBQ pork + chinese sausage with BBQ sauce over rice. It was as one might expect it to taste at a restaurant; salty, oily, full of MSG, and delicious!

This is a good place to go when you're shopping and you're on a budget. The food comes out fast.
author: Sarah W.

description:
I always enjoy myself at any King of Thai! I love any of them.

Duck friend rice, nom nom!
author: Gerard L.

description: Some dishes were significantly better than others. We loved the Pra Ram and the Green Curry!
author: Milly B.

description:
"i went to king of thai before it was cool"

KOTNH - has become a  successful Thai food chain.  Their food quality and service are consistently good, almost every time i've gone there was no wait and prices are decent.
author: Oleg H.

description:
Pros:  It's open late and the portions are big enough that you practically get two meals for the price of one.  They have pumpkin curry (I love anything with squash).

Cons:  The flavors are too mild.  The curry is never spicy.  The peanut sauce for the satay gai is never peanutty enough.
author: Jenn C.

description:
Beef Pad Kee Mao FTW. 
Finished the entire plate satisfied!
Loved the spicyness and the basil flavor!
YUM YUM! and it's been a while since I've had good thai food too!
author: Eileen Z.

description:
This is my favorite King of Thai location.  On a norm, they are fast, friendly, and courteous.

My go-to's are always: Pad Thai, Pad Sew Ew, or Duck Noodle Soup.

However, I had a change of heart today.  I literally just found a wavy hair buried in my Pad Thai.  I can't even complain to them since it was take out :(

I'm going to boycott for awhile!
author: Judy C.

description: The original King of Thai....oh so good!  According to my buddy who is half Thai, this place is the real deal.  From what we ate, I can't argue.  It was delicious.
author: Dilly M.

description: Pretty good food. I really enjoy the crab cream cheese puffs. Not sure what they are called lol! Spring rolls are good. Good service. Not the best but not the worst. The chicken curry was very good. Fried rice ok. I will eat there again but it is not my favorite.
author: Jacqueline C.

description:
How I never thought to put my two cents about this King Of Thai yet I have about every other one. Weird, isn't it??. But any who.. 

My tummy was grumbling and with my two boys in tow we headed over to this spot right down the block from CPMC hospital. The best thing about being on Clement Street is that you have choices, a variety of spots to satisfy everyone's need but I was craving Thai, so here we are. 

Walked in and my have they remodeled. No longer purple as every other King Of Thai but a dark, cherry oak colour. Smooth, beautiful, cherry oak wooden tables and even matching dishes and utensils to go with the theme. BEAUTIFUL, I likey!! :)

As we were greeted and seated to our table, our sweet and friendly waitress came by to introduce herself and chat with us for a bit. After taking our orders we waited approximately 15 minutes for our dishes bc it was lunch rush with a packed house. 

My how I LOVE their grilled duck noodle soup. Tasty, salty grilled duck with flat rice noodles in a sweet duck herb soup, making this the best tasting combo of sweet and salt :)

We also ordered an order of their Thai Fried Rice with veggies and tofu, no meat. If you haven't tried it, it's a must have!! Garlicy rice cooked with sweet basil, carrots, onions, mushrooms, cabbage and egg for an exotic flavor that will have you devouring it in seconds and wanting more. 

Excellent service from beginning to end, my boys being well behaved and the sun shining makes today's lunch date THE BEST :)
author: Anonymous P.

description:
This is a good place if you want cheap, descent Thai food. The service, however, is terrible (which is why I'm giving 2 stars).

You can never go wrong with the Yellow Curry (it's mildly spicy), Radnar, Pad Thai, or Fried Chicken over Fried Rice. The Fried Banana and Coconut ice cream is also amazing! 

This place isn't the best for large groups, and has terrible service. I've had so many mix ups on my orders (I do go here frequently) and would have to wait 30+ minutes for a new plate. Or my order wasn't ready for take out when they say 20 minutes, and has to wait another 15 because they haven't even made it. The service is why KOT is receiving 2 stars from me.
author: Alexess N.

description: Yummmmm! Fast, fresh and fiery Thai food for pretty cheap. This location has an open kitchen, somewhat dingy interior, cash only and a nastytown bathroom but the food is bomb. The portions could be bigger and have more veggies in the dishes but the prices are fair.
author: Cec D.

description:
Food: 2.5 stars
Service: 3 stars
Value: 3 stars

We needed to have a quick early dinner, so we stopped by this place. If you want some gourmet Thai food with comfortable environment, this is not the right place. King of Thai Noodle House is more a fast food place with affordable price. 

We had a roasted duck noodle soup and a stir fried noodle. I like the strong duck flavor in the soup. But there were only a few very tiny pieces of roasted duck in the soup. The stir fried noodle looked good, but it was too greasy, with cheap ingredients. 

Although the food inside the restaurant smelled good, the taste was okay. It is not good enough for me to go back. One try is enough!
author: F T.

description: Got some takeout, highly recommend the pumpkin curry -- first time trying it, and it was quite a nice surprise. Can't comment on the sitdown experience though, and it doesn't have a popping bar with clientele like the broadway location, but for food this place is quite alright.
author: Christophe C.

description: I downloaded the Yelp app just for this review. I basically paid 10 dollars for brown rice. They gave me 4 fork servings of my "chefs recommendations" meal which came with more brown rice than their side dish quantity of brown rice. Food was cold when I picked up. Thanks but no thanks. Never coming back.
author: Chevalier R.

description:
This is my go-to Thai spot for late night eats after a fun night of bar hopping. This place is always filled with customers and after tasting the food, I can see why.

The dishes we usually always order are the Red Curry and the Pad Kee Mao. The Red Curry is pretty fantastic. It's so spicy and has all the flavors perfected. This dish is really what keeps me coming back for more. The Pad Kee Mao is different from most Thai places I go to -- but tasty nonetheless!

If you are dining in at King of Thai, you'll notice that the food gets served very quickly -- perfect when your late night munchies are kicking in. Or if you're sitting at home, order delivery! They get your food to your house in no time and and will certainly leave you satisfied.
author: Sara K.

description:
The greatest noodle house I have ever been to!!!

I wish I lived in SF because I would be here weekly! This is the go-to place when you are visiting the city. At least it is for me. I can't wait to go in September, wish there was one in Orange County -- Thai Spice DOES NOT COMPARE! 

They have Sriacha sauce at the tables to add the extra kick to your noodles. Awesome! 

There are a few of them throughout the city, they are open late for a drunken munchy, or for a nice lunch.
author: Deborah V.

description: WOW! My boy and I were driving to sf to have dim sum (we are from Santa Rosa) but once we parked I saw a tiny little place called 'King of Thai noodle house" Sat down and saw what the waitresses were taking out to the tables and I was so excited to eat...Ordered Coconut soup which was a huge bowl!!!!  Then I had the Yellow curry and it was HUGE!  My boy had the Pumpkin Curry and for all 3 big portions and a great price...HELL YEA! I wake up craving this place!!!  I am most def coming back!!!  I LOVE THIS THAI PLACE #1.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Great spot if you need some late night dinner. For less than 10 bucks, you can get a filling meal!
author: David L.

description: I probably fell for the most delicious and popular items on the menu, the seafood pad thai and the vegetable pumpkin curry.  I thought these two entrees were cooked to perfection and a great value.  The service was fine and they brought everything including our thai iced teas and waters right away.  I cannot speak for others' food or service experiences, but there were enough good waitresses for a busy Christmas Day crowd and plenty of other good looking things being made in the kitchen.
author: Mark P.

description: Dirt cheap, great service, good food. I ordered a noodle soup and they gave the wrong kind of noodle by mistake. When I pointed that out, the server apologized and get me the correct noodle as an extra order. Great service to make their customers happy.
author: L S.

description: This place is great for basic cheap quick Thai. Not amazing but great value street Thai style. Nothing fancy but good grub.
author: John N.

description:
This place is one of the many chain stores in the Bay Area. Like the others, the food is alright, but not as good as Marnee Thai on Noreiga.

The pad thai is alright but sometimes it's weird how it always sticks together like a big pile of gunk. 

The positives are that it is pretty inexpensive and the food comes out QUICK. I had take out before and they said 10-15 minutes. I found parking really quickly so I walked in after 5 minutes and it was all ready!
author: Wilson T.

description: My and I have been coming here to eat for years, the food here is great, the beef stew noodle #4 & sea food flat fried noodle #17 are my favorites, the service is OK, over all this is a great place for Thai Food.
author: Terry T.

description:
AFTER CLUBBING EATS!!! (2.8)

Those giving a 5 star rating must have rolled into this place drunk as hell, eat the food, and went to sleep smiling. The thing I love about SF, you can eat korean, chinese, american, filipino, and thai food at 2am. There are a few thai spots open and King of Thai is one of them, not the most recommended but its a recommendable place. It's been years and I have returned with the crew after a drunken night out. 

My friends introduced me this place a few years ago (after a drunken night). The first time i came here was delicious and thought this was a pretty good place to eat. I have returned after a drunken night out with some folks. 

The guys that I was with ordered "fried rice with fried chicken" so I'm assuming they give you lots because they were talking about it in the car on the way there and they didn't even bother to look at the menu. I ordered Pineapple fried rice (w/ chicken). Our other friends ordered chicken Phad Thai. 

We were servered right away. The service was on point. Though i didn't think this place had a conservative crowd, the people hear were because we were talking out loud and talking "PG13"-ish and everyone would look our way. What do you expect from late 20's to early 30's just leaving the bar and drunk?! geez. Well anyways...

My Pineapple Fried Rice was ALRIGHT. I only took a few bites because it wasn't as tasteful as I had imagined it to be. It had big chunks of pineapple and shrimp and chicken but it wasn't all that.  It was good but not as tasteful. I had high hopes. I ate some of the "fried rice and fried chicken" and THAT WAS OFF THE HOOK. not the fried rice but the fired chicken cutlets tasted like Japanese fried chicken "karaage". I love karaage so I can definately eat the chicken on it's own because the fried rice wasn't that crack'n. I ate some Phad Thai and that was good. Normal Phad Thai, i enjoyed it more then my fried rice. 

The portions were HUGE and the price was CHEAP. I swear it was like $5-$6 a plate and a ridiculous amount of food was poured onto the plate. Nothing special about the plating, it was just toppled with food.

I took hella left-overs home and the next morning woke up to eat the left-overs. Uhm.... nothing tasted great (except for the fried chicken!). My stomach hurt from eating the left overs. I felt like i brought home food from a chinese hole in the wall place but instead it was thai food. i hate to waste food but a took a few bites and threw it away. I didn't feel good afterwards. 

Price - DIRT cheap
Portion - TOO MUCH
Service - on point
Ambiance - eh, alright

Will I be back? Only if i am drunk as shit and need some greasy food to help me sober up.


Until the next review.....
author: Jane A.

description:
I used to really like this place, but my last experience there was disappointing. I ordered the pad kee mao, which had a lot of veggies in the picture and description -- the result was mostly noodles, some chicken, broccoli, & chiles, and one lonely piece of red bell pepper. My friend ordered the pad thai, which had a slightly weird soapy taste (maybe the sauce was too watery?)
In addition, the food came out slowly and with big gaps in-between, so we had to wait awkwardly for everyone's dishes while some people's food (plus that lonely bell pepper) got colder and sadder.
author: Annie O.

description:
PINEAPPLE. FRIED. RICE. 

It has a funky name at King of Thai, but it's the same dish and it tastes amazing! Seriously, delicious spices/flavors and lots of chicken and shrimp to accompany the amazing rice.
author: Kevin L.

description:
been coming here for years but had not visited for a few years.  last minute decision to go for lunch on Easter really paid off.  especially not having to search for hours to find a parking spot.  pretty much all the same except fresh paint, new decor and tables.  looks nice but i kinda miss the ambiance of dishes written on a strip of paper and stuck on the wall.  i guess they've upscaled the joint a bit.

the important part is the food.  in a word, AWESOME.  between the 3 of us we had two bowls of noodle soup (beef and duck leg).  they were huge.  fish cake.  papaya salad. and sour spicy ground pork.  all were good and pretty authentic to the street food of bangkok.  all very fresh.  we go there so rarely we order more dishes to go.  

definitely one of the best thai place to go in the area.
author: P.Y. H.

description:
Small seating area but great food! Me and my brother went here to eat and I got the spicy noodles and he got the chow fun with tofu and greens. Both were delissssssssss and it's worth trying the other items on the menu.

I also tried the thai iced coffee. Wasn't what I expected from the other places I have tried. Nevertheless, it was ok.

Customer service is friendly and the taste is perfect. Give it a go!
author: Christopher J.

description: This place is awesome. cheap with great thai food. love their pad see ew, and that fried rice. one of the best thai food outlets in sf. Its just cash only but i am in sf and thats something i better get used to.
author: Arvind G.

description:
It always amazes me how ridiculously fast my food comes at King of Thai. I'm convinced they are 1) psychic or 2) have the food sitting in the kitchen and re-heat it upon my order. I'm leaning towards the latter. 

My friends LOVE this place. Why? The portions are HUGE and all plates are under $10. But what I get out of every bite is lots of grease, MSG, and rude service! I've tried this place so many times, because it's open late and all my friends can't get enough of the house specials, #31 & #33. 

Tried them both - not that great! I've also tried the Pad Thai and I never end up eating all of it because it's so salty and the noodles are too soggy for my taste. I think they have the notion that quantity is better than quality. If you want over the top greasy, mediocre Thai Food served in gigantic portions, this is the place for you. If you care about quality, go elsewhere.
author: Linda T.

description:
got the Tom Yum Gai (spicy/sour soup) it was so good

also got Pad Prik Khing, was very good and came with rice. i would have preferred a little more veggies but that is just me 

ordered take-out inside after looking at the menu took less than ten minutes to have it all and the staff was very friendly. 
if you are thirsty i would highly recommend the thai iced tea and thai iced coffee.
author: Adriana L.

description:
Best value for Thai food in San Francisco. I go to King of Thai on Clement at least once a week. 

For the price, flavor, and speed - you can't go wrong and you can't complain. 

Yes, the service is not great, the tea is poor quality, and the food is greasy and somewhat minimal (i.e. little meat in food) but for the price, you get what you pay for.
author: Kennie B.

description:
Solid.  Hole, wall -- in.  Kind of cramped waiting for my takeout.

CASH ONLY.  FYI.

But very delectable Thai food, and as others noted it was ready in approx. 7 minutes.  I would recommend this for take-out for sure.
author: Jon M.

description: Went here last night to satisfy a pad thai craving.  The pad thai was really unusual. I don't know how to describe it,  but it tasted different than what I'm used to back in Seattle.  I don't know if it's an SF thing or just a King's thing. Less sweet maybe?  Lime flavor cooked in instead of having a lime on the side? I didn't love it,  but boyfriend did. They didn't skimp on meat or tofu so that was a plus.
author: Kira F.

description:
Um if it was up to my friend Binder and I we would probably eat here daily.

Everything is good.  I don't think I've ever not liked anything.  And I've had other Thai places, and I don't think any has been as good as here.

Yes it's small, and sometimes not always the cleanest, and there is little to no ambiance, but it's really all about the food here.
author: Denise B.

description: I had pad sie ew that was like it was hand pulled by the lord himself.  Not a fancy place, just superb noodles, cheap, and fast.
author: Henry P.

description:
Depends on who the cook is

Sometimes my pad Thai and fried rice are bomb. 
Sometimes it's just eh

Either way love this place for Togo, delivery, or dine in  and also they open late which is a plus.
author: Quyen T.

description: Big bowl of noodles for super cheap.  Different meat and noodle combos.  Cash only.
author: Matthew P.

description: Gotta LUV King of Thai Noodle! This place sure does not disappoint! I came here a couple late nights in a row after midnight and the meals are delicious as ever! Notable dishes include the Pad Thai and Panang Curry. The fried rice is scrumpty-dumcious! Its fast, easy, and all around delicious!!! Lets not forget the Thai Iced tea also! The last memory I have of this place was eating so much I literally could not walk home immediately. I did walk about 3 blocks and was fine. The place is yummmmay!
author: Erin M.

description: So this place is loved by Yelpers and Zagat rated so I decided, instead of Osha, I'll try out King of Thai Noodle House. I ordered one of the house specials which is the fried chicken over fried rice. It's golden battered and served over egg fried rice. It was really good but portion wise, not enough for me compared to Osha's size. It was probably half the size but oh wells. Maybe I'll come back to try their other items but I hope it's not dinky like my fried rice was.
author: Danster L.

description:
This is a place I will never revisit.
I saw a giant stack of raw chicken breasts next to the stove.
greeted by unsmiling waitress.  didn't get drinks til after food came.  
the food did come out within 5-10 minutes.
ordered pad kee mao with beef.  not what I thought it would be.
the pad kee mao came with skinny green beans, bell peppers, basil, and tiny bits of ground beef.  The texture of the noodles was good, but everything was drenched in oil.  the beans were burnt.  the dish wasn't spicy or flavorful. portion was small.
author: Candy Y.

description:
Friendly, inexpensive and tasty.
With a new baby in the house, we figured we'd order out, and the Pad Thai was good, and the Pra-Rarm was good, and Tom Ka Gai - one of my favorites.  Ordered by 6pm, food was here by 6:30!
We'll order from them again soon!
author: Marcia K.

description: Its a small place but the food is good. Didnt expect much since it was kinda empty, but once we got our food, that changed my mind quickly.
author: Tony D.

description:
FOOD:
Usually get the pad suey... which is satisfying and totally my comfort dish. Forget what else we've gotten before, some curry or other, but I remember everything is pretty much good. Some dishes better than others, but not totally omg awesome, but it's very very RELIABLE. :)

SERVICE:
What? How have I not reviewed this place yet?? Came here many a times - mostly bc it's good late night eats. Service is fine, they refill the hot tea sufficiently and also I've ordered pickup and they had it in a flash.


ATMOSPHERE:
Small, casual, not bad. :) It's interesting to see how the kitchen as you have to walk past it in the front.
author: Angela L.

description: worst service ever!!! There was a mosquito in my noodle soup, the waitress did not even say sorry, and seem very unhappy.
author: Lina L.

description: It's small, but I love coming here with my fiancè! Service is great and food is up to par. It's better than the king of Thai a couple blocks away! I usually order fish cakes, pad gra prow, and pad seew. Comes pretty fast and if you're ordering to go, like most, you can see them make it right in front of you! I recommend :)
author: Kimberlie M.

description:
Pretty sure I ate in, but not sure on the experience given I was completely drunk and it was a long time ago.

But the countless number of times I did call in for take-out, it has been consistently good.

Number 1 is the small hole in the wall with woks right near the entrance... 

Number 2 is down the street, larger and opens late.  

I always get the same thing, and at Number 1, I can say it is consistently better. 

Waiting alongside the wall, watching the cooks prepare my Pad See Ew sub small rice noodles, is a pleasure.  I have always been acknowledged with a smile and a greeting as they fired up my meal before me.  As they sprinkle that MSG all I can think of is a cold beer.

Thanks for the extra 15 lbs. king of thai
author: Brandon T.

description: Busy for dinner service but no wait... one of the cleanest Thai restaurants I've been to. had the shrimp coconut curry which was tasty. Large shrimp to top it off. Pad thai was decent not too sweet.
author: Jerrome S.

description:
I was early for my appointment so i walked around and found this little cute Thai place. The food smelled good and you can see them cooking because their kitchen was by the front door. I ordered spicy pad sa ew chicken for lunch. It left me disappointed.

I love Thai food - I cook Thai food. I know how it should taste! The noodle was plain to me. I think its missing some flavor so I added a ton of hot sauce. I was going to tell them to fix it or add some oyster sauce but I didn't want to be late for my appointment. So, when I took the left over home, I just added some soy sauce for flavor.

The place was small but cozy. The service was decent. The overall experience was just ok for me.

If I have another appointment around that area again, I will give it another try. Depending on the food, I will update my rating.
author: Nokie N.

description: I ordered Pad See Ew and it was ... edible. I suppose. It was a quiet afternoon and the service was great. Just avoid that particular dish.
author: Bianca R.

description:
Food - inexpensive and excellent. I've tried the pad thai, pumpkin red curry, duck curry, seafood noodle soup with red bean sauce and so far, everything's been great. You can't go wrong with their menu. If it were just about the food, this place would have 5 stars from me.

That being said, here's the rest of the story: the place is tiny, cramped and COLD. They leave the door open for ventilation even when it's below 50. There's no noteworthy decor and the dining room actually features a tv on mute. Yeah, if I wanted to eat my dinner in front of a tv I would've stayed home.

The wait staff - completely unhelpful and even rude. I asked what "red bean sauce" was hoping to get an explanation about whether it's hot or included other spices or even if it was supposed to be savory or sweet and all I got was "it's a sauce... made from red bean". Gee, thanks - I totally didn't get that! We weren't even done eating when someone put the bill on our table with no word at all. We felt rushed. Nonetheless, we put money on the little tray (exact change) and kept eating, intending to leave our tip on the table as we exited. When the waitress came back, she counted the money in front of us and frowned, saying "we expect a 10-15% tip here". WHAT?! Who demands a tip?

My advice: save yourself the hassle and just get takeout.
author: Diane Y.

description: Close to my work, so I come here often. Rad Na with chicken and shrimp is delicious. Oh, their Thai style noodle is awesome.
author: Ben B.

description:
a little disappointed with these guys. am used to coming here quite a bit but tonight when i ordered the portion sizes were significantly smaller. 

not to mention the beef noodle soup had NO BEEF and was all tendon (i hate tendon). 

would be great if they were more consistent with portion sizing and gave more proper meat in their dishes.
author: Logan G.

description:
I am really not into Thai food but my friends wanted to come here after nightlife at Academy of Sciences so now I'm reviewing my experience.

Bottom line is that I can't really say anything bad or good about this place. It was kinda like whatever.

I will say that it's in a perfect location near Golden Gate Park and good place to go late at night. I'm not sure what time it closes but it's a cool place to chill post 10PM. It's near other eateries like Genki and some bars like The Bitter End.

Food was good, not great. Service was fair, prices fair. It's just a good place to go at night if you're out of ideas and you're in the area. It also shouldn't be too hard to find parking.

Maybe get a crepe afterward or instead at Genki.
author: Marlon T.

description:
Came here yesterday to satisfy a late-night won ton soup jones. 

Pretty classic BBQ / won ton soup (#10).  No noodles (you can add for $1), clear broth with some kind of greens.  

Broth was a bit too sweet for my taste; I like it mostly savory.  

Generous with the won tons and *really* generous with the BBQ pork.  

Won tons were pork and shrimp, I believe.  There were pretty good (3 stars), but I prefer my wontons to be chewier.  Thin won ton casing, as I like it.  

Overall portion was perfect.  No Won Ton or Soup left behind.  

3 stars for food.  
1 star for late night (they close at 1:30am!!) and pricepoint.
author: Goolie G.

description:
Yes, it is a dive place but the noodle soup was delicious.  A very tiny dive, I might add.  I had the seafood soup with vermicelli.  Added some of their homemade hot sauce, it gave it just the right kick.  The soup was very tasty and flavorful. 

You can have 3 types of noodles.  Just make sure when you order the vermicelli that you say the size you want.  They won't tell you.  I ordered that and got the very small vermicelli.  But the soup ended up still be very good.
author: Ammala B.

description:
I never really liked King Of Thai.

The worst one was on 33rd and Clement (closed) but my friend I kept going back because we would get hungry after playing tennis at the nearby courts.  The waitress was a b*tch to us every time.  Yeah, that's right, I called her the b-word.  And every time we still overtipped her.

Anyway, this one on Clement is not any better.  The service is poor and the food barely makes up for it.  The portions are kind of small compared to other Thai restaurants.  

Travel to Chinatown for Thai Chef.  It's worth it.
author: Vivian H.

description:
Love love love this place. 

This place has always been a favorite of mine. I usually order one of the following: duck fried rice, pad see ew( duck or beef) or Chinese sausage fried rice. Either of them are delicious. 
 

The cost of the plates are about 7 dollars not including tip. But they are definitely worth it. My only qualm is the parking around here is ridiculous. So if you plan to come here bring quarters!
author: Chuck C.

description:
Duck.  Fried.  Rice.  

End of story
author: Sage S.

description:
Good food at a great price! 

We just dropped by for a snack, and ate a full meal for a snack price. Behind the grill was a full dining area bustling with customers, but still we were seated immediately. The server was very polite and attentive, and the food was delicious. 

I ordered Guay Tiew Lord. Well, not really. I ordered menu item 16, because I have no idea how to pronounce it. But look at what it is, and you will see why I wanted it: Sauteed shrimp, dried shrimp, calamari, ground chicken, bean sprouts, green onion slices, sliced black mushrooms, a sweet black soy sauce, on a bed of flat rice noodles. I mean, yum! I was surprised to discover there was absolutely no heat at all in this dish, so extra points for having food everyone can eat. 

My Lady ordered chicken satay. The chicken was grilled without the little skewers, which made it very easy to eat with a fork or chopsticks, however we preferred. The peanut sauce was seriously delicious, and the lightly pickled diced cucumber ditto. No heat here, either. 

Of course we shared both dishes, as we always do in a Thai restaurant. The travel posters were absorbing, and it is always nice to see portraits of the King and Queen. We were both satisfied, spiritually, mentally, and corporeally. 

They are open until 1:00 am, which will be a big plus when we have rushed home from dance class. And that filling meal for 2 was just $17 + tip. Cash only. 

We will be back.
author: David D.

description:
Honestly, I wasn't expecting too much. I just met up my friend in the Richmond district and we decided we were hungry so we walked around and this was the first thing we spotted.

The place looked pretty average on the inside, nothing too special. I decided to get the gong pad yang (I think that's what it was called), which was basically duck curry with pineapples, lychee, basil, bell peppers and basil. I was honestly surprised at how delicious it was. Maybe I was just super hungry, but it definitely hit the spot and I was impressed. And I must add, I am very critical when it comes to Thai curries. 

The only thing stopping me from giving them a 5 star review is because they could have just gotten lucky with this curry. I'm going to have to try their panang curry, pad thai, and pad see ew to truly judge this Thai restaurant. But so far, this is yet another great Thai restaurant in the city.
author: Brent C.

description:
Interesting enough, I really disliked King of Thai when I first tried it, but now I'm a regular at the Clement location.

Duck Noodle Soup.  The end.

OK, so i guess i owe you more of a write up hehe.  It's the broth, it has traditional Chinese spices blended with authentic Thai herbs!  The pieces of duck are a bit on the fatty side but so delish!  The broth is amazing and the veggies are a perfect compliment to the noodles and duck!

If i 'had' to pick something else, the Duck Fried rice is really good, the Pad See Yew and Pad Thai are both quite good.

This is a great late night spot in area, cheap prices and consistently good food.  A while back they didn't take credit cards but now they do, so eat with confidence!
author: Anthony L.

description:
Small and dirty but with fast service. Food? Very meh. Made us a little sick. 

I ordered the yellow curry and it was boring. I know it's not the most elevated thai dish to ever order, but this one was particularly flavorless and flat. It also made my stomach turn just a little. My date had a beef soup (not sure which one exactly) that was so salty he got a massive headache and had to lie down, the poor dear. So, it's cheap, it's a little off-putting, and it's boring... but we may have totally ordered wrong. If I come back, which I don't think I will, I'll get the tom yum, as it was the best looking and smelling thing we saw come out of the kitchen.
author: Erica L.

description: Had lunch to-go today.  No customer service,  employees only stared at me and had to ask for help. Only the cook gave me a smile. Waited forever to get my order taken and waited forever for my food. The portion was small and the curry was only half filled. Asked if I would want a bag with the big order. The lady didn't give me utensils unless I asked. Come on this is a to-go order, you expect me to bring China plates and my silverwarw everywhere I go for take out?
author: Elm E.

description:
If I had to, I would describe it as: Fast Food Thai Food.

Why fast food? The food comes out fast! Served promptly. (we were at least).

BUT, I think it's good thai food because I order the pineapple fried rice. It has such a rich variety of flavors and ingredients: golden raisins, cashews, pineapple, curry flavoring, onions, and more. I always order pineapple fried rice when I go. However, the food is very heavy as it gives me headaches sometimes. 

It's good for a casual lunch. Will come back.
author: Glo Y.

description:
this place has really good food. i had the shrimp fried rice, vegetable pad sew ew and pad thai. all three dishes were tasty and brought to my table soon after we ordered even though the restaurant was pretty full on that halloween's eve. if i were to judge solely on the food and service, this place would receive four stars from me easily. 

now the reason it doesn't receive four stars is because they don't take cards!!!!!!!! i understand why some businesses would choose not to accept credit/check cards but they in turn need to understand why i will not  accept them. when i return to san fran i will not be returning to 'king of thai noodle house." unless i find out they were now consumer-friendly and would allow me to use my visa check card. also, i was told they had amazing crab-fried rice, a dish i had never even heard of before. well they were out of crab, so another deduction for that.
author: Michael G.

description:
The red pumpkin curry is amazing with a sweet and slightly spicy sauce with lots of fresh veggies and roasted pumpkin. 

The pineapple fried rice also had a lot of veggies, chicken and shrimp but it was lacking a bit in the flavor department. 

The place is very small and it's kind of run down in the dining area but the food is good, fresh and there are huge portions for cheap prices.

Good service too!
author: Mister Chub S.

description:
Don't judge me for rating King of Thai Noodle House so highly. Yes, it is chain but that doesn't exactly make it a bad thing. Having said that I want it to be clear I only think the original location on Clement at 8th is worthy of four stars. 

Have a cup of their hot tea. They add pandan leaves that give the tea this aroma that is absolutely intoxicating (pandan is used in lots of Asian sweets for just that reason).

Menu items I really enjoy: beef noodle soup, fish cakes (it's an app but I like it with my meal over rice), any fried rice (they make the best Thai fried rice), and minced chicken with chili and basil.

One last thing (maybe most important) this is my favorite (pretty) cheap eat in the city. About $10 for a very filling meal. Yum!
author: Chanthi L.

description: Kinda crazy of me getting something with curry in it with today being hot, but once I saw it had salmon, I had to get it. I ordered an Emerald Salmon  and chose it to be deep-fried after asking the waitress what she recommended. One taste of the salmon was enough for me to form my opinion that the food was great. Didn't even taste deep-fried to me. Wound up finishing the whole thing, but of course didn't finish up the soup as it was hot outside already. Anyway, I wouldn't mind coming back here again. Too bad it's cash only though.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
I have a biased opinion already.  I rarely go to this place when I'm not 
a) drunk 
b) so hungry that I could my own foot off
c) both.  
It always seems to be that place you end up when pizza sounds too greasy and you're too tired to find another restaurant.

That said, their food is pretty good.  I like eating the duck and bok choy served over rice.  It's very tasty and the food comes out in less than 5 minutes even if the place is packed.  Their vegetarian soup is also quite good although you have to watch out if you're on a date.  It's heavy on the garlic.

I'm pretty sure this place takes cash only.  The upside is that most places in this area only take cash so you usually have cash on hand you when you go.
author: Ashley I.

description: Ordered duck fried rice to go last week. You can tell that they used old oil to cook ( the oil under the rice are black). The whole meal looks like brown rice ( dark color). I don't want to eat "recycle oil". Will not come back again!
author: Alin X.

description: Very disappointed :( I ordered their spicy eggplant (Pad Ma Kuer) with seafood and it had a disgusting after taste. Plus thankfully the portion was too small for a full-priced 10-dollar item. Never going there again. Plus they take cash only or they won't make ur order. On the bright side, customer service was ok :)
author: Ahmed E.

description:
When I was in high school I would always come here for their duck fried rice. One day at work I was craving Pad Thai and this was the only place I found open. 

I must say, I was VERY VERY VERY DISAPPOINTED. I don't know how to explain it but it was just NOT GOOD. I couldn't even eat the whole thing. It just tasted weird.
author: Annie L.

description: Would have given it 4 or 5 stars but the service I received  was horrible. I initially ordered for pickup but I later came in literary like 3mins after I called and asked to change it to eat in. They made a fuss about it, but finally let us change the order. She then threw the menu on the table and it fell on the chair. And it took forever to get our food.
author: Brian F.

description: King of Thai is tiny, nondescript restaurant packed with flavor and uncharacteristically cheap San Francisco pricing. When you want good, solid Thai food (we suggest the Duck Fried Rice or the delicious vegetarian Guay Tew Jae) make the trip to Clement Street. Open late. Always reliable. A place us locals love.
author: Anderson W.

description: No muss, no fuss, just REAL good food. Reminds me greatly of the hawker street food in southeast asia, it's what's in the bowl that matters here!
author: Chloe L.

description:
My favorite Thai place EVER! It is super duper cheap which is good because they only accept cash so make sure you stop at an ATM and have some cash in your wallet. 

Although I've tried tons on the menu, the ones I love the most are the pad thai, fried rice (they are ALL good), satay gai (chicken on a stick haha), tom yum gai, and tom kha gai (thai hot and sour soups). 

The portions are pretty big so we usually order a few and share. Like if there are 3 of us, we order 2 dishes and share, 4 people, then 3 dishes and so on. I also love the tamarind candy they give us along with the check :D
author: Jennifer K.

description:
At least this place avoids bearing the label of "another mediocre Thai restaurant" simply by being putridly awful.  If I want my noodles stuck together, creating massive ribbons of rice dumplings, generously heaped with Penzoil 10W-40, I'll just go to the local frat house.  The base sauce is some icky gooey greasy rendition of crisco mixed with soy and the ehancements seem to be little more than red chili flakes that someone didn't use from their pizza delivery and heaping spoonfuls of MSG.  And I think they stole their fish from one of those sushi display cases. 

But I digress. Awful.
author: Nathan R.

description: Thai food does not sit well with me...I get sore throats from the msg. But the presentation was super nice and overall the food was alright. Not really the KING of thai. I'd want to try better thai places in sf. I think this place is overhyped.
author: Natalie Charlotte W.

description: Used to eat here a lot when it first opened many years ago when the service and good was still good. Moved out of San Francisco and visited SF this year and ate here and ordered the vegetarian pad thai, it was charred with black bits from the wok, it was inedible and I told the waitress but she pulled a face at me and did not offer to make me a new plate and still charged me. She told the cooks in the kitchen and they were laughing. It was unbelievable to see a restaurant do that. I will not go back there again. Big disappointment.
author: C L.

description:
FABULOUS food.

We had the following items:

Guay Tiew Moo Look Chin Pla (No. 5) - Noodles with sliced pork, ground pork, sliced fish cakes, fish ball and bean sprouts in clear chicken soup.  $6.45.

Som Tum (No. 27) - Shredded green papaya with tomatoes, green long bean, ground peanuts, dry shrimp in spicy lime dressing and served with sliced cabbage.  $6.95.

Thai Iced Tea & Coffee.  Each $2.25.

The papaya salad was the BEST one I've had so far.  I know for sure this will be one of my regular spots.  =)
author: Ally C.

description:
DUCK FRIED RICE. 

 i would just leave it at that, cause that's all you really need to know.  but i guess it deserves more of a review than that.  

i don't know what they cook this stuff with and i don't care...it's amazing. 

It's got great flavor and has tons of duck.  You know that feeling when you order "________fried rice" and you get like a smidgen of the "______" which is the whole reason you ordered that particular fried rice to begin with...frustrating right???  you won't get that feeling here, i promise.  They do not skimp on the duck meat or duck skin (mmMMmmM fatty duck skin).  

I like eating my duck fried rice with the vinegar that the peppers are marinating in--it has the perfect spice and tang to cut the greasiness of the duck fat.  you may think it's weird, but don't knock it till you've tired it.  

...am i drooling?

SOOO GOOD.  

There isn't anything here that i love more than the duck friend rice, but there are a few other things that i would recommend: 
-yellow curry
-papaya salad
-fried chicken over rice

Great price, lots of food.  What more could you ask for?
author: Bridget K.

description:
good pad kee mao dishes
asked for hot..omg
really spicy, during whole meal, i had so much sweat, but it was so tasty.
drank two cups of thai iced tea but I loved to eat extra spicy pad kee mao
fried egg rolls is good too
author: Tina L.

description: Used to be good. The first time we got delivery it was fine. The last couple times the food hasn't been as flavorful and I found 3 black hairs in my food. Very unappetizing. I recommend Bangkok 900!
author: Nicole L.

description:
After waiting for a tow truck for two hours, we decided to get some food!

Pad See Lew with beef
Larb with pork
Pumpking Curry with chicken

Delicious.
Delicious.
Delicious.
author: Laura T.

description:
Probably the most overrated place in Richmond. The food is terrible! The taste is not authentic and food is done in a lazy way (Pouring curry sauce over tasteless overcooked boiled meat and vegetables doesn't make it curry. Sorry about that. The sauce itself also tastes like nothing but sugar.) 

Don't get me start on the service. The lady who take the order was very grumpy and rude. She got pissed when we asked how long do we have to wait for the table. She also got extra pissed when we couldn't decide right away what to order. I understand you're busy and tired, but it's your job to now show it off to your customers

The only thing that's good about this place is that it's open until late. Otherwise I have no idea how can anyone rate this place so highly when other Thai restaurants in the neighborhood are mostly in the same price range and taste way better
author: Bobo V.

description:
Came here for lunch and Worst experience ever! 
The food was ok. Like any other Thai food! I love the fact that they serve brown rice. I ordered Panang chicken curry w/ brown rice. Food was a little bland but I was okay with it. Everything went well UNTIL a roaches started to crawl up the wall next to me onto my table. OMG, I freaked out and told the server and he/she said to me, "oh it came for next door, our kitchen is really clean so it's not us!" I can't believe the push the blame to the neighbor! RIDICULOUS! I had bad diarrhea + vommitting. At one point I thought it was mind over matter but when I went to urgent care they told me I was food poison!  This was the only thing I ate all day. Was it worth all it?! Hell No! I would never come here gain!
author: LisaH T.

description: I've only been here once, so I can't speak about their consistency, or lack of. I personally, had a good meal. There were seven of us, and everybody was very happy with their orders. The portions are very generous, and modestly priced, and the food was tasty!
author: Niusha S.

description: I was craving some bomb Thai food so I decided to go here since it was closest to me. To my surprise they have bad customer service. One of the cashiers thought I gave her a fake $20 because it was "old." Until she confirmed with someone else it was legit. She obviously had no familiarity with our new & old bills. I give it 3 stars simply because I love Thai food.
author: Maria G.

description:
Quick and dirty! (like my girls) haha
Tasty and moderately priced thai food. Good for late night eats. I give 3.5 stars.
author: Daniel N.

description:
The Pad Thai was not very good - there was only one small piece of Tofu in it! 

i won't be going back...
author: christina b.

description:
Love it! Super good :)

Only thing is though, that they don't serve sticky rice. Otherwise, their dishes are pretty delicious
author: Sophia J.

description:
The only thing I order when I come to this place is the #10 with rice noodles, wontons, and pork. I can't change my order and I'm addicted to whatever they put in that broth. Its so good. Its even better on a cold, rainy day and you happen to have an upcoming cold.

The only thing they could change is the service...altho I don't expect very much. I have to wave or flag down someone sometimes for their attention because their usually talking among their friends. I don't mind tho for the #10.
author: Nathalie N.

description:
Service is very quick.  On a hot day like today, you feel as if you've been transported into southeast asia.  Equipped with two flat screened plasma televisions, hovering gnats, and John Milan art  (imagine art that evolves from the ideas of Norman Rockwell and Pablo Picasso).  This place is odd.  Cool lavendar walls, and a bathroom in elbow's reach of one of the tables (do not sit there or you'll get grossed out), one might easily become apprehensive of the quality of the food here.

Don't worry.  It's actually very good.  And cheap.

For two, you can have two noodle dishes, hot tea or cold thai ice tea (very good), it'll set you back $16 with tip.

Very good deal for dinner if you are in San Francisco and on a tight budget and would prefer something more cultural instead of the typical extra value meal kind of food you'd get for that price.

Eating tip:  #1. if you're carniverous, try #8 (Guay Tien Ped Yang); then, ask for them to cook a fried egg on top of it (extra 50 cents).  It's very good.

Observational metaphor tip#2: Note that above the toilet room, there's a picture of the king and queen of Thailand.  I wonder if that's a subtle political message about the state of things in Thailand.

If it weren't for the hovering bugs, I'd give this 4 stars; the other star docked off is because it's very tight and too loud to carry a decent conversation.  The food itself is 4 stars.  The #8 dish is 5 stars.
author: Tony U.

description:
Sometimes I can be a bit of a food snob, and claim to only like "local restaurants" and "hole in the walls." But the truth is, some chains are just so damn good! I LOVE THAI FOOD. And while I still prefer Marnee Thai for its more authentic food and classier, calmer ambiance, when I just want some good Thai food for a cheap price I can count on King of Thai. Their pad thai has never disappointed me, the pad see ew is solid, and I recently tried their pumpkin curry and loved it! Coconutty, milky, and spicy, just how I like it. =P 

Fast service, no long waits, and very spacious. If you want your Thai fix, and you want it fast, come here! (The only part that sucks is parking--but you're in San Francisco, what else is new?)
author: Diane G.

description: PUMPKIN CURRY IS THE BOMB... I have never had pumpkin curry before, maybe because the name doesn't sound too appetizing but it is beyond delicious, so reasonably priced and you get your fair share.  If you've never had pumpkin curry... I highly recommend you try it from here!!
author: Kaila H.

description:
My favorite Thai Noodle House in San Francisco! I've been going here for years. 
Highly recommend!
author: Gina V.

description: Clement St. gem!  We loved the Pad Kee Mao!  I love finding a casual spot with affordable and authentic cuisine, and KOTN hit the spot!
author: Kim K.

description: Cheap good Thai Food.  Good Pad Thai, Seafood Salad, Thai Ice Coffee and spice condiments.
author: Harry C.

description:
We got the Wonton soup with BBQ Pork (#10), It was OK, but the wonton actually contained shrimp.

The service was not all that great.  We went in and said that we wanted something to go, the gentleman just handed us a menu and walked away...we were ignored for about 5 minutes.  We had the menu down and looking around, but they just ignored us...if my wife didn't really want to get food there, I would have just walked out.  Finally the guy behind the counter took our order.   Would a simple "Hello" or "Thank you" kill them?

Since it was take out, did not check out restrooms like my other reviews.
author: Jerry W.

description: LOVED IT!!! Go go go best Thai I've had in San Francisco and I'm a born and raised local
author: Kellene R.

description:
SOLID FIVE STAR NOODLE PLACE

Went there with my thai friend a few days ago. Honestly, I haven't heard of this restaurant, didn't expect anything, and didn't know what to order. My thai friend recommended #4 (the beer noodle soup). I ordered that with thick rice noodle. The noodle arrived 5 minutes later. Generous portion!!!Everything is good- soup is good, comes with different parts of beer, thick rice noodle wasn't soggy at all. 

Conclusion- Again, I didn't expect anything when I first walked in and I walked out as the happiest man (in that hour). Now that I looked up this place on yelp and realized it's a 4 star place with tons of reviews. This is definitely one of the best places for noodle. Fair price ($6.50ish), good service, clean place, simple yet classy decor. I'll definitely go back to try out other dishes whenever I go to sf.
author: Henry Y.

description: Used to be good, but they have taken a major nose dive. At my most recent visit, the service was so rude I felt resented for being a customer. It was particularly shameful that with two waitresses working couldn't take care of the maximum of four occupied tables! The service was super slow and negligent (eg they plunked down a large bowl of soup with no individual bowls or spoons until we finally had to ask, never checked in to see how food was, very difficult to get their attention when we needed anything). Veggies used in our food were not fresh and they used the thick fibrous inedible outer skin of the broccoli stalk in our soup. Definitely avoid this place!
author: Ida R.

description: The original King of Thai in SF. This is the place that started them all! It's super small (fits max of 20 people?) compared to the rest but the food is just like the rest of them. Although KoT is not the BEST thai restaurant, I think the chain is the best with fast-food Thai. You can't go wrong with any of their dishes and my favorites are always their noodle soups or their fried chicken fried rice. I don't know what it is about their fried chicken and fried rice, but it's so addicting...and that sweet chili sauce?!...yea...I want some now...total comfort food.
author: Justin L.

description: How did this place win so many awards when they use the same curry mix that anyone can buy from the asian grocery store?
author: Justine L.

description: the roasted suck oodles soup is the best!!! the only thing is the service, they can sometimes be rude but I understand since they are always busy. other than that, can't go wrong with duck soup!
author: Vivian H.

description:
I work a block away from this place, and I often get take-out for lunch here. I have loved everything I have ever ordered- Pad Thai, Red Curry, Tom Yum Gai, Emerald curry with salmon (once it came fried which was very good, although you can get it steamed, as I would have preferred, but the waitress did not offer me the option), Pad Prik Khing, etc. The portions are always big enough that I have enough food for 2 or 3 lunches during the work week. Mmmm, good stuff!

They only take cash, so I would take off a star, but maybe they have a good reason for only taking cash.
author: Amy J.

description: Whenever I have thw need for Thai food, I always come here; its even better than other KOTN branches. Small, but cozy, this place is a gem with the best pumpkin curry around!
author: Cecilia R.

description:
a regular spot in my 'hood.
Always love the Pad Kee Mao, and the Vegetarian soup.  

Cheap, Quick and friendly with good food to boot!

It's not even worth mentioning but the free Tea always makes me feel comfortable.  

Tip: ask for extra veggies
author: Artnok A.

description:
SOOOO GOOD!!

Get the Tom Yum Gai Noodle soup with the thick noodles. I can eat that every day.
author: Alyssa K.

description: Tiny place on Clement street but the service is extremely fast and the food is delicious. I have gotten the chicken pad thai and tom kha gai soup here and the meal was delicious. The only negative thing is that the place is cash only!
author: Karina A.

description:
When you're stumbling after long night of drinking and watching the Lakers lose to the 8th seed, eating good food is a must.   This is the area for late night eats and I was pleasantly surprised how crowded it gets.  Locals definitely know best!

I ordered the classic No. 30- Fried chicken and fried rice.  The portion was outrageous, it was huge!  Can't complain about the prices either.

I definitely need to make a stop here before heading back to Palo Alto.  =)
author: Alexander H.

description:
This place is always packed on the weekends! They're open pretty late too, I think until 2:00am.  Pretty good food and super inexpensive which is a plus.  I usually just get the egg fried rice with tofu and veggies and my bf is a fan of their pad-thai.  The portions are really great for the price, I only order one item and always have left overs.   I usually get take-out (they only take cash).  They're super quick, which is great when you're really hungry!  I've tried their thai iced tea...very delicious.

They also have another King of Thai a few blocks down on Clement, haven't been there, but some people say it's better, but who knows.

If you're looking for quick take-out that is cheap and filling, this is your place!
author: Cherie A.

description: The service here is AMAZINGLY fast. My friends and I usually go to this place because it has fast service and is open late. The portions are huge and the food is priced under $10. They finally accepted credit cards as of a year or two ago. It is a good to go spot if you're hungry and want food right away.
author: Loree T.

description:
Was on a mission to get a yummy dinner off of Clement. My BF and I decided on King of Thai Noodle House...you just can't go wrong with thai. Plus, the restaurant was pretty full for a week night so it must be good.

I love the thai beef noodle soup. Its usually 50/50 chance to find this dish at a thai restaurant but I lucked out -- there were 4 options depending on your choice of beef. You can choose from sliced beef, beef balls, or beef stew, or combo. I chose the combo. The portion was pretty huge...I'd say enough to serve 2. The soup was tasty, but the consistency was a tad bit muddier than I like. 

Overall, the food + service was very nice.
Shrimp Fried Rice (with shrimp fried like tempura batter) - 4/5
Beef Noodle Soup - 4/5
Fish Cakes (good, but a little oily) - 4/5
author: Susan V.

description:
If your dream has always been to stab either one of your two best friends that are allergic with an epi-pen, this is your place to bring them.

Though the food is great with cheap prices, they always screw up and put peanuts in the dishes. As much as I'd love to "have to" stab my friend with an epi-pen if it came down to it while she were shaking or spewing shit out of her mouth, restaurants should not screw up specific requests regarding allergies. -1 star.

On the flip side, they're open till 2 am or some other crazy hour which is great if you like to get drunk at the bars on clement then eat your little drunk heart out.
author: Allen L.

description: they are open late.  they have affordable thai food.  service is awesome.  i usually get the fried rice with deep fried chicken breast with sweet and sour sauce.  that plate is amazing!!!
author: Kurt N.

description:
When I think King of Thai..I think Thai Fast Food. Well...this King of Thai doesn't have the fastest service. From seating to ordering to serving..they were consistently behind. Granted..it was Christmas day and they were probably busier than usual...but from what I can gather not any busier than their Union Square location during any lunch rush.
The food was okay...decent but not fantastic...With so many fantastic restaurants on Clement..this isn't a place I'd visit unless it was a holiday and most other restaurants were closed.
author: Mimi T.

description:
I like their yellow curry, but their pad thai is not that great. The food came out really fast. They also give you a LOT of rice. 

Service was okay. The girls were friendly, but there wasn't much service.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
This review is for the delivery food. 
The dinner we ordered came within the reasonable time frame  for delivery:  about 30 minutes. We ordered tom yum gui, pumpkin curry with salmon and pad see ew with beef. The soup and the noodle dishes were fine. Not great but not bad for delivery food. But instead of pumpkin curry we got something that taste like panang curry and not at all good.  Won't be ordering from this place again.
author: Sandra H.

description:
So disappointed with KoTNH. Perhaps we didn't order the right things... the hubs ordered the roast duck over rice and I had the beef stew noodle soup. The soup broth was okay, interesting flavor (not exactly what I was hoping for...was wanting more like the Chinese/Taiwanese beef noodle soup broth). And there was literally like 4 tiny pieces of beef! At $7, I get more beef in typical Pho joints. The roast duck was flavorful, but the rice used seemed like it was "left over" rice, a bit dry and clumpy. 

Perhaps next time, we'll stick to Thai dishes like Pad Thai or something...
author: Jane T.

description:
What a shame! Service is OK, portions are large and prices are low, but we had a nasty case of food poisoning from our recent trip here - very disappointing!!!
And if the food doesn't make you sick, the decor will.  Excess purple does NOT aid digestion!!
author: Izzy A.

description:
Man.. I love this place. The only plate I get here at King of Thai is the specialty item #37, fried rice with fried chicken. It is the absolute best plate here, and I get it every single time. No other plate on the menu can even come close to the tremendousness of this plate. It is delicious. Ever since my discovery of this item on the menu in 8th grade, Presidio Middle School, I've been shaking in my boots each time I am about to wolf it down. The fried rice, though very easy to make, is salted lightly; in combination with the fluffy eggs make for sum real yum yum in my tum tum. The chicken is very crispy on the outside, and very tender on the inside. Unlike your regular chicken katsu, the chicken actually has flavor on the inside as well. This plate is very good, especially since it is under 10 bucks. It literally calls for some nom nom nom

-wifive-
author: simon k.

description:
Haven't been to these place for more than 4+ years. 
Food is getting better, perhaps I was hungry also. 
Anyway, we had:
= Crab fried rice - fresh crab meat and not too salty and Oily. Highly recommended.
= Pak see Ew - It's similar to chinese chow fun but it taste fantastic. Not Oily, not stick together, not over cook. it has heavier taste compared to crab fried rice.
= Tod Mun - very good. we all like it.
= roast duck in Yellow curry - Again like Pak See Ew, very heavy in taste. It may be too sweet for some people but the coconut flavor inside the sauce made it a perfect blend.
author: George W.

description: Staying open past midnight on a Sunday night? Score!! Great customer service, the food was fresh and the white rice was plentiful. You can't beat an $8 dish no matter what you get. Definitely making this a regular occurrence, as Clement street is absolutely a ghost town at this time of the night. Nom Nom. Only downfall, Sprite is the most refreshing drink you're going to get, no cerveza:(
author: Justin B.

description:
When I first came here I say wow I like it. Then each time I came back I liked it less and less. The feeling of a chain restaurant like Olive Garden where certain distinct flavors are just missing; people are trained to follow a recipe thus making a copy of a copy. 

Don't think I will ever go back to any of The King of Thai's.
author: M C.

description:
A pretty solid, standard thai place.  So I prefer that the North Beach King of Thai offers $5 entrees, but for a buck or two more here, you do get larger portions.  

The dining area is pretty small, so I don't know if there is a peak time here, but on a rainy Friday afternoon we didn't have trouble getting a table.  We shared the green curry, pad kee mao, and a garlic chicken over rice, as well as chicken satay and larb appetizers.  While some compromises were made in terms of meats and sauces so as to appeal to all of us dining, I'd say the food was pretty standard and tasty.  

I think we'll dine here more often since it's not too far from work and the prices are very reasonable.  We didn't think we'd finish all our food between the 3 of us, but we managed, and then I was so full I didn't need dinner, so that's good, right? 

Friendly staff, pretty extensive menu compared to other King of Thai's, and tasty fresh dishes for a good price.
author: Anne Marie B.

description:
Fast! Fresh! Cheap! 

Fish cakes. Pumpkin chicken curry. Shrimp pad thai. Ohhh...M-G! 

They do late nite!
author: Shree R.

description:
This is a hole in the wall, but the food is great.  Also, whether you get take out or eat there, the order is served so quickly.
