My favorite appetizer is the fried chicken wings.  They are crispy, sweet, and spicy.  Sooo good, especially after a night of drinking.  The noodle dishes are also all very good, but my favorite dish is the Tom kha gai soup.  The soup is huuuuuge, and is loaded with chicken.  It is spicy and has a good coconut flavor.  I can't get enough of it.

Another upside to this place: it is open until 2:00 a.m.  Awesome.
author: David S.

description:
This place is awesome..

I'm a huge fan of King of Thai and i know whats good and not..

I would say this King of Thai is Okay compared to the one at  Taraval .

My friends and I agreed that King of Thai Tarval got the best food out of all King of Thai restaurant in the city.
author: irwin v.

description:
The original restaurant is just as good as it's counterpart #2, but inside it's a cozier location.  If you're looking for a place to sit during lunch, its like a freeway at 6pm traffic, bumper to bumper. Weekends are much better depending on the time you go.  

I decided to drive up to the city this evening and go to this location on the way to pick something up from a friend.  Finding a parking space at 7:30pm was horrendous.  But after deliberation, I finally found a spot adjacent to the restaurant.  The menu items are the same as the other Clement Street location and we ordered Guay Tiew Yan Ta Fo, Pad See Iew beef, and Poh Pier Tod.  The pad see iew was a bit salty for my taste today and I had to drink lots of water to cleanse my taste buds. The noodle soup was just right and the fried egg rolls was still freshly fried when they served it.  It was too much food and we ended up taking some home for lunch tomorrow.

Overall, the service was quick, friendly and food came out piping hot, especially if you know how to speak Thai.  The only drawback was the cramped space, tables that did not align well together, and were different heights.  I think this location needs a major overhaul on their flooring and seats, and it feels like a hole in the wall.  But then again, the food is cheap enough not to complain and make a big fuss.  Next time, I'll just go back down the way to #2.
author: Hogan W.

description:
My husband and I eat Thai food A LOT. Religiously. We were both loving this place. As soon as we walked in the door, we were seated. My husband speaks Thai (he loves practicing) so the servers all conversed with him. We ordered and the food came out FAST. 

I ordered the pad kraw prow (It was the noodle version)
YUMMY!

My husband ordered the Garlic Pepper Chicken - Thai Gai Tod Kratiem Prik Tai
He hasn't had this the real way since he left Thailand and he said, "They made this right! They sauted the pork instead of deep frying or boiling."

I liked mine better, but they were both tasty.

We've been twice now and love their food and service.
author: Kristin P.

description: Not all King of Thai Noodles are created equally. This location in particular is the best of all King of Thai Noodles spread out in the city. I don't think they have messed up my order not once, and I have been here maybe 30-40 times. Their service is quick and usually very friendly as well. The only down fall is that this location is very small, so seating may be an issue.
author: Dan B.

description:
Cheap, affordable, fresh, and delicious! 

The flavors are wonderful, and the food comes out fast, hot and freshly prepared. We ordered the #15 and #34, a chow fun-like dish with beef and chinese broccoli and a fried rice dish with duck. It was rich, yummy, and the veggies were tender but still had a crispness to them. 

  This would be my ideal choice for post-drinking grub!
author: Kristen S.

description:
King of Thai is great for what it is. The food here is great for the price. Appreciate that it's open til 2 am. Also love that it delivers. 

Don't love that only one location serves the mango and sticky rice dish and the one that delivers doesn't carry it :( I love my mango sticky rice...

Pad Thai and Chicken Pad See yoo (sp?) are always safe bets
author: An-Nhien L.

description:
My parents and I used to come in for dinner every friday night. Today, we still come if there's nothing to eat at home and we are just near the restaurant. 

The service for this restaurant is excellent. When you order your meal, your meal comes to your table within 3 minutes. However this depends on what you order and how busy the restaurant is, but service is still considered pretty good. 

The food is delicious. What I recommend? Just about anything on the menu! Be aware that some of the meals are spicy, so when you order ask how spicy it is so you won't burn yourself like i did when I ordered one of the Chef's Specials. lolz

The downside is that the payment is only by CASH. So be ready to give cash when your check comes. the prices are fairly cheap!!!

I highly recommend eating at King of Thai if you want to try something new. The restaurant is open until 1:00 AM, so if you are on Clement Street trying to find a place to eat late at night, then this is the restaurant.
author: Henry D.

description: KTNH on clement has always been spot on. Good serving and also so fresh even at 3AM in the morning. The food always comes out so fast and the service is pretty good. I have never eaten here on regular hours, but I am sure it would be enjoyable as well. I usually get their duck fried rice here. The best thing about this place is that they do not skimp on the duck. Instead of the usual skin and  a beak you get quality duck meat. It is like this across the board here  with all the dishes here. The bathroom are clean, but the locks don't work so well. There have been many times when people walked in on me when I was doing my business. As I have nothing to be ashamed off it never really bothered me. There is always plenty of parking around here as well and a lot of options for boba or dessert in the area. If you have to eat king of thai then eat here.
author: Kyaw L.

description:
My gf and I just flew in from a crazy weekend in Vegas and as you would imagine, we were in dire need of a good bowl of pho. It was around 10:30pm and to our surprise, we could NOT find one pho restaurant that was open. Cruising down Clement, and browsing our limited options, we decided that a Thai restaurant should have noodle soups that would do the job. We ordered a chicken soup with small rice noodles and a pad see ew because I never go to thai restaurant w/o ordering this dish. We shared the two dishes since we both needed the soup and the pad see ew was just too good to pass up. The noodle soup obviously wasn't pho but it did the job and def. hit the spot. The pad see ew was delicious as well and was not over bearing with gravy like some other spots I've been to. I ended up bringing the pad see home for lunch the next day and it was still good. Def a fan and will be back!

*nom nom*
author: Steve H.

description:
Perhaps not the first choice for a first date, but definitely a place to frequent regularly with friends, this small restaurant seating less than 20 lacks atmosphere and ambiance.  However (and a big however), King of Thai makes up for it in food! ... and VALUE!!  

My party ordered:

- vegetable panang curry
- golden pumpkin chicken curry
- pad tai
- beef salad

Three entrees + one salad + one thai ice tea = $38!  Unbelievable value and more than enough food for three people.  While not the best Thai food in the city, delicious and cheap enough to make this a regular place to visit.  The star of our meal had to be the curries (both pumpkin and panang curry).  I would definitely recommend this place for those looking for serious value and good thai food.
author: Brian S.

description:
Make no mistake, this  is somewhere between a dive and a hole-in-the-wall.  But the food is TASTY and the service fast and friendly.  Oh yea, and they're open at 10PM.

Four of us noshed and were out of there at around $40.  

It's now on my short list.
author: Ken B.

description: This was the first time in which I received bad service.  First of all the servers were not attentive to my table at all. Secondly, there were people who were seated after me that had gotten their food first. I had also ordered the spring rolls after waiting for about a half an hour, the server comes back and tells me that they had ran out for the evening. This is of course after the people after me got theirs. I won't be going there for a while.
author: Tiffany M.

description:
The "King of Thai Noodle" must be going through some hard times.

I would have thought with all his majesty would have more regal standards for his noodle house but maybe not. What I do know is that the guy really loves the color purple as in "let's color the restaurant several different shades of purple because I decree it is a most royal hue." The color purple was so prevalent that I swear if you stare at it enough you'll see Oprah Winfrey. Maybe it was an illusion like those "Magic Eye" posters. But it makes you think that the King of Thai probably never read Alice Walker's novel or otherwise he may have considered a different color...maybe fuchsia pink. 

Anyway, the point is the color draws you into this little restaurant on Clement St. and it works because with all the different little restaurants (several with "people love us on Yelp" stickers) adorning the street it can be overwhelming. We chose this one and it was a decent Thai place but I wasn't going ga-ga for it like the locals do in their reviews. 

Food:
I had ordered from the Chef's Special section of the menu and had the Pra-Rarm ($7.75) which came with a choice of chicken, beef, or pork and I chose chicken. Perhaps I should have had beef instead but this dish was just good but not great. The curry peanut sauce that they pour over this dish is pretty good but it didn't really work with the chicken. I also got to try the "Golden Pumpkin" plate ($8.45 Seafood style/ $7.75 normally) and this was again good but not great.  The name Golden Pumpkin conjured up anticipation for something regal but the GP was just flat. The best dish of the lunch was the Gang Khew Warn (green curry) at $8.25...i guess you could say it was "Gang"-ster (word play). This was served seafood style with shrimp, calimari, imitation crab meat, and sliced fish cakes and was the spicy but not too spicy and was the most flavorful overall. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/YYQX-gJhJ6cFzzIhRWjaFA?select=YBgGkrkaVbV3ZwpdwNu4Fg

Drinks:
As far as beverages go, apparently the King has digestion problems because when we ordered the Green Hele-Blue Boy Syrup ($2.25) for funsies...it ended up tasting like green pepto-bismol. Take a look: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/YYQX-gJhJ6cFzzIhRWjaFA?select=SyGKGIxnJneGISTQ8voMuA
The Thai Iced Tea was good though.

-A couple of final notes. I like how they play up the whole royal theme (or maybe it was coincidence) with the flat screen TV playing "Shanghai Knights" starring Jackie Chan and Owen Wilson. Talk about two people with weird noses. 
-They offer free delivery. 
-Parking is pretty bad. It's hard to find a spot near the restaurant or even just a spot in general. I ended up having to scarf down the three dishes and the Thai Iced Tea to avoid the meter maid's wrath.
-It's a small place so the bathroom is conjoined with the dining area. It's not too noticeable except the door is a sliding door that's broken. It often took two to three people just to pry it open.

This is an interesting little place that unfortunately, based on first impressions (fair prices, okay food), was not as majestic as it's name.
author: Matthew T.

description: I went here with a friend for lunch and got the cashew chicken w/ rice special The chicken was great. It is fried and then sauteed with a tasty sauce. We also got the pineapple fried rice and the soup w/ vermicelli noodles. Super spicy so watch out! Great place for lunch. Super small. Only 6 tables of 4 persons. Also a "standing" area for patrons to eat if the don't mind standing. Original and first KOT. Much better than the location down the street.
author: Katie Anne N.

description: This place is small but their plates are well priced, their food is delicious, and they give large portions. Another plus is that they're open late.
author: Natalie N.

description: This is possibly the best yellow curry I've had so far in the city. I stopped in on a weeknight to place a takeout order and it was ready in 10 minutes. Awesome. It has kind of a weird set up so I wouldn't like sitting down here as much, but takeout, insanely good.
author: Lauren C.

description: Extremely fast Thai place.  Always loved the Pad Kee Mao, Pad Thai, and Yellow Curry.  If you are ever in a hurry for Thai food, this I'd the place to go.  Even if you are not in a hurry, the ambiance is superb for a nice sit down.  The one at this location is probably the largest out of all of the locations in San Francisco, so it is extra spacious in terms of sitting room.  Ohh, it's late now, and I'm hungry for KOT right now!!!
author: David P.

description: This place is great for late night munchies. My favorite dish would have to be pumpkin curry. It sweet, buttery, and spicy. My second favorite is the Thai noodles. They're pretty fast in cooking the food. Most of the dishes are under $10 and the taste would never let you down.
author: Richard C.

description:
Yuk, watery yellow curry, the worst unflavored watered down curry sauce ever. 
For 8.00 there was 2- yes 2 pieces about 1 inch long of chicken in the yellow chicken curry.
The pad thai was not good at all, over cooked, the shrimp were fan-tailed tough and over-cooked.
Yuk, take out sucks from this place - what a waste of cash-ola
author: Pug P.

description: Having eaten thai food all my life I came to SF wanting to try different foods but was bent on confusion that i gave up and found King of Thai Noodle on clemente St. in the Richmond district of SF, what i first thought was wow they are not only Zagat rated but loved on yelp so a must try i suppose. Came in to see what a small restaurant but quite the nice to-go thai food place. Sitting down me and family had tom yum kung AKA a soup with spices and shrimp that is packed full of flavor which is what they have achieved. Pad thai on the other hand felt mediocre and was loaded with too many bean sprouts in my opinion. dont remember the other dishes we had ordered but overall not a bad experience at all. only thing was this restaurant is way too cramped to even fit 4 per table so don't come if you have more than 4 people.
author: Melvin G.

description:
I've honestly had way better!!! I think Osha Thai on Geary is way better then this place!!! I'm From LA and Thai Food out there is awesome so I have a high expectation for good Thai Food, and people were telling me that king Of Thai Noodle is awesome! I respectfully disagree!!

I just think its standard Thai Food, everything I order was ok, I was just hungry after my flight so I ate it!  The papaya salad was weak, had a bland kinda sweet taste to it.  Tom Yum was ok, curry was ok, etc etc etc. 

Anways I probably would never go back to any King of Thai Noodle when I'm back up in SF! Because SF is the Shietttttt!!!
author: Freddy S.

description:
The decor of this place is hideous, but as uninviting as the outside of this place looked, I wasn't left with many choices around 11 pm on a Friday night, so my friends and i walked in. 

Upon setting foot in this restaurant, I noticed the kitchen immediately to my right. Hmm, a bit odd, but also re-assuring to know the food being prepared for you is within your field of vision (not that it's all that big a deal to me, I'm no prick when it comes to interactions with people responsible for my food). The next thing I notice is the interior...purple, lavender, whatever...I thought Barney the dinosaur was responsible for this mess. 

Our waitress appeared  shortly after we sat, and came with 4 waters in hand for my friends and I. We ordered 2 plates of Pad Thai. The noodles arrived, and that distinct aroma that is pad thai wafted through my nostrils and  cleared all apprehensive thoughts about the purple, the kitchen being misplaced and Barney the dinosaur. 

Needless to say, the taste surpassed well beyond my expecations. I couldn't have been a happier food-patron late in the evening of a friday night. King of Thai, we must re-unite soon....if only i didn't live 45 minutes away.
author: Nick C.

description:
GREAT Thai Fast Food, but far from being Authentic. When you need a late night place to eat after partying in SF, I recommend this place! The service is fast and the quality of food is satisfactory. #31 Fried Chicken over Fried Rice is one my favorite dishes, but try and stay away from the Chicken Curry, no flavor what so ever! ugh. I thought their curry would have big flavor, but I guess I was wrong. 

If you need a quick fix for Thai Food, then 'King of Thai Noodle House' is for you. If your a 'Fine dining Foodies' then you might think twice....
author: Oliver D.

description: Recently remodeled, so some of the original feeling of being in a hole-in-the-wall is gone, but there are still only about ten tables in the whole place. The food is still awesome and the hours conducive to a late meal. Just make sure to go to #2 a few blocks down if you want dessert. This place doesn't have any of the sweets.
author: Lucius M.

description: This review is for the 1st & original location on 639 Clement. Tried other locations, all were good to very good, but this is where it all began and still is the best one! You have to order any of the noodle dishes with spicy beef broth (#1-#4) with morning glory. This is the most complex and beef-iest tasting broth I've had in SF...better than even the best Pho broth out there. I always order the small rice noodles as my choice. We also love the duck noodle soup, pad thai, pad see ew, fried stuffed tofu appetizer, pineapple rice, and duck fried rice. The only reason for 1 star less is that it is cash only!
author: H E.

description: I have been to this place a few times and still crave their Tom yum soup!! Favorite place to do take out during the week!
author: Anna B.

description:
King of Thai Noodle House they have to many locations in SF city!

l like this location is the best l came here every time l would like to have BOAT NOODLE soup it's good. This area the parking lot is always full load take me around 10 or 15 mi to get in this King of Thai Noodle House!!!
author: Mary P.

description: Food was great! The service was terrible. Our server was acting very rude. We called him over and he answered by saying "what" very rudely like if he didnt want to be here.Disrespectful server.
author: Genelle G.

description:
I ordered Green curry with pork. 
I had never eaten green curry with pork, but their pork was so dry. 
My friend ordered fried rice with chicken. 
the chicken was better than pork, but it was dry too.
author: Clarya C.

description:
I was in a hurry for a quick lunch and since there were empty tables,  I jumped in to give the food a try.  They have specials posted on the wall, all around $8/plate. I ordered the standard Pad Thai ($7.25) noodle which consisted of very thin rice noodles, topped with 5 shrimps, some scrambled eggs and chunks of tofu and a pile of raw bean sprouts on the side.  It was OK, not great, didn't leave me craving for more.  If I wasn't running around town, I'd order the Thai iced tea just like the woman next to me.  I wasn't in the mood to be looking for a toilet when the caffeine hits.  Speaking of toilets.  Their unisex single toilet is in the back of the restaurant with a sliding door.   

They serve noodle soup, stir-fried noodle, rice plates, salads, appetizers, soup, curries and 4 house specials and 9 Chef's specials.  Most dishes were $6-$9.  Service was quick.
author: Ry T.

description: The purple restaurant is my nickname for this place. The Thai food is pretty good and they're open late! Only downside is it's above average prices for food. Service here is kind of so so. They usually only have one or two waiters/waitresses working the late night shift so if it gets busy, it's hard to flag down someone. This place gets a 3.5 stars in my book.
author: Steven B.

description:
Parking: parking is horrible , this joint is located the heart of Clement street. Expect to take10-35 mins to find parking.
Impression: Clean and bright
Food: Roasted duck fried rice (good and consistent) and Rad Nar w/ Beef (flat rice noodle with gravy) was a little bland. the sauce could use a lil kick to it.
Drinks: Thai Iced Tea (a little watered down)
Portion: Sizable per person.
Service: Quick and friendly. The food arrived 5-10 mins after we ordered
author: Rebecca L.

description:
Wow, yummy.
-- -- -- --

My old roommate is new to this neighborhood, asked what I was in the mood for, I said "Thai" and she knew exactly where to bring me.

-  This place is in a very easy-to-get-to location.

-  The food is delicious.  I got pineapple fried rice with chicken and cashews, she got chicken fried rice.  Both entrees were really tasty.  The serving sizes were extremely generous.  Neither entrees skimped on the chicken.

I'm at a bit of a loss because the service was really fast, and normally that means heating up pre-cooked food or half-ass cooking which results in lack of flavor, but that didn't happen here.  I mean, I don't know what they do in the kitchen, but they end up serving a really delicious meal.
-- -- -- --

I am for sure coming back here.
author: Seema S.

description: I was so happy when I discovered this place, as it is very authentic in its flavors and dishes.  There Gao Prao properly uses thai basil and ground/minced meat, and had good flavor.  Their pineapple fried rice is awesome.  Osha's pad thai is better, but King of Thai's is still good.  It's all very reasonably priced, and it's open late.  Just don't come looking for alcohol or to pay with a credit card.
author: Scott E.

description: Best Thai we have had in SF EVER!  Bright flavors, wonderful service, delicious in every way!  Pad Thai Chicken and Beef Laab to DIE for!  Don't miss this one!  Prices are low as well, 2 for lunch was $26 w/tip!
author: Howard L.

description:
I have been coming to this place for 10 years +.

I have to say that the food is always consistent. I always order the same thing I am a creature of habits. 

The staff is friendly and supper nice. 

The place is rather small.  If you drive too fast you will miss it. 

 I always order her fried rice with chicken and the flat noodles with vegies and beef.
author: Kathryn W.

description:
Its. So. Purple. In. Here. Woooooow.

Aside from the color scheme, the food here is good. I think I got the roast duck noodle soup. The duck was good, the duck SKIN was AMAZING (arguably more important than the meat itself), and the noodles were OK. The soup was constructed in a way that eating the first half of the dish satisfies all the right places in your greedy stomach, but the oil and saltiness ends up being really heavy and overwhelming at the end. 

The price is over average considering the food you get, but considering the area, i'm not complaining. The place seems legit and I would consider this place a solid contender to visit when you absolutely need Thai food.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Another spot i discovered this spot back in 03 after open mics right down the street, they have  the bomb  chicken & shrimp fried rice,.....specially after a night of getting mangled! 
  Update,
 I went back late in this summer (August) & STILL have the same flavor! 
  Recipe is down to the t!!!!!! 
    I highly recommend this spot to anyone who's around the Richmond district parlaying the night away...looking for some late night grub!
author: Mario S.

description:
It is cash only. 
If it weren't for that I would give them 5 stars. The food was great. I had the lemon grass, coconut milk soup and put some rice in it. It was amazing.
author: Michael R.

description:
Ding! Ding! Ding! THEY DELIVER!!

King of Thai is one of my default take-outs restaurants. My favorites? #15 Pad Bee Law #34 Kad Pad Pao.
author: Crystal S.

description:
I was lucky enough to go here during work and today i decided to order something different. I ordered the beef stew with vermicelli.  I usually order a curry dish or pad thai but today I was feeling bold.  
The bowl of soup came out fast and piping hot. All the flavors and smells were on point. 
When you get here, request a table far away from the bathroom door. You might get a good whiff of someone's #2.
I happened to see a poor lady lose her appetite after someone finished and didn't close the sliding door completely.
CASH ONLY!
author: Dennis d.

description: I really wanted to like this place. I had high hopes because it's open late and walking distance from my apartment. But, it was just terrible. I ordered Kao Moo Dang (roasted red pork & chinese sausage over white rice). First of all, watched them microwave it right in front of me.. and it was really just gross. Even the chinese sausage, which are pretty hard to mess up, were below average and only edible when doused with their sauce. Would've given no stars but the girl who put together my order was really sweet. I'm hopeful that I just ordered the wrong thing, maybe I should go back for the curry sometime. I hate to be hater!
author: Katie P.

description:
Real authentic Thai food that I can appreciate. I can't even count how many guys I've brought to this restaurant for the last 9 years. I bet those waitresses think I'm some kind of pimp but this is my go-to place to bring my guy friends or sometimes dates when I can't think of any other place off the top of my head. Oh well, I feel no shame...

Parking here's a biatch but somehow, I always find parking close by. It was meant to be. This location has plenty of room so you never have to wait. The one in Union Square, however, is packed like sardines so good luck. The staff members are more sweet here, but that's probably because there isn't as much traffic of people so they aren't as rushed. There is absolutely no ambiance so don't expect anything.

The food is great. The dishes I really love are the Pad See Ew with chicken and tofu and I put some of their hot sauce in there for a little zing. I also love their eggplant and rice dish and their fried rice with pork! Never ever leave without getting the ice cream and bananas! Good food, plentiful, and great price! Oh, and the owners are doing a new thing... there's posters all around saying that your first Thai Iced Tea is on the house cause of the sucky economy haha 

If you decide to come here, go to this location, not the one in Union Square cause it's packed there!
author: Lucky N.

description: Best fried rice EVER!!! I was at cpmc not wanting to satiate my palate with hospital food...turning to help, I felt like thai food. A short walk in the inner sunset crappy weather I discover this place....and I notice it by the purple walls....I love king of thai noodle in the financial district....I brought this thai good back to the hospital to the wife who was very lightly contracting....after eating the spicy chicken fried rice....her water broke!  EVEN the baby wanted to eat their fried rice!!!!
author: Shel D.

description: Um. I believe the expression is fckn awesome. The best thai food I've had in the city. Sure you can go to upscale fusion joints but hardcore home made family style and it's consistent?? Superbly delicious mouth watering awesomeness. What else do you need to know? BRING ON CILANTRO!
author: Jon H.

description:
I love this place!! Always room to get a quick bite and enjoy some good company with friend. Heres what I get.

The Pad thai is awesome. I ask for a combination. really nice seafood and noodles. 

The number 30 fried chicken and fried rice!! This is the best!!! must try this when eating here. 

The duck with the chinese sausage is very tasty as well with the fried rice. crispy duck and delicious fried rice. prepare to use your hands.

The spring rolls are just ok. nothing fancy but they are tasty. 

Thai tea is very nice. although their iced coffee tasted stale and old??

other wise for their noodles and rice plate dishes especially the chicken and fried rice?? This place is the place to go.. open late as well!  Enjoy friends.
author: Joseph G.

description:
I haven't been to this place since my college years (pre-Yelp). I remembered ordering #16, 17, and 18 and I finally re-visited the original King of Thai and they haven't changed the order of their menu, which was GREAT!

I ordered #16 which was a seafood mix with stir fry flat noodles, ground chicken, bean sprouts, tofu bits, and onions. It came out hot and delish. My girlfriend ordered #15 which was similar to mine but hers had a more smokey taste from the noodles, kind of like beef chow fun. It came with seafood all stir fried.

The place had friendly staff and attentive as they kept filling up my glass of water. It's a very small place so I can see it being packed in no time. I think capacity is like 20 people is my guess. That's how small it is.

We went during the the weekday and around 7 pm and was able to be seated without the wait. I highly recommend this place.
author: Hayden P.

description: GREAT hole in the wall. The atmosphere is 2 star but the food and kind staff rate a 7 so they get 5 stars. Good price for good food and it's open after 11pm! Beats pizza by a mile.
author: A S.

description: Place is small, service is quick.  I came here today for #16, a seafood dish over Fat Flat rice noodles with a special soy sauce.  When i ordered it during lunch time, they said they ran out of Flat noodles and try the skinny noodles cuz it tastes the same.  I tried it anyways....i knew it wouldnt taste the same and it didnt....kinda walked out disappointed.....
author: Hugh L.

description:
My wife and I always come here because of the taste of their food.
My disappointment  came when I visited tonight, the lady who took my order was seem so unfriendly. She didn't even put tissue in my to-go order.
One more thing, she told me that they don't accept dimes or nickels.
author: Lance I.

description: Say what you want about this place...  I LOVE IT!  I think you get what you pay for both portion and quality wise.  The crab fried rice, the tom yum soup, pad see ew, pad thai...  all the standards are good...  PLUS i love that it's open late...  It's a MUST when im in the Bay.
author: Jaba O.

description:
The Fried Rice was typical and not very substantial - not many ingredients other than rice itself was included. The Pad Thai was not good. It did not taste authentic, the noodles all stuck together and were almost soggy soft, and it was basically just noodles - none of that peanuts, bean sprouts business.

Unimpressive food but the ladies sure are smokin'.
author: Lilian W.

description: My favorite is the eggplant with chicken, but dont get me wrong, the curries are delish on those cold nights and the pad see eww is great when you are craving carbs!  Make sure to get some of the pickled jalapenos too!
author: Anna L.

description: I love this place for 11 PM Veggie Pad Kee Mao Runs.
author: James O.

description:
Why does Thai food sound so good at 1am? Because King of Thai stays open late! 

Pad thai? YUMMMMMMM. This is where I learned to love pad thai. It is sooo tasty! Their chicken dish is also delicious (#37). I have only gotten either of those two entrees in the over 30 times I've been here during my college years. Why switch it up when you can consistently eat something yummy? I do prefer the pad thai plate over the chicken plate and this is saying a lot because I RARELY eat pad thai. I usually save my Thai cravings for their curries but not here! 

It should be named King of Pad Thai. ;)
author: Stephanie P.

description: Been going to this place from last 3 years. The food is fast and good. Even the name has changed in last few months the quality is same. My favorite is Pad Thai and Pineapple fried rice.
author: Dhiren P.

description: I cam here after a dragon boat practice at Lake Merced. We were tired, hungry, and wanted warm food. All 15 of us took up just about the entire little restaurant and the waitresses attended to us immediately. Everything was so fast! We ordered and the food was out in no time. Most of us got the pahd thai. It's a good amount of food- but holyyyy bean sprouts. I like bean sprouts and all but they give you A LOT. Other than that, everything went well. It won't be the BEST Thai food you'll ever eat, but not bad.
author: Sally C.

description: I've only been to this place once, but I have nothing but good things to say. We were a larger group and within just a few minutes of ordering, we all had our food. And it was delicious! The server was friendly, the place was clean and accommodating. I'm looking forward to going back.
author: Julia S.

description:
This place was okay.  Not too great, not too shabby.  It makes for a quick lunch around the corner (if you work or live around here), but I felt somewhat cramped in there, and the place wasn't the cleanest.

I judge all Thai restaurants by their Pad See-Ew, and this one was moderately good.  I'd have to say that I was disappointed with the prices - for the type of restaurant, you'd expect cheap, good food in big portions.  However, it was a moderately-priced restaurant with decent food.

Service was okay.  I recommend walking down two blocks to the King of Thai #2 though.  Somehow that place tasted better, even though they had the exact same stuff.
author: Tori S.

description:
i had a weird noodle soup today. the clear broth was red. something out of the kool-aid color school. the seafood included surimi (which is fake crab). after dousing it with the table condiments of garlic and jalapenos, it was edible. my recommendation is to skip this dish and stay with the beef noodle soup or the pork noodles soup. this one looked like a 5 year experimented in science class. 
and failed.
author: Jeff W.

description: Fast, cheap, friendly and good! What more do you need?
author: Tim C.

description: Ordered duck fried rice but there weren't any meat. ONLY DUCK SKINS. Not worth paying alomst $10 to eat DUCK SKINS. This place is more expensive than other king of thai places.
author: ice m.

description:
I went to this place after a few of my roommates and friends had a strong craving for Thai food late in the night. The thing I liked this place was that it's open very late... like 3AM. The place had good tasting food and the prices were about average. I ordered the normal Tom Yum Kum with Shrimp because I was craving soup. My other friends ordered noodles, the soup with coconut milk, and fried rice. All-in-all all the food looked really good and tasted really good. I really liked the Tom Yum Kum here. A lot of times I order this soup and it always ends up being too spicy for me to the point where I'm tearing up. But the soup here was fantastic. Spicy enough to give me that kick but at the same time mellow enough where I can handle it. 

Service: The service was pretty positive overall. The guy was very attentive and always responded quickly to all our requests. 

Deco: Kind of tacky... but no biggie. I wasn't a big fan of the bright purple all over the walls.

Music: It was fun eating to the techno music playing in the background. It just made me want to start dancing and fist pumping. I also wish that there was a disco ball in there. 

So, overall I give this restaurant 4 stars. I only removed a star though because for some reason a spider almost fell inside my soup from the ceiling. However, I caught the spider with my soup spoon. I'm sure though that if the spider fell in the soup I probably would have gotten a meal replacement or something. It just irks me too know that spiders and such are falling from the ceiling in this place.
author: Kristen M.

description:
We frequent all the King of Thai Noodle shops around San Francisco but this one the most.  Why?  The noodles.  I know, I know, you think I'm crazy but I swear this place has the freshest noodles in their Pad Sie Ewew.  Love it.  I've tried most everything as have the kiddos and our friends and never were let down.  

Parking is the only issue but that applies to everything else on this street.  Love walking down the street after looking at all the other things/stores.

I read some reviews that say no Visa/MasterCard?  Huh?  I pay every time with mine.  Not sure whats wrong with yours..  :)
author: LeftCoast Y.

description: This place is the perfect quick stop for Thai. Delicious food, wonderful + polite service, extremely fast. Walk in, order, and be out the door in under 7 minutes. There's a reason they have so many good reviews. Also, open late!
author: Charles G.

description: My friend and I went here on 10-31-12 1:15am'sh, after singing karaoke at the rockit room. We both ordered the pad thai (surprisingly good) and reasonably priced.  I haven't tried anything else yet (probably more in the future). The waitress is courteous.  Note: I was fortunate to have a good chef----I do know that not others will have the same experience.  Always depends on the skilled/experienced individuals
author: Jer W.

description:
You know how a lot of Thai restaurants are empty, and that kinda hinders the experience, should you be so inclined to eat there in the first place? They're all "restaurant" restaurants, with dimmed lights and kitchens in the back.

Screw that.

I was first taken to King of Thai a few years ago, when I hardly knew the joys of Clement Street. Ever since that first fateful visit, this place has been my favorite go-to Thai in the city.

King of Thai lays it all out. To get in, you walk by the kitchen, and you'll notice two or three people, hard at work, shaken up the woks.

There are about six tables. I'd guess room for about 15 diners at a time. But I've never had to wait.

The menu is full of all the familiar standbys: Pad kee mow, pad see eiw, pad thai, red, green, yellow curry. There's a nice selection of salady appetizers, most with at least one interesting, unconventional ingredient, like green papaya.

Then there are the chef's specials. In my experience, pumpkin is commonly found at Thai restaurants, but no one serves it up like King of Thai. Golden Pumpkin has one of those magical, of-unknown-origin, amazing flavors that makes you want to keep eating after you've licked the bowl. Okay, TMI.

The point is, there's no pretense at King of Thai. Sit down, order, talk, eat.

And the best part? It's kind of ridiculously cheap. Drinks, appetizer, main dishes for two people will be about $17.

Oh, and the other best thing: They deliver.
author: Jeff H.

description: We were there last night for dinner and we ordered a specific soup called "Coconut cream soup with noodles and shrimp" and the wrong soup was brought to us.  We asked again to bring the soup again but instead the waiter, and the two chef came to our table to ask us what was wrong with the soup and we explained to them that we were given the wrong soup but the main chef kept arguing with us while we were eating and made our experience horrible!!! She told us not to come back again!!!  I strongly recommend not to go there!!! Unfortunately the waiter(s) can't even understand what you're ordering!!!   They need to know how to speak English correctly and provide good customer service!!!
author: Emily R.

description:
Screw all the fancy Thai food restaurants and come to KOT!  Hole in the wall, cheap, and prolly the best Thai food restaurant you'll find in the Bay Area.  There's also one down the street open late for your late night yearnings.

**Vegetarian friendly
author: Cesar Thomas V.

description: When I lived in Pac Heights I would go to the Noodle House at least once a week, they arguably serve the best Thai Noodle soup outside of Thailand.  I still have not found anything as delicious in the US, take it from a guy that used to live in one of the best food city in the world!
author: Mike L.

description: It's fine and I don't think they care to be anything more. Eliminating an extra star for their impersonal, hurry up and order and eat and get out of here service. Ordering delivery - a huge pain and that's after consistently having to call back after being hung up on.
author: Rocky B.

description:
Disclaimer: The place is a bit of a dive.

Claimer:  Best soups I've had ever (and I've stayed at the Mandarin Oriental in Bangkok).  They did a magnificent job on the beef stew as well as the various shrimp soups, which my family and I had various rice noodles. I'd gone for the Pad Thai (and was unimpressed because it was soggy rather than drier) but swooped up the stews and soups that others had ordered. Sumptuous. Restaurants like these do not do everything well but what they do well . . . is so well done!
author: W G.

description:
Late night Thai food = for the win.

I came by here after hanging out at the Rockit Room. Right before heading back to my sister's apartment, we stopped by King of Thai Noodle House to have something in our stomachs to go with our alcohol intake.

I had the pad see iew with beef, which was really greasy, but enough to make my tummy happy. The crab fried rice that my sister and my boyfriend had tasted a bit better than my pad see iew. I wish I got that instead of the pad see iew. The food was good, nonetheless.

If you do come out here, it's cash only. It also gets crowded quick, even at late hours. Luckily, we were able to snag a table for 4 right after a party left. Win!

I wish I got to enjoy my thai iced tea, though. Note to self: alcohol + thai iced tea = not a good mix for me ;x
author: Mylene A.

description: Cheap delicious thai food --- and awesome for watching sports! I watched the world series here with all my friends.
author: Shivani S.

description: Great place to get some fast thai food after a long night of drinking. The price is cheap and the service is pretty good. The staff here is nice and friendly.
author: Anthony V.

description:
The night a Chinese man saved my life

Me: "Oh my god I'm so drrrunk and hungry.  Really hungry"
Me: "Drue, why don't you have any food in your fridge?"
Me: " Why does the 540 Club always smell like dirty ass?"


(Enter Ed M. with bags and bags of food)
http://eddo.yelp.com

Me: "Ed where did you get all of this soup from? I thought you were in the bathroom"
Me: "How did you get all of this food on your moped?"
Me:  "Noodle-ey soup is the perfect late-late night food"
author: R M.

description:
well,
I used to go there a lot.
I liked it.
But, since my son found a worm in the noodle soup,
Fxxx ! 
That is it.
Can't take it any more.
Thank God we did not die.
All of us must to know that when you are in the restaurant, 
you really don't know what you eating.
author: Nobu K.

description: You really could not ask for more from this tiny place.  It's tasty, cheap, open late, and they are quick!  I have come in late and starving after a night of dancing and I've come in on the way home for dinner looking for a quick meal.  It's always delicious and fresh.
author: Erika W.

description: Good food at rock-bottom prices. And the portions are huge, so it's easy to share. I split a noodle entree and a thai iced tea with a friend and had dinner in SF for 2 people for less that $20 (and a full belly) - hard to beat that.
author: Laralynne B.

description: As far as I can tell, this is the location that for years USED to be The King of Thai Noodle House - that was a great Thai place, and never had an off tasting dish there. Last two times I went there, I noticed something had changed. The layout looked the same (though the outside was no longer the mauve color it had been for as long as I remember), but the name is now The King's Thai Cuisine, sounding like a change of ownership. Either way, the last two times the food tasted decidedly different, and NOT in a good way. What a shame :-(.
author: Rob S.

description:
We were wandering down Clement Street looking for a steaming bowl of hot noodles and soup and found King Thai.

Seating was pretty tight especially with trying to maneuver our stroller into the restaurant but the waitress let us park ourselves in the corner so we wouldn't be in anyone's way.

The restaurant didn't seem very clean and I felt like I needed to wipe down our utensils before eating. Service was SUPER QUICK! From the moment our waitress took our order, another waiter suddenly appeared at our table with our food in less than 5 minutes!

My husband and I shared an order of pumpkin curry with chicken and the roasted duck noodle soup with thin rice vermicelli. The pumpkin curry was pretty spicy and the chunks of pumpkin seemed unevenly cooked (some were soft and some were firm). The curry sauce was sweet and very coconutty. The roasted duck noodle soup was okay. My husband was impressed that they gave us pretty lean pieces of duck meat (instead of pawning off the fatty pieces with skin) and enjoyed the flavor of the soup. To me, the soup tasted like they put a ton of oyster sauce in it. Wouldn't order either dish again.

Overall, not too impressed with this restaurant as I've had better Thai food elsewhere.
author: Allison Q.

description: affordable menu. i had pineapple fried rice with cashews and chicken. i can make that at home. the restaurant is open late so that's why we went. it's a nice offering for clement st. i don't know what to think of king of thai and it's prolific presence in san francisco. i think it is successful and people go there. i am chinese and thai food is not too different from chinese food, but the menu is more friendly to americans.
author: Denise C.

description:
What is it with me always getting hit on by guys. I try to dress well, but I'm far from Metro. I'm not effeminate. I don't have the macho YMCA Village people look going on. I'm just me. Ok, so I can wear pink and pull it off without being a Jack McFarland queen. Hmmph!

I guess I got Ga(y)me and I shouldn't complain. i just need to figure out how to flip it and get the LADIES not LADY-BOYS to go Cuckoo for my CoCo Puffs. 

Why am I telling you this? Well, I was getting hit on pretty badly in the lavender restaurant known as King of Thai on Wednesday night. I mean, I was with two girls and another guy. 

Nonetheless, KOTNH is the best for late night foodies. It's inexpensive, quick, open late, yummy, and lavender.
author: Kevo M.

description:
Last night I was discussing how I always feel the need to write a review once I visit a place.  I don't wait to get inspired, I don't wait to visit the place twice most times, I don't wait for the funny.  I just feel, as a Yelper, that it is my civic duty to review the places I go.  Funny or no funny, people want to read what I write.  I tend to live in a fantasy world most days, and kid myself into thinking that my opinions matter. 

With that being said, King of Thai noodle is a chain.  There are a ton of them throughout the city...this one being smaller than most.  The food hit the spot for sure, and the Pad See Ew, Red Duck Curry and the salad we ordered (i believe it was the #22, but i cant remember the name.) was great too.  Then the bill came.  $22 for three of us to pretty much leave the restaurant about to give birth to little Thai babies....that's great!  Procreating for cheap!  Awesome.  If i had to pick one word to describe this place...consistent.
author: Lauren F.

description: Good late night Asian food places are always hard to find, but this King of Thai stays open late and serves up a great meal to satisfy your cravings. The space is teeny and I'd say parties with over 6 people should beware.
author: Theresa D.

description:
FREE DELIVERY!!...

...if you live in the Richmond.

I had the golden pumpkin special last night at home, in my hoodie and soft pants, and it was even more delicious because of that.

Osha's got nothing on KoT.
author: Tara R.

description:
I have a habit of drinking heavily in the Inner Richmond area. Specifically 540 Club. When I drink, the anorexic in me dies a little and the fat kid takes over. I want grease. I want carbs. And I want it all RIGHT NOW.

I have a habit of asking my man to do my bidding for me in the booze-fueled 540 feedfest department. This is okay since I've noticed he's always starving at 540 Club for some reason. And he's usually very helpful and tends to pick things I wouldn't normally go for. 

Several times now, he's satisfied my ravenous hunger with King of Thai. Now I don't know how good the food is if you're sober but it's some damn fine grub after a few strong vodka sodas. The tofu pad thai had another Yelper and I face-down in the take-out container a week or two ago. Last night's chicken-peanut creation had me wishing I wasn't on a diet. Portions are huge and the King is FAST! Really, really fast. Which is good, because if drunky AK has to wait for food, she's likely to cut a bitch.
author: Autumn K.

description: What to day about their thai menu that has not been said by other yelpers! Love the place! The heat of the curries; the freshness of the ingredients which you can see from the counter if you order to take out like I do. The noodle dishes are outstanding, specially #17. Give the Chef specials a try. You will not regret it.
author: Frank B.

description: Great Thai food. They've tailored it for American tastes. Ask them to put less salt and sugar and make it Thai spicy if you want to taste the real Thailand.
author: T C.

description:
One of the few Thai places I have tried, and it is great! The only thing I'd wish for is more food, as sometimes I feel there isn't enough to fill me :)
I almost always get the Kao Nar Ped (roast duck over rice) when I go and am never disappointed! The Pad Thai flat noodles are also great. Let's just say you can never go wrong with this place!
author: Herman H.

description: I LOVE HOW CHEAP THE thai food around this richmond area is.. Ive been to three different ones here.. and they were all good.. its like they are competing with each other so they put their prices as low as possible.. Nevermind how cheap it is.. it freaking taste like the best thai food you'll ever eat.. it is soo GOOD.. I would definetely recomment this place...
author: Sean P.

description:
All hail the King of motherf#$@in' Thai. Fast, cheap, ridiculously huge portions of tasty Thai food until the wee hours of the morning. 

I am your loyal subject.

So much so that my friend Zoe and I once ate there three consecutive nights in a row after 1:00 AM, or thereabouts. Kinda disgusting, but I said I was a loyal subject...

I'm a little scared of what goes on in that kitchen that allows them to make food that tastes that decent, that quickly, that cheap. I get scared in those types of situations. But I'm all talk -- it doesn't stop me from stuffing my face.

In fact, I stuffed my face last night with some freakin' yummy tofu and veggie soup in clear broth with flat rice noodles, after a killer workout. Mmm...

Yes, for the record, I DO eat there at decent hours, when I'm not wasted. I am a very, very loyal subject. Do not doubt my loyalty.
author: Lisa T.

description:
Reading Teri C.'s review of King of Thai Noodles reminded me: Yikes! I forgot to write my review! I just ate at the Clement one recently! Thanks Teri! 

Ok, I always order #17(flat rice noodles, veggies, basil, peppers) with tofu. ALWAYS. I add some tiny jalapeno peppers to it. Start eating. Start sweating. LOVE IT....

Fast service. Cash only. Two orders for my husband and I, less than $15! Now THIS is recession food! :D
author: Caroline C.

description:
Service is fast...food comes fast, I was here to pick up some to-go and I left like 5 min after ordering. and this place is only 5 min away. By the time I got there, the food was already waiting for me! yay~~

Ive never sat down to eat here but it seems a bit cramped.

supposed to be first King of Thai..gotta be good for something~
author: phillip w.

description:
I somehow am able to drunk dial King of Thai Noodle to coherently order my favorite, Duck Over Rice, on the 38-Geary every time I get sloshed at the last few downtown DYLs and effectively walk over to Clement to do the cash exchange before finally stumbling home to stuff my face.

If that isn't dedication to this place, I don't know what is!
author: Faffy L.

description:
There are a few main reasons why I like this place: Pad Kee Mao, Som Tom, and Pumpkin Curry.   Actually, I haven't tried much else because these dishes hit the mark every time.  Prices are reasonable and food is served up pretty quick.  They're open late, but unfortunately they aren't always up for a delivery.   Unlike some, I actually prefer this location to the one with the larger dining area just down the street, the open-kitchen atmosphere is pretty cool.  

Oh, and let's not forget Thai Iced Tea.  :-)
author: Megan J.

description:
This is where it began.

I mean, if you want to get technical on me, the successful noodle soup chain began with the first replication, King of Thai II, three blocks uptown.

But this is the first, a hole in the wall with no concept, no sense, just delicious noodles fried or in broth, cooked quick and cheap for student geeks, cops, kids like us back in residential parts after a night of hip hop and pool and sweaty expectations.

You're not getting special little treasures, deep fried foods, appetizers you want to pet like a baby sea otter.  Food here is big sloppy portions, hearty, comforting, slurpy-good.

Later, some genius -- the family's evil older brother? -- decided pale green and pastel purple are a good color combination, and decorated subsequent restaurants and uniforms with that not-so-subtle reminder that noodle joint owners are not known for design sense.  But here at the source, design is whatever it takes to cook a bowl of noodles.

Sadly, this location closes early now, so if you want beautiful smudged makeup girls in tight dresses and broken heels clutching tiny designer bags eating pig intestines, you'll have to go elsewhere.
author: Gil S.

description:
Eat in or take out either way they won't do you wrong.  I do suggest eating here if you like hot sauce or jalapenos.  I swear every asian restaurant I go into I end up eating either all the jalapenos or hot sauce.   What can I say I like it spicy.  I usually order the same things everytime I come...sometimes I may even rotate it...but someway somehow....its te usual.

Guray Tiew Ruer Ruam noodles with sliced beef, beef stew, beef balls, spinach or morning glory (seasonal), and bean sprouts in spicy beef soup-I love this one with the garlic hot sauce and jalapenos in it. 

Rad Nar thai style gravy sauce with your choice and chinese broccoli, and served over stir fried flat rice noodles -saucy....good.

Pad Kee Mao stir fried dal rice noodles and your choice with green long bean, bell pepper, thai chili and basil-I almost always get this one...I would love it if it was spicier.

Tod Mun(4 Pieces) marinated fish cakes with thai curry pasta and chopped green long bean, deep fried and served with peanuts sprinlded sweat and sour cucumber sauce.-another favorite of mine.

Roast duck with thai fried rice-this is my son's favorite and he will order it each and everytime.

Another plus they open late night...so there is a decent place to get food..
author: Allison T.

description:
Not the best Thai food but still pretty good & the price makes my wallet happy. Noodle, rice or soup? We always struggle to choose so we usually order all - tam yum soup, pad thai & Panang curry. Still cheap =)

Fast service, fairly clean, small place but they even have high chairs for babies. Appetizers are the same price as the main dish so we skip appetizers.
author: Sunny K.

description:
Late night Thai food on the go at its best.  The Pad Thai is pretty good.

About to try a more meat heavy plate next time I hit this place up.
author: Chris T.

description:
I've only been to King of Thai twice (I've been living under a rock, okay?), but so far, everything I've tried here has been HELLAAAAAAAAAAAA GOOOOOOOOD.

Pad Thai? HELLLLLAAAAA GOOOOOOOOOD.
Kao Gra Prow? HELLLLLAAAAA GOOOOOOOOOD.

Gained three pounds from eating all that? NOOOOTTTTT GOOOOOD.
author: Jennifer L.

description: I can't believe I never put my two cents about DUCK FRIED RICE! This is a dish I travel all the way to San Francisco to eat.  I would pay the premium to have it delivered to work everyday if it was possible. There's no other way to describe this dish other than it's perfect. They have the complex flavor of  duck meat, duck fat, duck juice, duck flavor to a science. I literally savor every morsel of every grain of rice in this dish. Served hot, cold, in a bowl, on a plate, without a plate, chop stick, no spoon, heck i'll eat it with my bare hands if necessary. Yum....
author: My T.

description:
I used to have a Thai girlfriend, so I do have certain experience/knowledge about Thai crusine as general.

King of Thai noodle house lives up to its name, their Duck Noodle soup is amoung the best in the city, and they also open past mid night everyday, so what is to complain?

I've tried most of their rice dishes and only the Fried Rice with Green Onion've caught my attention.  The chicken/beef are usually a bit dry but the flavor of the rice is strong and tasty.

Overall, there is sure reason behind the success of King of Thai, (about 4 + prosperous locations already in the city, 2 locations in Clement st are within 2 blocks of each other! )  They are good, and I wish we have something remotely similiar here in San Mateo!
author: Wei H.

description:
If you are near Clement with hunger pains, consider KoT.  If you ON Clement and seeking Thai, you are crazy not to stop in.  Walk-in orders get turned in about 15 minutes and you can watch them cook it up in front of you.

Big winners are Tom Yun Gai, pineapple fried rice and any of their curries.

I'm not a big fan of the dining room area, it needs a bit of love.

I live 3 blocks away so it makes for a perfect walk home meal or taken to mtn lake park.
author: Dave E.

description: I live in the neighborhood and have been here a few times.  It isn't bad but I found it to be very mediocre.  The Tom Ka Gai is not very flavorful at all and everything else I had was just okay.
author: Susanne R.

description:
A step above King of Thai #2 just down the street. Excellent pineapple fried rice, pad kee mao, and pad see ew.

You can see the whole kitchen while you wait for take-out, so you know it's well-kept.
author: Michael H.

description:
For years, I always thought this place was meh at best but for some reason the quality of the food started to improve and I started to really enjoy eating here instead of whining "Ugh, can we go somewhere else? Just because it's so close to the house doesn't mean that we always have to go here!"

I look forward to eating here often times I'm not at school in santa cruz because I like ordering their tom kha soup with tofu. The broth is decently creamy and tangy and lately they've been making it spicy everytime I ask for it. Their papaya salad is crunchy and has a right blend of fish sauce and tanginess. The pumpkin curry is good, the duck fried rice, the flat noodles...everything I order here is pretty good and they're pretty fast with the food, dining in or ordering to go. One of the good things about this place is that they're open until 1am, I think.
author: kristin e.

description:
This is a complete hole in the wall that just feeds your Thai addiction.  

One dish that I will never ever get sick of...their special #31 Duck Fried Rice.  Dude, it's $8 bucks, you get duck, thai flavor and a huge portion for two.  

I'm in love with this place cuz I am always full and my bill is never over $30.  Enough said...right?
author: Alice H.

description:
All I have to say is stewed duck leg noodle soup. SO GOOD! I'm don't even like duck usually! But the meat falls off the bone and the herbed broth is perfect if your sick or it's raining. And since I live 2 blocks away, I always call in my order and walk to pick it up. 

The other dishes arent bad either. The green curry is good, but sometimes the veggies they use are tough. Oh and the crab fried rice is the shiznit. And I don't usually like fried rice, either! 

Overall, good for cheap, fast, late night Thai food.
author: Jenny C.

description:
I was first brought to this place by a good Thai friend of mine in college, way back in 1995, and have been visiting ever since. The quality of the excellent Thai food has remained consistent in this location (unlike some of their other branches around the city).
My favorites are the No.17 Flat rice Noodles with ground chicken...yum! And they make one of the best Larb Chicken salads I've had in this city.
author: KebabKing ..

description: It feels dirty, which is unfortunate, but the duck noodle soup is a hidden treasure.  The soup broth is super ducky and delicious, the duck meat is tender and plentiful, and the gai lan is a great addition.  We ordered it with thick rice noodles last time but will probably give the thin rice noodles a go the next time around.  The bowl is pretty large so I recommend splitting it and another dish with a friend.  The duck fried rice was tasty as well but I may try a different dish next time for more variety.
author: Krystle S.

description:
Good Thai food - duck in red curry and pad see ew
Bad atmosphere - small, cafeteria-ish but cute posters
Bad/Slow service.
Inexpensive.
author: Jessica L.

description: Every so often I have a craving for this place.  Skinny Vermicelli noodle sliced beef soup is my favorite.  Also location on O'Farrell & Powell is great too.
author: Chris R.

description:
I've never had bad food here. Decently priced and super yummy... and open late to boot!

Now to try the cuisine out whilst I'm schnokered. The true test of late night eats.
author: Jenn H.

description:
King of Thai Noodle house has a rather lofty title, is it really the king of Thai Noodle house's? Or is the owner the King of this (and the ones he owns) Thai Noodle House? 

 Either way its tasty and cheap! I love their Red Curry with roasted duck, as well as their  Yellow Tofu Curry. I don't know as to the quality of their Pad Thai for I am not a fan in general but a good place for Thai food with out breaking the bank.
author: Tony M.

description: I used to go here a lot of time with friends. I really like their fried rice with the chinese sauage. Also their pad thai is pretty good. Though, I wish their portion would be a little bigger
author: Aniko N.

description:
Out of all the King of Thais thrown around SF, this is my fave location.  The others' food just don't have that something something the Clement location does.

They don't skimp on the portions, are open late, and are quick to cook when calling in an order.

I always stick to my usual greenbean/tofu plate but have been adventurous to try the chicken dishes.  I tend to worry when chicken is minced (what part of the chicken is this again?) but the flavor was good enough.

All in all, King of Thai is worth venturing out to the Inner Richmond.  It remains the "our place" of a relationship I had ... good times even if it involved the cops.
author: Diego S.

description:
If you want some awesome noodles, just say:  "Number 14."  Or "Number 15."  Or "Number 17."  This place hits the spot!

We used to get carry-out from here every weekend when my husband used to live in the Richmond.  Just had lunch here recently and nothing has really changed except that  they replaced their old t.v. with a flat screen.

Portions are generous and they know what they're doing with their spices!  If you eat in, you can even jazz up your dish with more things from their well-stocked "add-ons"  jars.  I almost always go with one of the aforementioned noodle dishes, but the last time I was there, I went for the Pumpkin Curry.  It was pretty good, but I think I'll stick to the noodles.  It's just tradition.

Receipts are written in Thai, so if you're going to expense your lunch, be ready to do some explaining back at the office.

Don't be afraid of the bathroom.  It looked sketchy from the outside but really wasn't that bad on the inside.  Just remember to lock the door!
author: Adrienne P.

description:
We always come to Clement to get some dim sum and steam pork bun. Since we go to King of Thai on Taraval, we thought we should try this place and see which one is better.

To our surprise, the food here was way better than we expected!
I'm not fan of ducks, but we ordered their duck soup and it was delicious and exceeded my expectations.
I can;t wait to come back.

Their papaya salad was good as well.
author: MC C.

description:
So we read good things about this place and decided to check it out..I'm glad we did!

This place is a hole in the wall Thai place is the absolutely DELISH!

We ordered the Fried Chicken over Fried Rice, Chicken Red Curry, Vegetable Fried Rice and Stir Fried Eggplant.  Everything was excellent! The servings are big! We actually had some left over fried rice...we just over ordered.

We go to Thai Time which is around the corner and this place is slightly better in flavor and the amount of food for the money.

It's a very small place...you walk in and they are cooking right there...people are ordering in the hall way. You basically go in the back and find a spot to sit down. The place holds no more than 25 people at a time.

Stick with the Original King of Thai Noodle House!

We will be back!!!!
author: Daddy F.

description:
mmmmm. mmm. mmm. mmmm. 

Can we talk?  Okay, right now I'd like to tell you a story, okay?  But in order for me to tell you this story, you must... you just MUST use your imagination. Ok, ladies?

Okay, first.  Imagine.  That the tacos from Oakland taco trucks is like the finest man you have EVER seen in your life!  OOOHHH!  Is he FINE, or WHAT?!  But he's MINE.  And I LOVE him.  

But on my way to rehearsal.... I came upon King of Thai Noodle and I had the roasted duck fried rice... which is like THIS man.... OOHHH WEEEE!  And girlfriend, let me tell you, he was finer than my man was!  

So... I wanted to mess around with him a little bit but.... I couldn't leave my man, could I?!?!?!

So.... in order to have my cake and eat it too.... I had to keep my roasted duck fried rice... a secret.

Do we have any secret lovers in the house tonight?   

This. is. for. you.

mmm. mmm.mm.

Here we are.... the two of us together..... taking this ... crazy chance to be alone....

i used to have an aversion for hecka fatty roast duck.... but it is all nicely chopped and well incorporated into this dish (along with scallions, eggs, tomatoes, etc.) that I don't even feel gross eating an entire plate of this dish!

I think about you and douse you with jalapeno infused vinegar.  hope that you're okay... hopin' you'll call before anyone gets home... I wait anxiously alone by the phone....

I know I shouldn't be eating you..... but the vinegar definitely helps  cut the sensation of grease on my lips.  

And in the middle of eating you, I notice the time.... I get nervous 'cause it's way after nine.... even though I hate eating hecka late, I know I couldn't just leave a morsel of you go.  I gotta be careful... so that no one would know that I derive as much enjoyment and satisfakshun from eating you as I do my man.

oh roasted duck fried rice... sometimes I feel guilty when we have our occasional trysts.... we gotta be careful so that no one will know....


so real.... so real..... so real.... so real.

(  |  )
author: Grace M.

description:
- deco:  hole in the wall
- price:  not as inexpensive as I initially thought it would be. 
- food: 

- pork chop with chicken wings over rice (+fried egg rolls)  $7.95, I think next time I will order only the pork chop  version (it comes with 2 pieces instead of 1 piece of pork chop)

- tom yum shrimp noodle soup - $7.95 - pretty good, small quantity though. 

I will probably drop by if I am in the area next time, but will not make a trip just for it.
author: Winifred X.

description:
Great place for Tom Yum Gai.

it's definitely a hole in the wall and the bathroom  can be literally an arms lenght away if you're sitting @ the back.

YUMMMY YUMMMY!
author: Emily L.

description:
I ate here yesterday for a late lunch and it has raised my interest in curry for the better. I ordered the Roast Duck with Red Curry which had bell peppers, cherry tomatoes, pineapple and bamboo shoots... guuuhhh sensory overload. When i was a young lad of 11 my mom tried to make Thai style chicken and curry and it made my eye's tear up as my throat quivered. Ever since than i have always been weary about Asian style curry and coconut. sorry Mom.

the place is extremely small but the upside to that is the service is a lot quicker than the other King of Thai's.
author: Jordan A.

description:
I'm surprised this was actually my first time going here.  I've heard a lot about it, but have never actually had a chance to stop by.

I went there for a afternoon lunch with my boyfriend.  The place seemed extremely quiet, even though there were people there.  Either no one was talking, or They just were not talking loud.  Which made me wonder. 

Anyways, the food was delicious, I ordered the Pat King Meo, which I would say looked like chow fun.

quite a strange atmosphere, but nevertheless still good food and great service!    5 stars in my book

(oh I also heard there's some sort of "secret" menu for services) not sure what that's all about. Nor do I want to know! :)
author: Laurie H.

description: I only had the pad thai here but it wasn't bad at all. The service was pretty good and the portion size is pretty decent. Lets just say you won't be going home hungry!
author: Eunice S.

description: #50 is the best especially after a club! :)
author: Carol Y.

description: I prefer the location between 8Th and 9Th ave and Clement, but when I don't feel like walking as far I'll eat here and it's still pretty good, but there's just something about the way they make the Pad See Ew at the other one. Plus this location is a lot more crowded and I don't particularly like the new purple decor that much.
author: Petra S.

description: How could you deny it's lavender radiance? ... King of Thai is the place I go to when I'm either a) hungover, b) have a death cold, or c) starving for huge gluttonous portions that will send me directly into outer space. I always have a hard time just picking one. Among my favorites: a number twenty-one (choice of meat with basil and spices over a mountain of rice, and I get it with a fried egg on top), a seventeen (flat rice noodles sauteed with green beans, Thai chili, and basil and choice of meat), a forty-three (deep fried boneless chicken on fried rice with wondrous sweet and sticky sauce), an eleven (choice of noodle with roast pork and yao choy vegetables in a clear chicken broth). The service is decent and the chefs are quick.
author: Natasha P.

description:
Drunk sustenance.
Beef noodle soup.
Pad Thai.

AAAHHH!!  Peanuts!!  Take 'em out!  Ack!!....Phew...thanks. 

Maybe I couldn't taste the Pad Thai cuz I was five vodka soda's down the gullet.
author: Jay H.

description:
Man, I wish there were more places like this in LA - great food, huge portions, reasonable prices and late hours! Here's a rundown of the stuff our party (10 people!) ordered:

Tofu Tod Appetizer = Usually with appetizers, you expect anywhere from 6 - 10 pieces of whatever it is you ordered. In this instance, we got about 16-20 pieces of tofu and a very generous helping of peanut sauce! Ono!

Pad Kee Mow (ordered both beef & chicken) = Great flavor and HUGE portions! Both versions were quite tasty and each helping was enough to share with 3 people!

Prik King Beef = This is one of our favorite Thai dishes, when it's done well. There are a limited number of ingredients in this dish, so the sauce/flavoring makes this dish. King of Thai's version was excellent, with a generous helping of beef, surrounded by tons of fresh green beans and some other veggies. 

Green Curry (chicken) = I LOVE green curry - it's my favorite of all the Thai curries. King of Thai's was quite flavorful, with just enough coconut milk - not too much, which can be somewhat overwhelming. 

Red Curry (chicken) = Not usually my favorite type of curry, but still really good. Good flavor, generous amounts of ingredients...and a good price. 

I know we had a few other dishes, but I can't remember what they were. :) 

5 shakas...Grinds! :)
author: Dawn S.

description:
The food here is just ok.  I have definitely had much better, but I will get King of Thai late night, when there really aren't many other options.  The best item I have ordered is the Kao Pad with veggies and tofu.  Everytime I order it with meat the pork and beef were too fatty and the chicken is always dry.  

P.S.  They only take CASH.
author: Violet S.

description:
Growing up in Thailand, there are times I really miss my fix of comfort food. Thats when I go to King of Thai for my fix of thai noodle soup. This isn't the typical thai restaurant where you order Americanize Thai food. Here, you can order traditional Thai noodle soups that people typically eat on the streets of Thailand. 
If you're willing to go out of your typical Thai food bounds, may I suggest the Boat noodles (Kew teuw leur), Yen ta fo or the Larb. These are my favorite dishes and makes me feel I'm in Thailand again.
author: Danvin R.

description:
I used to live across the street from this place. That was the mid 90's before there was a Thai joint on every corner in SF.

At the time I really didn't like it, but I've come to appreciate dumps like this. 
The dudes working the woks are friendly, the food is fine- really spicy if you like. 

And to all the haters that say Thai food has too much sugar in it, I got a hint for you: ask them not to put any in, tell them you want it they way they eat it at home. 

Thai food ain't so sweet, but it is oh so delicious!
author: Jason R.

description:
I come here sometimes when it's like 11PM and I worked super late and I need something quick.  Definitely hits the spot.  

Plenty of parking at night.  cash only.
author: Dong T.

description:
This place has saved me on countless late nights! The staff is friendly and the food is cooked fresh at the counter right where you can watch.
They have a good vegetarian selection, too.
The curries are especially tasty, as is the decor... Sometimes there is really weird stuff on the TV!
author: Rachel M.

description: I had pad Thai cashew chicken w/brown rice and pumpkin curry it was very awesome. The food was vet
author: Jamal W.

description:
Everything I have tried here has been really good, really quick and really cheap. 
The menu is huge however, and I have only had a few of the dishes, so I am a little hesitant to bestow the five stars. If I have anything I don't like I promise to edit this review! 
I recommend the green papaya salad to start, Thai iced tea to drink and the pineapple fried rice or the pad Thai as an entree. 
Service here is very friendly and quick. One slight drawback is that if your party orders very different types of food the plates may come at different times. I don't consider this to be that big of a deal and I think it comes from the fact that the food is being prepared fresh. 
There are four types of chili on the table (jalapeno whole, jalapeno ground, dried red and ground red) though I recommend trying your plate before adding anything as many of the dishes are served spicy.
author: Tiffany S.

description:
Did they just prepare my pad thai in 3 minutes?

Why YES, they did!!!

Fast, cheap, good. Totally hit the spot when I had a mad Thai craving. I kind of wimped out, getting pad thai - I really wanted to try one of their more interesting and adventurous entrees - but it's a good standby, and one I use to judge the overall quality of a thai restaurant. King of Thai did not disappoint! Nice, cheap, FAST lunch or dinner option on Clement.
author: Beth T.

description:
Cheap good Thai food.
This is the original of the series and thus all of the regulars swear the food tastes better here.
Basically this is a hole in the wall joint which serves up decent food at cheap prices ($5-7 for an entre.) In other words how can you go wrong?
author: Greg J.

description:
YES YES YESSSSS
god I love this place, if it wasn't illegal to marry restaurants, I'd be the first one! let me list why everyone should eat here:
1. papaya salad
2. open till 2:30AM DAILY
3. sauteed eggplant/roasted duck
4. their clothes matches their walls
5. cheap
6. papaya salad

and those people who said slow service, bad service, anything negative about this place...well...

...

you're entitled to your own opinion

which by the way, bring cash, which isn't too bad because if you're with SHAMU then they got an ATM down the block...very convenient, god I love this place.
author: Kevin C.

description:
I keep coming back because the food is fresh, tasty and fast. Don't expect fine dining but do expect great Thai food.

Usually I get the beef noodle soup, but last night I got something else (don't remember the Thai name). It was mixture of ground chicken, shrimp, carrots, mushrooms, onions with silver noodles. Yum! Large plate for $7.95. I asked for hot tea and it was free.

I counted 1 waiter/waitress for every 3 patrons last night at 8pm.  They were all chatting loudly in Thai among themselves but the speedy service made up for it. The place is kept very clean.

Walk to Green Apple Books afterwards, great new/used books, dvds, and more!!
author: Bill B.

description:
King of Thai is the only King of Thai, all the other Kings of Thai are pretenders. Don't go anywhere else but King of Thai 1. If it's not a shotgun storefront with eight tables and cash only, with the cooks working like mad dishing up amazing heaps of delicious food at lightning speed, then it's not King Of Thai.

Red Curry, green curry, yellow curry yum! Pad Thai is great. 

No booze and cash only are the only things that detract from the experience.
author: Laura w.

description:
The service sucks.  The wait staff are rude and inattentive. 

I'm a reasonable girl.  I can tolerate bad service if my taste buds are placated.  Unfortunately, King of Thai fails in both regards.  Of all the Thai places I've tried in this city, this particular King of Thai was the worst.

I'm trying to think of a reason why they deserve a star.  Uh, nice logo?
author: Teresa K.

description:
My friend ordered take-out for us, from King of Thai on a recent rainy day and it really hit the spot!  

We started off with the SATAY GAI- chicken breast on skewers.  I am not a huge fan of breast skewers...I think they are so much tastier as dark meat.  The peanut sauce, however, was AWESOME and I ended up licking the container that it came in.

The special fried rice- KAO PAD SAPPAROS, was amazing good...(And please, fried rice is not always "just fried rice". )  This one is packed with pineapple, chicken, shrimps white onion and cashew nuts...and the rice is a yellow.

This is a link to their online menu:  http://sanfrancisco.menupages.com/screenmenu.asp?restaurantId=7717&htmllink=B0DA809AB28A1D095E107861167CCD486F7A053F0D9FEF12FEC5851FD0904AD0FC242AC3E3734FF1&taglineid=0
author: Judy K.

description: Meh, I honestly have experienced better.The soup wasnt that great neither the fried rice..The only thing I liked chicken satay appetizer.The soup didnt taste like it had much broth...too much water and also the penut sauce.Bleh Not the best.
author: Cinderella S.
